30.dialogue: Another one!? Wh-what’s going on?!

40.speaker: speaker_woman
40.dialogue: That thing is gigantic! It’s way bigger than the monsters from before!

50.speaker: speaker_unknown
50.dialogue: Gyooooohhnnnnnn!

60.speaker: speaker_man
60.dialogue: R-run!! Run for your lives!

70.speaker: speaker_morgana
70.dialogue: See? Look at that. The darkness isn’t so bad.

80.speaker: speaker_morgana
80.dialogue: I think it’s rather beautiful… and the operatic singing voice was a nice touch. Don’t you agree, Herald?

90.speaker: speaker_dark_herald
90.dialogue: Gyooooohhnnnnnn!

100.speaker: speaker_akali
100.dialogue: Whatever. I don’t care if you kill anyone, I just don’t want to see them die.

110.speaker: speaker_morgana
110.dialogue: No? Well, you’ll develop a taste for it eventually. This promises to be quite the show.

120.speaker: speaker_morgana
120.dialogue: Do your best, Herald. I await as much death and destruction as you’re able to handle.

140.speaker: speaker_akali
140.dialogue: Be safe, Kai… Just hold on a little longer…

150.speaker: speaker_dark_herald
150.dialogue: Gyoooooohhhnnnnn!

160.speaker: speaker_ekko
160.dialogue: Okay, now we’re fighting evil space kaiju? What is going on, Kai?!

170.speaker: speaker_sona
170.dialogue: [“If we don’t stop it soon, that creature will reach downtown! All those people...!”]

180.speaker: speaker_kaisa
180.dialogue: I’m trying to think of something… It’s so big… If only we had someone who loves fighting giant monsters…

190.speaker: speaker_nilah
190.dialogue: Aha! A Dark Herald! I haven’t seen one of these in a hundred years!

200.speaker: speaker_nilah
200.dialogue: Worthy enemy, face me in storied battle! Find your joy in the heart of combat, and our legend will dance through time immemorial!

210.speaker: speaker_ekko
210.dialogue: Okay, I like her a lot.

220.speaker: speaker_sona
220.dialogue: [“She’s fun and strong! Feels like she’d fit right in!”]

230.speaker: speaker_nilah
230.dialogue: Kai’Sa. Do you have a plan? As my acting captain, I defer to you.

240.speaker: speaker_kaisa
240.dialogue: Me?! Aren’t you an Outer Guardian?

250.speaker: speaker_nilah
250.dialogue: I am. But I’m supposed to be teaching you, not doing your job.

260.speaker: speaker_nilah
260.dialogue: If I slay this beast for you, what will you learn? Morgana is far more powerful and represents a much greater threat.

270.speaker: speaker_nilah
270.dialogue: The deaths of any inexperienced guardians will be firmly on my hands. It would take me twenty… thirty… maybe fifty years to get over the guilt.

280.speaker: speaker_kaisa
280.dialogue: I’m so glad you care.

300.speaker: speaker_ekko
300.dialogue: Hi? Everyone? Giant monster?!

310.speaker: speaker_dark_herald
310.dialogue: GYOOOOHHHHHHNNNN!

320.speaker: speaker_kaisa

response.dialogue: Ekko, take Sona and Tali. Sweep the streets of any smaller creatures.
Nilah, you’re with me. Rell and Quinn are backing us up.
…Has anyone seen Akali?!

320.dialogue: Hmm. It’s almost here.

330a_10.speaker: speaker_ekko
330a_10.dialogue: Got it, Captain. Can we pick a cool team name?

330a_20.speaker: speaker_sona
330a_20.dialogue: [“Later! More of those little monsters are swarming all around the giant one!”]

330a_30.speaker: speaker_taliyah
330a_30.dialogue: I love fighting those little guys. Put me in, Coach! Chu chu!

330a_40.speaker: speaker_ekko
330a_40.dialogue: Right, right, next time! Sona. Tali. Let’s roll.

330b_20.speaker: speaker_ekko
330b_20.dialogue: Oh! Oh, no! Is that your game face?!

330b_30.speaker: speaker_nilah
330b_30.dialogue: What? I’m trying something new. Go fight those smaller monsters, and I’ll practice my “game face” later.

330c_10.speaker: speaker_nilah
330c_10.dialogue: Curious. I do not feel her presence anywhere.

330c_20.speaker: speaker_ekko
330c_20.dialogue: I have a really bad feeling about this, Captain…

330c_30.speaker: speaker_sona
330c_30.dialogue: [“We can figure it out later! Right now, there are people to save!”]

340.speaker: speaker_taliyah
340.dialogue: H-hey! Ekko, Sona, wait up! I wanna punch some stuff, too!

350.speaker: speaker_quinn
350.dialogue: You’ve been spending way too much time with Taliyah.

360.speaker: speaker_rell
360.dialogue: So now team bonding is a bad thing?

370.speaker: speaker_rell
370.dialogue: I thought I was making good progress, thank you very much!

380.speaker: speaker_kaisa
380.dialogue: Thanks for coming, you two. The more guardians we have on our side, the more people we can save.

390.speaker: speaker_rell
390.dialogue: And we’d better save ‘em fast. Look at the size of that thing! Sebastien and I are ready to charge that monster like Don Quixote.

400.speaker: speaker_nilah
400.dialogue: Ah, a fellow enjoyer of the classics!

410.speaker: speaker_rell
410.dialogue: Mecha Don Quixote uses a lance of meteor metal stolen from the Zalbaxian Empire...!

420.speaker: speaker_quinn
420.dialogue: Oh my God.

430.speaker: speaker_kaisa
430.dialogue: Focus up, team. This is the biggest monster we’ve ever faced, and the safety of the city is in our hands.

440.speaker: speaker_kaisa
440.dialogue: Nilah, can you cut us a path through the Herald’s attacks? If we can reach that lady on its head, we can win this, but those claws are massive, and there are a lot of them.

450.speaker: speaker_nilah
450.dialogue: Without question. They will sing of my skill for all of time.

460.speaker: speaker_kaisa
460.dialogue: Glad to hear it.

470.speaker: speaker_kaisa
470.dialogue: Rell… when we’re through, charge into the Herald’s center of mass. Hit it as hard as you can, as many times as you can.

480.speaker: speaker_rell
480.dialogue: Now we’re talkin’! GYOOOHHHHN!

490.speaker: speaker_kaisa
490.dialogue: Oh, that’s… erm… okay. Happy about the enthusiasm.

500.speaker: speaker_rell
500.dialogue: Uh… this isn’t your favorite part of the job?

510.speaker: speaker_quinn
510.dialogue: Charging in headfirst isn’t everyone’s style, y’know…

520.speaker: speaker_rell
520.dialogue: It’s only the BEST one!

530.speaker: speaker_kaisa
530.dialogue: Quinn, you and Valor stick to me. Once Rell stuns the Herald, you and I are going in for the kill.

540.speaker: speaker_quinn
540.dialogue: Our eyes are yours, Captain.

550.speaker: speaker_kaisa
550.dialogue: Get ready, team. It’s just us this time… so let's prove those other victories weren’t flukes!

560.speaker: speaker_nilah
560.dialogue: There were other victories?

570.speaker: speaker_quinn
570.dialogue: I don’t think we were here for those.

580.speaker: speaker_kaisa
580.dialogue: Just fight!

590.speaker: speaker_dark_herald
590.dialogue: GYOOOOOOHHNNNNNNN!

600.speaker: speaker_nilah
600.dialogue: Seize the bliss in your heart, and face me!

610.speaker: speaker_rell
610.dialogue: Now it’s my turn, loser. Bad luck!

620.speaker: speaker_quinn
620.dialogue: The head is exposed! Valor, to me!

630.speaker: speaker_kaisa
630.dialogue: I don’t know where you came from, but this is our city! The Star Guardians will never back down!

640.speaker: speaker_dark_herald
640.dialogue: Gyoooooooohnnnnn…!

660.speaker: speaker_morgana
660.dialogue: Hmph. Your stupid little friends are stronger than I anticipated.

670.speaker: speaker_morgana
670.dialogue: It doesn’t matter. The darkness unleashed by the Herald is more than enough…

680.speaker: speaker_morgana
680.dialogue: Yes… Such power… This is what it must have felt like when Zoe became the Twilight Star!

690.speaker: speaker_morgana
690.dialogue: Mhmhmhahaha! Justice will die! Entropy will reign forever! And you, girl… You… will bear witness to the birth of a dark new age...!

700.speaker: speaker_morgana
700.dialogue: And age without light, without darkness… and without Star Guardians!

10.speaker: speaker_akali
10.dialogue: Mrph… gulp… urp… so good.

20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
20.dialogue: Slow down, Akali. Those noodles aren’t going anywhere.

30.speaker: speaker_akali
30.dialogue: Mrnch… ulp… Yeah they are. Into my… mrmph…. mouth.

40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
40.dialogue: You’re gonna get a stomachache. And we have training later—

50.speaker: speaker_akali
50.dialogue: And the award for best impression of my dad goes to…

60.speaker: speaker_kaisa
60.dialogue: I’m just trying to help.

70.speaker: speaker_akali
70.dialogue: Mrmph… slurp…. You know how you can help me?

80.speaker: speaker_kaisa
80.dialogue: Ugh, watching this is so gross. How?

90.speaker: speaker_akali
90.dialogue: Order me a refill. I’m running low.

100.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
100.dialogue: Nobody runs low on my watch.

120.speaker: speaker_akali
120.dialogue: See, someone knows when they’re wanted.

140.speaker: speaker_akali
140.dialogue: Mmrmph… slurp… mrnchh… Uh… Bill? Are you still there?

150.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
150.dialogue: Yeah.

170.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
170.dialogue: I couldn’t help but overhear…

180.speaker: speaker_akali
180.dialogue: Oh, c’mon! Not you, too!

190.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
190.dialogue: It’s okay. I’m not here to talk about you. I’ve got problems of my own.

200.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
200.dialogue: I’m sure it doesn’t compare to your little high-school adventures…

210.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
210.dialogue: But for me? This day was pretty memorable.

220.speaker: speaker_akali
220.dialogue: Are you going to tell the story, or can I finish eating this like a monster?

230.speaker: speaker_kaisa
230.dialogue: Ssshh!

240.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
240.dialogue: Every morning, I wake up early to make my broth.

250.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
250.dialogue: I like to read the paper while I let the flavors mix… But today, I felt like taking a walk.

260.speaker: speaker_akali
260.dialogue: Fascinating stuff, Bill.

270.speaker: speaker_kaisa
270.dialogue: Akali!

280.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
280.dialogue: Valoran City is peaceful in the early hours of the day. A special sort of quiet.

290.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
290.dialogue: I was enraptured by the smells of fresh bread warming in the oven…

300.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
300.dialogue: Of the light reflecting off tiny droplets of dew on freshly cut grass…

310.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
310.dialogue: Before I knew it, I had spent hours walking through our city, and I found myself in a place that I didn’t recognize…

320.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
320.dialogue: “Oh, no!” I thought. “I must get back to my broth! If it reaches a boil, my hard work—and the day’s profits—will be lost.”

330.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
330.dialogue: But I had been so swept up by beauty on my stroll, that I had not traced my steps. I rushed through the streets, and by sheer luck, I found my way back to my stand.

340.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
340.dialogue: My broth still simmered lightly. All was well.

350.speaker: speaker_kaisa
350.dialogue: Oh. That was… evocative.

360.speaker: speaker_akali
360.dialogue: Don’t lie to the man, Kai! Bill, what are you even saying? That was your most boring story yet!

370.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
370.dialogue: Gah hah! I appreciate your feedback, Akali.

380.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
380.dialogue: But I think perhaps you both missed the moral of my tale.

410.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
410.dialogue: Trust in your friends.

420.speaker: speaker_kaisa
420.dialogue: I’m… not sure I understand.

430.speaker: speaker_akali
430.dialogue: Isn’t it obvious, Kai’sa? Bill is saying the pork broth is his friend.

450.speaker: speaker_kaisa
450.dialogue: Wait—are you?

460.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
460.dialogue: Not quite. But friendship is like a good broth.

470.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
470.dialogue: You put in time. And effort. That’s the chicken feet. And love. The pig bones.

480.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
480.dialogue: And you must know that even when you aren’t there… the friendship will simmer on.

490.speaker: speaker_kaisa
490.dialogue: Love is like… boiling pig bones?

500.speaker: speaker_akali
500.dialogue: Well said, noodle man. Very wise. Love the part about the feet and bones.

510.speaker: speaker_kaisa
510.dialogue: You weren’t even listening. You were about to doze off with noodles still in your mouth! Again!

520.speaker: speaker_akali
520.dialogue: Sorry, I’m just exhausted from all our late nights training.

530.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill

response.dialogue: …Golf!
…Soccer?
…Baseball?!

530.dialogue: Training! My, my. What sport do you play?

540.speaker: speaker_akali
540.dialogue: Uh… Tennis?!?!

550.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
550.dialogue: …Tennis.

560.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
560.dialogue: Well, I’m sure you’re both very hard workers! At tennis. The game you both play.

570.speaker: speaker_kaisa
570.dialogue: W-we are!

580.speaker: speaker_akali
580.dialogue: …Alright, that’s it for me. Thanks for the noodles, Noodle Bill. Tasty as always.

590.speaker: speaker_akali
590.dialogue: Kai’sa, you got this one?

600.speaker: speaker_kaisa
600.dialogue: But you ordered three bowls…

610.speaker: speaker_akali
610.dialogue: Thanks so much!

620.speaker: speaker_kaisa
620.dialogue: ...Great. Gonna have to beg dad for more spending money.

630.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
630.dialogue: …You’re a good friend.

640.speaker: speaker_kaisa
640.dialogue: Not good enough.

660.speaker: speaker_kaisa
660.dialogue: I used to be a better friend, but lately…

670.speaker: speaker_kaisa
670.dialogue: Life’s just become so complicated.

680.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
680.dialogue: You want some more advice from a wise, old cook?

690.speaker: speaker_kaisa
690.dialogue: …Sure.

700.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill

response.dialogue: Thank you?
Well, that’s not very helpful.
…Maybe you should stick to making noodles.

700.dialogue: It never gets any easier.

710a_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
710a_20.dialogue: But couldn’t it? Get easier, I mean. If I figure out a plan of attack. Face my problems… head on…?

710a_30.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
710a_30.dialogue: You solve one problem, another takes its place.

710a_40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
710a_40.dialogue: Heh. Now you sound like Akali.

710b_10.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
710b_10.dialogue: Gah hah! I didn’t say it was helpful advice.

710b_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
710b_20.dialogue: But if life is so hard… then why do you seem so happy?

710b_30.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
710b_30.dialogue: I have good customers and great friends! Friends like my pork broth.

710c_20.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
710c_20.dialogue: But if we all did only what was comfortable, the future would be written in stone.

710c_30.speaker: speaker_kaisa
710c_30.dialogue: So... I’m just supposed to act impulsively?

720.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
720.dialogue: Trust in your friend. She trusts in you.

730.speaker: speaker_kaisa
730.dialogue: If that’s true, she doesn’t show it.

740.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
740.dialogue: That just means she needs you to trust in her even more. So sayeth Noodle Bill!

770.speaker: speaker_kaisa
770.dialogue: Oh… uh… Put it on our tab.

10.speaker: speaker_kaisa
10.dialogue: Akali?

20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
20.dialogue: Akali?

30.speaker: speaker_kaisa
30.dialogue: [She’s ten minutes late. I’m starting to think she isn’t going to show.]

40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
40.dialogue: [What did she want to talk about anyways?]

50.speaker: speaker_kaisa
50.dialogue: [Something so important that she’d call an “Emergency Star Guardian Meeting...”]

60.speaker: speaker_kaisa
60.dialogue: [And then not even bother to come?]

80.speaker: speaker_kaisa
80.dialogue: [Maybe I’m being too hard on her. Maybe she just forgot. Maybe…]

90.speaker: speaker_kaisa
90.dialogue: [No, she wouldn’t!]

100.speaker: speaker_kaisa
100.dialogue: [But just to be sure…]

120.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
120.dialogue: Oh, hello, Miss Kai’Sa! One bowl of miso coming up—

130.speaker: speaker_kaisa
130.dialogue: I’m not here to eat, Noodle Bill. I’m looking for Akali.

140.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
140.dialogue: Hhrm. That’s odd. She was right here.

150.speaker: speaker_kaisa
150.dialogue: Of course. She vanished, huh?

160.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
160.dialogue: Suppose so. Not sure what to do with this half-eaten bowl though...

170.speaker: speaker_akali
170.dialogue: Bill! Could I get a take-away thingy? I could chow down on this food all day.

180.speaker: speaker_akali
180.dialogue: Oh. Uh… Hey, Kai’Sa.

190.speaker: speaker_kaisa
190.dialogue: What are you doing here?

200.speaker: speaker_akali
200.dialogue: …Eating noodles? It’s Noodle Bill’s. Noodle is right there in the name.

210.speaker: speaker_kaisa
210.dialogue: You asked me to meet you in the park. You said it was an emergency.

220.speaker: speaker_akali
220.dialogue: Did I? That doesn’t sound like me.

230.speaker: speaker_kaisa
230.dialogue: Yeah, I guess you’re right. You’re more the “hide from your problems” type.

240.speaker: speaker_akali
240.dialogue: Hey, I have a particular set of skills. And, like, fifty different kinds of star knives.

250.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
250.dialogue: One bowl to go—

260.speaker: speaker_kaisa
260.dialogue: I don’t get you, Akali.

270.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
270.dialogue: —Oh look, my chicken feet are running away. Better go catch them.

280.speaker: speaker_akali
280.dialogue: Not much to get. I sleep, I study, I eat ramen…

290.speaker: speaker_akali
290.dialogue: I fight the forces of darkness…

300.speaker: speaker_kaisa
300.dialogue: And you do it all without a care in the world.

310.speaker: speaker_akali
310.dialogue: Oh, I care. I care a lot.

320.speaker: speaker_kaisa
320.dialogue: You constantly miss training, you fall asleep in class, you spend all your free time here—

330.speaker: speaker_kaisa
330.dialogue: So what is it that you care about?

350.speaker: speaker_akali
350.dialogue: Sorry I don’t care enough. Should I act more like you?

360.speaker: speaker_akali
360.dialogue: Should I follow my friends around like a little bunny, desperate for them to like me?

370.speaker: speaker_kaisa
370.dialogue: I’m trying to lead a team. These exercises are important.

380.speaker: speaker_akali
380.dialogue: I don’t think that’s it. I think you’re trying to lead Lux’s team. I think you’re trying to lead Ahri’s team.

390.speaker: speaker_akali
390.dialogue: But we can’t be them. I’m not Janna, or Poppy, or Soraka, or Sarah Fortune. I’m me. And you’re you. Our squad doesn't even have matching gem shapes!

400.speaker: speaker_akali
400.dialogue: You’re chasing someone else’s standards. And those guys aren’t here to pat you on the head and tell you what a good little Star Guardian you are.

410.speaker: speaker_akali
410.dialogue: We’re in high school. And there are things out there that want to kill us, whether you like it or not. We’re gonna lose someone, someday, and no amount of rules following can stop it.

430.speaker: speaker_akali

response.dialogue: Yeah. You really don’t pull your punches.
No. I mean—yes, but it was the good kind of real.
Is anything really real? …That’s what you sound like.

430.dialogue: Sorry, was that too real? I know how much you like never talking about this.

440a_20.speaker: speaker_akali
440a_20.dialogue: What’s the point of hitting if it doesn’t hurt?

440a_30.speaker: speaker_kaisa
440a_30.dialogue: Oh, I don’t know… You can spare your friend’s feelings?

440a_40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
440a_40.dialogue: Though I do prefer honesty over constantly deflecting with stupid jokes.

440b_20.speaker: speaker_akali
440b_20.dialogue: Definitely not a defense mechanism triggered by my best friend attacking me.

440b_30.speaker: speaker_kaisa
440b_30.dialogue: Ah… and now you’re back to deflecting with sarcasm and stupid jokes.

440c_10.speaker: speaker_akali
440c_10.dialogue: I do not sound like that.

440c_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
440c_20.dialogue: Yeah, I guess your nihilism usually falls on the more depressing, less philosophical side of the spectrum.

440c_30.speaker: speaker_akali
440c_30.dialogue: Sorry, what? My doesn’t-care-slacker brain is too small for your big, giant words.

440c_40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
440c_40.dialogue: Ah… and now you’re back to deflecting with sarcasm and stupid jokes.

450.speaker: speaker_akali
450.dialogue: My jokes are smart, though. College-graduate-level smart.

460.speaker: speaker_akali
460.dialogue: They go to medical school. Call me Nurse Akali, because I—

470.speaker: speaker_kaisa
470.dialogue: So what is it you wanted to talk about? How we’re all going to die?

480.speaker: speaker_akali
480.dialogue: …I mean, yeah, I guess?

490.speaker: speaker_akali
490.dialogue: You don’t acknowledge how scary this is. What we do every day.

510.speaker: speaker_akali
510.dialogue: It’s not the fighting. I signed up for the fighting.

520.speaker: speaker_akali
520.dialogue: It's...

530.speaker: speaker_akali
530.dialogue: I have this dream. Different than all the other ones.

540.speaker: speaker_akali
540.dialogue: I’m back at the Battle of the Twilight Star.

550.speaker: speaker_akali
550.dialogue: People are screaming out for help.

560.speaker: speaker_akali
560.dialogue: I reach for my weapon… but it’s not there.

570.speaker: speaker_akali
570.dialogue: I look down and realize I’m in my school uniform.

580.speaker: speaker_akali
580.dialogue: I’m not a guardian.

590.speaker: speaker_akali
590.dialogue: Suddenly, the screams fade away. I know they’re still there… but I can’t hear them.

600.speaker: speaker_akali
600.dialogue: I should feel bad. Horrible, even. But I don’t.

610.speaker: speaker_akali
610.dialogue: I feel… relief.

620.speaker: speaker_kaisa
620.dialogue: And then you wake up?

630.speaker: speaker_akali
630.dialogue: No, I hit the snooze button a couple more times.

640.speaker: speaker_kaisa
640.dialogue: Akali…

650.speaker: speaker_akali
650.dialogue: Have you ever thought about what it’s like to fall?

660.speaker: speaker_kaisa
660.dialogue: I—

670.speaker: speaker_akali
670.dialogue: It must be horrible. Right? That’s why we keep having those bad dreams, that’s why I keep hearing things…

680.speaker: speaker_akali
680.dialogue: To burn out… to become… something else. Or fade away entirely. Is that what Zoe was? A Star Guardian who fell? She seemed pretty happy about it.

690.speaker: speaker_akali
690.dialogue: I want to be a team player, Kai. But you never want to talk about that night. Or what the old guardians actually went through.

700.speaker: speaker_akali
700.dialogue: So… sometimes it’s easier for me to imagine what it’s like to fall…

710.speaker: speaker_akali
710.dialogue: …than it is for me to imagine doing… that… forever.

720.speaker: speaker_kaisa
720.dialogue: We’re still new at it. Even Lux struggled—

730.speaker: speaker_akali
730.dialogue: And Ahri made plenty of mistakes. We met two of them. Actually… did I see Xayah the other day? No, that can’t be right…

740.speaker: speaker_kaisa
740.dialogue: Exactly! We’re just like the old guardians!

750.speaker: speaker_akali
750.dialogue: …No, we’re not like the old guardians! Listen to what I’m saying!

760.speaker: speaker_kaisa
760.dialogue: I am listening! You don’t have to be like them!

800.speaker: speaker_akali
800.dialogue: Ah… hey, I’m being a total bummer. I should go home. Let’s forget we had this conversation, okay? No harm, no foul.

10.speaker: speaker_kaisa
10.dialogue: [Akali hasn’t talked to me since that last time we hung out…]

20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
20.dialogue: [I… didn’t handle that conversation well. If only Lux…]

30.speaker: speaker_kaisa
30.dialogue: [No. No! If only I knew the right thing to say to her.]

40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
40.dialogue: [But every time I try to get close… I only push her further away.]

50.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
50.dialogue: Sorry, we don’t open for a—

60.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
60.dialogue: Oh! Kai’Sa! I haven’t seen you in a while! I was starting to get a little worried!

70.speaker: speaker_kaisa
70.dialogue: Hey, Bill.

80.speaker: speaker_kaisa
80.dialogue: Don’t worry, I’m not here to eat. I thought maybe Akali would be here.

90.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
90.dialogue: Ah, my most frequent customer. I’m gonna be able to renovate my house thanks to that girl’s appetite, gyah hah!

100.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
100.dialogue: She’s already on her 32nd punch card for a free bowl every eight bowls.

120.speaker: speaker_kaisa
120.dialogue: It’s… oh, I know this…

130.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
130.dialogue: A lot of ramen.

140.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
140.dialogue: You know, she always finds a way to make me laugh. Your friend is very funny.

150.speaker: speaker_kaisa
150.dialogue: She talks with you?

160.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
160.dialogue: Oh, sometimes. Other times, she just eats in silence. Tends to be the case with all my customers.

170.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
170.dialogue: But she’ll make this funny face when she’s slurping noodles. Always cracks me up.

180.speaker: speaker_kaisa
180.dialogue: I know the one. So focused. Like if she lets a single noodle slip from her mouth…

190.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
190.dialogue: The world will end. Gyah hah!

200.speaker: speaker_kaisa
200.dialogue: What... what does she say? When you talk?

210.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
210.dialogue: Don’t worry. She doesn’t spill any of your exciting teenager secrets, whatever they are. Plays a lot of Hyper Crystal Something-or-Other on her phone.

220.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
220.dialogue: She talks a lot about the future. Or… hm… the lack of it. Not as uncommon as you’d think for someone her age. When you’re young, you don’t have much for reference.

230.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
230.dialogue: One bad thing becomes… the only thing, because there’s nothing else to compare it to. She’s real vague about whatever it is. Not that it’s any of my business.

250.speaker: speaker_kaisa
250.dialogue: When did I become a person she couldn’t talk to…?

260.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
260.dialogue: A traveler carrying five stones shares their weight with the empty-handed man.

270.speaker: speaker_kaisa
270.dialogue: Bill, you can’t keep doing this to me. I have no idea what you’re saying.

280.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
280.dialogue: Gyah hah hah! Teenagers! Your problems are so small, but you think the future of the universe is at stake!

300.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
300.dialogue: Of course! Akali mentioned you’re the leader of your—what was it—ah! Tennis team.

310.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
310.dialogue: Balancing that with school… can’t be easy. I never played tennis, but, you know. I assume.

320.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
320.dialogue: On the other hand, I am an old cook with an abundance of time.

330.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
330.dialogue: I am the empty-handed man. Her problems are the—

340.speaker: speaker_kaisa
340.dialogue: The stones. I get it. And I have my own stones?

350.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
350.dialogue: We all do.

360.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
360.dialogue: You just travel with her down that road. Carry your stones together, and I’m sure she’ll come around.

370.speaker: speaker_kaisa
370.dialogue: …Thanks for the weird-but-helpful metaphor. I will.

response.dialogue: Actually, I was just at Noodle Bill’s and…
Uh… No, I just happened to be walking by…
This is sort of where I hang out, so technically, you’re stalking me…

410.speaker: speaker_akali
410.dialogue: …I was joking.

420.speaker: speaker_kaisa
420.dialogue: Oh. Yeah. I know.

430.speaker: speaker_akali
430.dialogue: Seriously though, how’d you find me?

450.speaker: speaker_kaisa
450.dialogue: Also the guys at the arcade said you threw a skeeball so hard it broke the machine, then stormed off to “that stupid statue.”

460.speaker: speaker_akali
460.dialogue: Threw it overhand. Like in the major leagues.

480.speaker: speaker_akali
480.dialogue: So… what? Am I late for training or something?

490.speaker: speaker_kaisa
490.dialogue: Sorry, no, nothing like that. We… we don’t have to talk about Star Guardian stuff. If you don’t want to.

520.speaker: speaker_akali

response.dialogue: After all the world saving we’re gonna do? Definitely.
I don’t know. You have to be a pretty big hero to get a statue.
If they do, I hope it’s one where we shoot water out of our mouths.

520.dialogue: Though… Do you think they’ll make statues of us one day? You know… if we don’t all, uh, die horribly?

530a_10.speaker: speaker_akali
530a_10.dialogue: How can you be so sure?

530a_30.speaker: speaker_kaisa
530a_30.dialogue: But I know you wouldn’t be doing this if all you cared about was a statue.

530a_40.speaker: speaker_akali
530a_40.dialogue: Yeah, I’m more of a billboard person. Captures my image better.

530b_20.speaker: speaker_akali
530b_20.dialogue: It’s easier if we don’t try to live up to Lux’s standards.

530b_30.speaker: speaker_kaisa
530b_30.dialogue: Yeah, you were right. We can forge our own path.

530b_40.speaker: speaker_akali
530b_40.dialogue: I want to be the first Star Guardian with an instant noodle brand. So much sodium your heart explodes right there at the table.

530c_10.speaker: speaker_akali
530c_10.dialogue: Ooh, and at night, there’s a water show set to music.

530c_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
530c_20.dialogue: They can play our theme song! You know, the… burning one? Oh, no… I don’t know the theme song!

530c_30.speaker: speaker_akali
530c_30.dialogue: You?! You, little miss leader, don’t know Burning Bright?

530c_40.speaker: speaker_akali
530c_40.dialogue: This is an incredible day. Wow. I’m telling the entire squad. Nonnegotiable.

540.speaker: speaker_kaisa
540.dialogue: Ha ha ha!

550.speaker: speaker_kaisa
550.dialogue: Ahhh, whew.

560.speaker: speaker_kaisa
560.dialogue: You know, I’m scared of falling, too.

570.speaker: speaker_akali
570.dialogue: Really?

580.speaker: speaker_kaisa
580.dialogue: Of course. I think about the invasion all the time… Rakan died right in front of us… thousands of people lost their lives… and everyone just… moved on.

590.speaker: speaker_kaisa
590.dialogue: I wonder… is that what it’ll always be? Losing people we care about forever… until we lose each other? Ourselves? It doesn’t seem right. It doesn’t seem… fair.

600.speaker: speaker_kaisa
600.dialogue: And part of me wishes I could just go back to before. Before all that happened, before Zoe attacked, before we ever knew there was such a thing as Star Guardians.

610.speaker: speaker_kaisa
610.dialogue: When you and I would hang out at the arcade. Or listen to music in my bedroom.

620.speaker: speaker_akali
620.dialogue: Or make friendship bracelets?

630.speaker: speaker_kaisa
630.dialogue: Yeah… Man, they’re so janky. So embarrassing. If anyone tries to take mine, I’ll kill them.

640.speaker: speaker_kaisa
640.dialogue: Ha! Well… no matter what we do, that old life is gone now.

650.speaker: speaker_kaisa
650.dialogue: But the Kai’Sa from before? Your friend Kai’Sa? She’s not gone.

660.speaker: speaker_akali
660.dialogue: You’ve been talking to old Bill too much. Did he tell you about the five rocks made of problems or whatever?

670.speaker: speaker_kaisa
670.dialogue: The problem rocks! I still don’t know what he was talking about. Maybe I never will.

680.speaker: speaker_akali
680.dialogue: Yeah… You know, it’s kinda funny.

690.speaker: speaker_akali
690.dialogue: The danger we face every day. Our oath. The darkness.

700.speaker: speaker_kaisa
700.dialogue: You’re right, that is very funny.

710.speaker: speaker_akali
710.dialogue: Heh, shut up. It’s all so… overwhelming. And when I’m overwhelmed…

730.speaker: speaker_akali
730.dialogue: Yeah! A really stupid one. Like, I call a pigeon a sky goblin.

750.speaker: speaker_akali
750.dialogue: A sky goblin! Because they gobble treasure and tell riddles!

760.speaker: speaker_kaisa
760.dialogue: Ak.. ahaha.. Akali… what do you think a goblin is?

770.speaker: speaker_akali
770.dialogue: I know what a goblin is! Hey, stop laughing! You’re gonna make me… ahaha!

790.speaker: speaker_akali
790.dialogue: Ahhh, whew. Hey… whatever happens… let’s just try to be there for each other, okay? You did promise, after all.

810.speaker: speaker_akali
810.dialogue: Friends ‘til the end? Even if that end super turbo sucks?

820.speaker: speaker_kaisa
820.dialogue: You and me, Kali. Until the sucky, turbo end.

10.speaker: speaker_prof_ikari
10.dialogue: Alright, there’s no way you’ll be able to compute this equation at such a speed.

20.speaker: speaker_ekko
20.dialogue: Try me.

30.speaker: speaker_ekko
30.dialogue: R-respectfully, ma'am. Ahem.

40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
40.dialogue: [Hm. Professor Ikari’s been testing Ekko to see if he can answer different math problems… before she can type them into a calculator.]

50.speaker: speaker_kaisa
50.dialogue: [He’s using his Star Guardian powers right out in the open. Idiot!]

60.speaker: speaker_prof_ikari
60.dialogue: 38,472,938 multiplied by 238,492. You have—

80.speaker: speaker_prof_ikari
80.dialogue: That’s… correct!

90.speaker: speaker_ekko
90.dialogue: What can I say? This man’s got all the answers.

100.speaker: speaker_akali
100.dialogue: Show off.

110.speaker: speaker_akali
110.dialogue: If I could rewind time, I definitely wouldn’t use it to impress my math class.

120.speaker: speaker_kaisa
120.dialogue: You’d probably go back to last week, when you fell on your face in front of the entire class.

130.speaker: speaker_akali
130.dialogue: Akali, you fool! Why didn’t you double knot your laces?!

140.speaker: speaker_kaisa
140.dialogue: …Do you think we should talk to him?

150.speaker: speaker_akali
150.dialogue: Ekko? What, for the answers to the big test on Friday?

160.speaker: speaker_kaisa
160.dialogue: No! Talk to him about misusing his Star Guardian abilities.

170.speaker: speaker_akali
170.dialogue: This again? You worry too much. I mean, it’s not like he’s gonna get caught.

180.speaker: speaker_akali
180.dialogue: And even if he does, he can just rewind time to before he gets caught. Problem solved.

190.speaker: speaker_kaisa
190.dialogue: Problem not solved.

200.speaker: speaker_kaisa
200.dialogue: Being a Star Guardian is about responsibility. Honor. Loyal—

210.speaker: speaker_akali
210.dialogue: I took the oath the same day as you. We’re co-leaders. Not that anyone seems to remember…

220.speaker: speaker_akali
220.dialogue: If it’s bugging you so much, go talk to the kid. Use your powers of being a giant buzzkill.

230.speaker: speaker_kaisa
230.dialogue: Fine. I will.

240.speaker: speaker_kaisa
240.dialogue: [There he is… It's like he’s avoiding me…]

250.speaker: speaker_kaisa
250.dialogue: Ekko! Hey!

260.speaker: speaker_ekko
260.dialogue: Oh! Hey, captain ‘Kai!

270.speaker: speaker_kaisa
270.dialogue: Been asking around for you. Feel like I keep showing up right after you leave.

280.speaker: speaker_kaisa
280.dialogue: Chess club, advanced physics…

300.speaker: speaker_kaisa
300.dialogue: How strange. I sort of have that problem, too…

310.speaker: speaker_ekko
310.dialogue: I can’t hang out this weekend.

320.speaker: speaker_ekko
320.dialogue: I have a… project I’m working on.

330.speaker: speaker_kaisa
330.dialogue: I didn’t ask you to hang out.

340.speaker: speaker_ekko
340.dialogue: Oh. Well, you were going to.

350.speaker: speaker_kaisa
350.dialogue: You’ve already had this conversation before, haven’t you?

360.speaker: speaker_ekko
360.dialogue: Just a few times.

370.speaker: speaker_ekko

response.dialogue: So you were avoiding me? I knew it!
Well, this version of me managed to track you down.
That’s it, hand over the time egg before you summon a planet-eating lava parasite.

370.dialogue: There were a couple repeats where I managed to sneak away. Those were my favorites.

380.speaker: speaker_ekko
380.dialogue: …Sure.

390.speaker: speaker_kaisa
390.dialogue: You can’t keep doing this, Ekko. Rewinding conversations so you say the right thing. Rewinding math class so you have the right answer…

400.speaker: speaker_ekko
400.dialogue: I’m not cheating at math! Why do you always say that?

410.speaker: speaker_kaisa
410.dialogue: You’re not?

420.speaker: speaker_ekko
420.dialogue: No. I’m just good at solving advanced equations in my head.

430.speaker: speaker_kaisa
430.dialogue: [Huh. Guess that makes sense. The kid is a brainiac, after all.]

450.speaker: speaker_kaisa
450.dialogue: But my point stands.

460.speaker: speaker_ekko
460.dialogue: And what point was that… captain?

470.speaker: speaker_kaisa
470.dialogue: My point was that, as your cap… Ugh, I’m telling you to only use your abilities to…

480.speaker: speaker_ekko
480.dialogue: Protect the universe?

490.speaker: speaker_kaisa
490.dialogue: Hmph. Nice guess.

500.speaker: speaker_ekko
500.dialogue: Wasn’t a guess. And… you don’t have to worry. I can never change the past anyways. Not when it really matters.

510.speaker: speaker_ekko
510.dialogue: Look… I should get going.

520.speaker: speaker_kaisa

response.dialogue: What exactly is the project you’re working on?
Do you have the math homework?
What am I going to say next?

520.dialogue: Wait.

530a_10.speaker: speaker_ekko
530a_10.dialogue: It’s a surprise. Or a… secret.

530b_10.speaker: speaker_ekko
530b_10.dialogue: You seriously want to cheat off me?

530b_20.speaker: speaker_ekko
530b_20.dialogue: After making me feel bad for cheating?

530b_40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
530b_40.dialogue: I-I wasn’t going to cheat. I just wanted to… compare answers.

530c_10.speaker: speaker_ekko
530c_10.dialogue: “That wasn’t what I was gonna say. “

530c_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
530c_20.dialogue: That wasn’t what I was gonna s—

540.speaker: speaker_ekko
540.dialogue: See you around, Captain ‘Kai.

550.speaker: speaker_kaisa
550.dialogue: [I’m not giving up on you that easy, kid.]

570.speaker: speaker_kaisa
570.dialogue: [Okay, so following Ekko home might not have been a high point for me as a Star Guardian…]

580.speaker: speaker_kaisa
580.dialogue: [...but I have to figure out what he’s up to.]

590.speaker: speaker_strange_machine
590.dialogue: Wooooooshh. Icka icka icka icka…

600.speaker: speaker_kaisa
600.dialogue: Wh-what is that?!

610.speaker: speaker_ekko
610.dialogue: Huh. You’re earlier than last time… captain.

620.speaker: speaker_kaisa
620.dialogue: [Oh, shoot.]

10.speaker: speaker_ekko
10.dialogue: Inventor’s Log: After a few setbacks, I’m prepared to proceed with ChronoDisplacer Test 91.

20.speaker: speaker_ekko
20.dialogue: Recalibrated the internal zeptometer for more accurate retrieval to the millisecond.

30.speaker: speaker_kaisa
30.dialogue: [It’s been a few weeks since I followed Ekko home…]

40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
40.dialogue: [He was mad at first when he found out. But then he seemed to forget about it…]

50.speaker: speaker_kaisa
50.dialogue: [And now, out of the blue, he invites me over. What’s he playing at?]

60.speaker: speaker_ekko
60.dialogue: Kai’Sa! You’re just in time!

70.speaker: speaker_kaisa
70.dialogue: Just in time for what exactly?

80.speaker: speaker_ekko
80.dialogue: To witness the first successful test of my ChronoDisplacer!

90.speaker: speaker_kaisa
90.dialogue: Chrono…

100.speaker: speaker_ekko
100.dialogue: Displacer!

110.speaker: speaker_ekko
110.dialogue: The title is a work in progress.

120.speaker: speaker_kaisa
120.dialogue: So, this is the “project” you’ve been working on?

130.speaker: speaker_kaisa
130.dialogue: The one that’s been keeping you from coming to training?

140.speaker: speaker_kaisa
140.dialogue: And the reason you missed Mandatory Mochi Monday?

150.speaker: speaker_ekko
150.dialogue: Yeah, sorry I’ve been slacking on my Star Guardian duties… though uh, nobody likes the mandatory Mondays. Just an FYI.

160.speaker: speaker_ekko
160.dialogue: But once I get this working, I’ll be back full time. I promise.

170.speaker: speaker_kaisa
170.dialogue: Ugh… fine. So what exactly does this thing do?

180.speaker: speaker_ekko
180.dialogue: Oh… uh, yeah, I should explain.

190.speaker: speaker_ekko
190.dialogue: When I became a Star Guardian, the First Light gave me the power to go back in time...

200.speaker: speaker_kaisa
200.dialogue: I remember, Ekko. I was there.

210.speaker: speaker_ekko
210.dialogue: Oh yeah! I’ll, uh… skip ahead.

220.speaker: speaker_ekko
220.dialogue: I’ve been experimenting... looking for a way to amplify my abilities.

230.speaker: speaker_ekko
230.dialogue: I want to increase the distance I can travel backward. The longer the better.

240.speaker: speaker_kaisa
240.dialogue: Where are you trying to go?

250.speaker: speaker_ekko
250.dialogue: Not where. When!

260.speaker: speaker_kaisa
260.dialogue: What?!

270.speaker: speaker_ekko
270.dialogue: Normally, I can only travel back as far as three minutes.

280.speaker: speaker_ekko
280.dialogue: But with the help of this machine, I should be able to travel as far back as three years!

response.dialogue: Yeah… sure! I guess!
That’s not exactly the word I would use to describe it.
What would happen if an insect got into the machine when it’s powered on?

300.speaker: speaker_ekko
300.dialogue: …Why aren’t you excited about it?

310.speaker: speaker_ekko
310.dialogue: Just think of the possibilities!

320.speaker: speaker_kaisa
320.dialogue: I thought you said you couldn’t change the past. And why would you even…?

330.speaker: speaker_ekko
330.dialogue: I just wasn’t thinking hard enough.

340.speaker: speaker_kaisa
340.dialogue: …Wait. Didn’t this neighborhood get hit during the invasion…? The night Zoe attacked…

350.speaker: speaker_ekko
350.dialogue: I know I can do it. I know I can go back. I just need to figure out a few more things…

360.speaker: speaker_kaisa
360.dialogue: …What happened, Ekko?

370.speaker: speaker_ekko
370.dialogue: Just have to get there one minute sooner… Even a moment…

380.speaker: speaker_kaisa
380.dialogue: Ekko...

410.speaker: speaker_kaisa
410.dialogue: You can talk to me, okay? That’s why you asked me to come here, right? To open up, and get this off your chest?

420.speaker: speaker_ekko
420.dialogue: …Wait, what? Pfft, no.

430.speaker: speaker_ekko
430.dialogue: Whatever singalongs you’re doing with the rest of the team, that ain’t me. Nice try, though.

440.speaker: speaker_ekko

response.dialogue: What would I have to do? Push a few buttons?
Wow. Rude.
I don’t even have my driver’s license. Should I be operating heavy machinery?

440.dialogue: I just need someone to help me operate the machine.

450a_10.speaker: speaker_ekko
450a_10.dialogue: Uh… it’s a little bit more complicated than that.

450a_20.speaker: speaker_ekko
450a_20.dialogue: What do you know about relativity?

450a_40.speaker: speaker_ekko
450a_40.dialogue: We haven’t had a lecture on relativity this year.

450a_60.speaker: speaker_kaisa
450a_60.dialogue: Just like I know nothing about what you have planned.

450b_10.speaker: speaker_ekko
450b_10.dialogue: You don’t want me doing something dangerous alone, do you?

450b_40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
450b_40.dialogue: Oh, come on… This is emotional manipulation!

450c_10.speaker: speaker_ekko
450c_10.dialogue: I won’t tell if you won’t.

450c_30.speaker: speaker_ekko
450c_30.dialogue: We won’t. If it works, no one is going to get hurt.

450c_40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
450c_40.dialogue: …Hm. Alright, what do you have planned?

460.speaker: speaker_ekko
460.dialogue: …I suppose I do owe you an explanation.

470.speaker: speaker_ekko
470.dialogue: I was out at the arcade with my friend…

480.speaker: speaker_ekko
480.dialogue: When Zoe attacked the city.

490.speaker: speaker_ekko
490.dialogue: …! What’s happening?! Is that… some sort of monster?

510.speaker: speaker_ekko
510.dialogue: I thought he was warning me. But when I turned around, I saw him under the rubble.

520.speaker: speaker_ekko
520.dialogue: He came out of his coma, but… the doctors still aren’t sure if he’ll walk again.

530.speaker: speaker_kaisa
530.dialogue: So… you think you can save him if you go back to that night.

540.speaker: speaker_ekko
540.dialogue: If I can get there before. If I can warn him…

550.speaker: speaker_kaisa
550.dialogue: You know, sometimes the past—

560.speaker: speaker_ekko
560.dialogue: I’m doing this, Captain. Either you can help me, or you can leave.

570.speaker: speaker_ekko
570.dialogue: I don’t care about when or where we’re “allowed” to use our powers, or how they’re supposed to be used, or whatever dumb rules you come up with. This is my choice.

580.speaker: speaker_kaisa
580.dialogue: Ekko, I’m only… Okay. I’ll do it. Let’s change the past.

590.speaker: speaker_kaisa
590.dialogue: How do we get this thing going?

10.speaker: speaker_kaisa
10.dialogue: [So, our first test didn’t work. The machine puttered out, generating some weird, blue gas.]

20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
20.dialogue: [Second test failed, too. And the third.]

30.speaker: speaker_ekko
30.dialogue: Inventor’s Log: This is ChronoDisplacer Test 143.

40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
40.dialogue: [Yeah, we’ve been at it for a while.]

50.speaker: speaker_ekko
50.dialogue: After numerous failed attempts with an operator in the present…

60.speaker: speaker_ekko
60.dialogue: We will now proceed with two travelers, one to monitor an active connection with…

70.speaker: speaker_kaisa
70.dialogue: [It’s hard for me to pay attention when he starts rambling on about all this time stuff.]

80.speaker: speaker_kaisa
80.dialogue: [But… I’m going with him! He gave me a device to pull us back if anything goes wrong.]

90.speaker: speaker_ekko
90.dialogue: …and, this time, nothing will go wrong.

100.speaker: speaker_ekko

response.dialogue: Let’s do this.
Not in the slightest. But what choice do we have?
Could you tell me what I have to do again? I… wasn’t listening.

100.dialogue: Are you ready?

120.speaker: speaker_ekko
120.dialogue: It’s now or never.

130.speaker: speaker_ekko
130.dialogue: Entering chrono-coordinates…

140.speaker: speaker_kaisa
140.dialogue: Digitizing quantum polarity…

150.speaker: speaker_ekko
150.dialogue: That’s… That’s not a thing.

160.speaker: speaker_kaisa
160.dialogue: Just trying to help.

170.speaker: speaker_kaisa
170.dialogue: …Ahem. Turning on the Stopwatch of Perfect Timing…

180.speaker: speaker_ekko
180.dialogue: Name not final. Patent pending.

190.speaker: speaker_kaisa
190.dialogue: Synchronized! If you’re gonna do something, do it now!

200.speaker: speaker_ekko
200.dialogue: Alright… Here goes nothing!

210.speaker: speaker_ekko
210.dialogue: Kai’Sa?

220.speaker: speaker_kaisa
220.dialogue: Checking the stopwatch to confirm accurate arrival time…

230.speaker: speaker_ekko
230.dialogue: No need. Look at the skyline.

240.speaker: speaker_kaisa
240.dialogue: That’s… Zoe… the Twilight Star… We’re back to that night…

250.speaker: speaker_kaisa
250.dialogue: You did it, Ekko.

260.speaker: speaker_ekko
260.dialogue: We did it.

270.speaker: speaker_civilian
270.dialogue: Wh… What is that?! Run! Run for your lives!

280.speaker: speaker_kaisa
280.dialogue: Quick, transform. Even if this is the past, that’s still Zoe. The old guardians are fighting her right now, and it is not pretty.

300.speaker: speaker_ekko
300.dialogue: You really weren’t listening to me at all, were you?

310.speaker: speaker_ekko
310.dialogue: We have to track down past me. Ignore everything else. I maaaay have neglected to mention the effects of messing with history too much.

320.speaker: speaker_kaisa
320.dialogue: Those are lies of omission! I… ugh! Just lead the way…

330.speaker: speaker_past_ekko
330.dialogue: Let’s get out of here!

340.speaker: speaker_claggor
340.dialogue: Just a second! My friend needs help!

350.speaker: speaker_past_ekko
350.dialogue: Claggor, hurry! The entire city is falling apart!

360.speaker: speaker_kaisa
360.dialogue: Wow, you look pretty much the same.

370.speaker: speaker_ekko
370.dialogue: It was last year, Kai. Not last century.

380.speaker: speaker_kaisa
380.dialogue: True. And that other boy… That’s your friend?

410.speaker: speaker_kaisa
410.dialogue: Wait a second…

420.speaker: speaker_ekko
420.dialogue: Sona?

430.speaker: speaker_kaisa
430.dialogue: Shhh!

440.speaker: speaker_kaisa
440.dialogue: She hasn’t met us yet. Wouldn’t talking to her mess with—I don’t know—the fabric of reality?!

450.speaker: speaker_ekko
450.dialogue: Oh, so you were listening!

460.speaker: speaker_kaisa
460.dialogue: Only when it was interesting.

470.speaker: speaker_ekko
470.dialogue: …Well, I don’t think she noticed us.

480.speaker: speaker_kaisa
480.dialogue: Maybe not. But he did.

490.speaker: speaker_claggor
490.dialogue: Hey, Sona! Don’t go running off on your own! …Wait, Ekko?

510.speaker: speaker_claggor
510.dialogue: Didn’t I just see you leave? In the opposite direction? …And why are you dressed in cosplay?

520.speaker: speaker_ekko
520.dialogue: I—no—there’s no way. I mean—

530.speaker: speaker_kaisa
530.dialogue: Sorry, his little computer brain is malfunctioning.

540.speaker: speaker_kaisa
540.dialogue: What he’s trying to say is that he… came back. Wanted to make sure you’re okay.

550.speaker: speaker_claggor
550.dialogue: Yeah, well, nobody is okay right now. Something bad is happening outside… Wait, you’re also dressed in cosplay? This is weird.

560.speaker: speaker_kaisa
560.dialogue: I’m… a friend.

570.speaker: speaker_ekko
570.dialogue: …You-you need to get out of here!

580.speaker: speaker_claggor
580.dialogue: Ah. You aren’t my Ekko, are you? Or you are, but… Well, you know.

590.speaker: speaker_ekko
590.dialogue: How—?

600.speaker: speaker_claggor
600.dialogue: I always knew you’d figure out a way to time travel! We’ve been talking about it for years!

610.speaker: speaker_claggor
610.dialogue: Did you use a wormhole? Did you figure out a way to alter the geometry of space-time?!

620.speaker: speaker_ekko
620.dialogue: …There’s no time.

630.speaker: speaker_claggor
630.dialogue: I’m sure you’ll tell future me all about it, right? Right? Ekko… Am I right..?

640.speaker: speaker_claggor
640.dialogue: Wait… Why are you here?

650.speaker: speaker_ekko
650.dialogue: …I’m not going to let it happen. Not again.

660.speaker: speaker_claggor
660.dialogue: What? What happens to me?

680.speaker: speaker_kaisa
680.dialogue: You get hurt. Saving someone else.

690.speaker: speaker_claggor
690.dialogue: Do I look cool while doing it?

700.speaker: speaker_ekko
700.dialogue: This isn’t a joke, Claggor!

710.speaker: speaker_ekko
710.dialogue: I’m-I’m a Star Guardian now. It’s my job to keep you safe.

720.speaker: speaker_claggor
720.dialogue: Huh? What’s a Star Guardian? Are they, like… superheroes?

730.speaker: speaker_kaisa
730.dialogue: That’s right… The invasion made the guardians public knowledge! Nobody knows they even exist until tomorrow morning!

740.speaker: speaker_ekko
740.dialogue: Yeah, they’re like superheroes. I took an oath and everything…

750.speaker: speaker_claggor
750.dialogue: An oath, huh? Like, protect the innocent, defeat evil? All that?

760.speaker: speaker_claggor
760.dialogue: Which means your job is to protect people. Not keep me from making my own decisions.

780.speaker: speaker_claggor
780.dialogue: And what about the person I save? What happens to them if you stop me?

830.speaker: speaker_ekko

response.dialogue: You’ve done all you can, Ekko.
Just let him go. It’s over.
Maybe we should just be glad we made it here in one piece.

830.dialogue: But we traveled all this way!

840b_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
840b_20.dialogue: Oh! I didn’t mean it like that! Don’t worry. You survive… mostly.

840b_30.speaker: speaker_ekko
840b_30.dialogue: But you don’t have to get hurt at all…

840c_30.speaker: speaker_ekko
840c_30.dialogue: We were still working out the kinks.

840c_40.speaker: speaker_ekko
840c_40.dialogue: And it was all for this moment. So, I won’t give up.

850.speaker: speaker_claggor
850.dialogue: You’ve read all the same sci-fi mangas as me… You know you can’t change the past.

870.speaker: speaker_claggor
870.dialogue: Why do you think we get along so well?

890.speaker: speaker_claggor
890.dialogue: Yeah… Always. Until the end of time.

920.speaker: speaker_ekko
920.dialogue: No. But I think I will be.

960.speaker: speaker_kaisa
960.dialogue: Yeah, no problem. I just had to push a button.

10.speaker: speaker_akali
10.dialogue: You sure you’re okay with doing this, Kai?

20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
20.dialogue: It’s not like we have any other choice.

30.speaker: speaker_akali
30.dialogue: I mean… you could come with us?

40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
40.dialogue: You know I can’t. Someone has to look after Valoran City.

50.speaker: speaker_kaisa
50.dialogue: Someone has to look after… them.

60.speaker: speaker_chiizu
60.dialogue: I promise we won’t be a bother, Miss Kai’Sa.

70.speaker: speaker_kaisa
70.dialogue: I’m not worried about you, Chiizu. But some of your friends…

80.speaker: speaker_umi
80.dialogue: [Angry screech!]

90.speaker: speaker_akali
90.dialogue: Umi didn’t appreciate what you were implying.

100.speaker: speaker_kaisa
100.dialogue: Yeah… I heard. [Ouch. My ears.]

110.speaker: speaker_kaisa
110.dialogue: But don’t worry, Akali. I didn’t really want to go on the field trip anyway…

120.speaker: speaker_akali
120.dialogue: Because you hate fun?

130.speaker: speaker_kaisa
130.dialogue: …No! I like fun.

140.speaker: speaker_akali
140.dialogue: Hmph. Coulda fooled me.

150.speaker: speaker_kaisa
150.dialogue: I went to the capital once when I was younger. Not much to see. Lots of buildings.

160.speaker: speaker_akali

response.dialogue: That wasn’t on the class itinerary!
MATCHA MUSEUM?! Please tell me you’re joking.
You can’t make me jealous. I have plenty of exciting activities planned!

160.dialogue: Yeah, I bet. Staying home and looking after a bunch of weird pets sounds way cooler than seeing history come alive at the world’s only matcha museum.

170a_10.speaker: speaker_akali
170a_10.dialogue: Who said anything about following the class itinerary?

170b_10.speaker: speaker_akali
170b_10.dialogue: Wish I was. I love to joke.

170b_20.speaker: speaker_akali
170b_20.dialogue: But I’ve never been more serious.

170b_30.speaker: speaker_kaisa
170b_30.dialogue: You’ll take lots of photos, right?

170b_40.speaker: speaker_akali
170b_40.dialogue: Of course! But I don’t think they let us take ‘em during the tasting tour.

170c_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
170c_20.dialogue: Uh… I was gonna hang out with some friends from school.

170c_30.speaker: speaker_akali
170c_30.dialogue: We’re your friends from school. Try again.

170c_40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
170c_40.dialogue: …Go to the hot springs and have a spa day?

170c_60.speaker: speaker_kaisa
170c_60.dialogue: [Sigh] …I was going to catch up on homework.

180.speaker: speaker_kaisa
180.dialogue: Well, one of us has to be responsible…

190.speaker: speaker_akali
190.dialogue: Spare me the self-sacrificing monologue, Kai. Sorry, Captain Kai, of the Star Guardians. Bwahaha!

200.speaker: speaker_akali
200.dialogue: See you in a week! Later, skater.

210.speaker: speaker_akali
210.dialogue: Oh, and Umi… don’t go too hard on her. Heh.

220.speaker: speaker_umi
220.dialogue: [Sad chirp.]

230.speaker: speaker_kaisa
230.dialogue: She’ll be back, Umi.

240.speaker: speaker_umi
240.dialogue: [Confused chirp.]

250.speaker: speaker_kaisa
250.dialogue: No, no! You need to stay behind, with me!

260.speaker: speaker_ina
260.dialogue: [Excited cheep!]

270.speaker: speaker_kaisa
270.dialogue: That’s right, Ina. We’re gonna have a lot of fun.

280.speaker: speaker_umi
280.dialogue: [Doubtful chirp.]

290.speaker: speaker_kaisa
290.dialogue: Yeah, yeah, you’re used to doing fun things with Akali.

300.speaker: speaker_kaisa
300.dialogue: But maybe my definition of fun is just different! Did you ever consider that?

310.speaker: speaker_aru
310.dialogue: [Declarative bahhh.]

320.speaker: speaker_kaisa
320.dialogue: Well, I’m not really taking suggestions for activities, and—

330.speaker: speaker_waku
330.dialogue: [Thoughtful boop.]

340.speaker: speaker_kaisa
340.dialogue: That’s not in our budget, Waku! Dad has me on a very strict allowance!

350.speaker: speaker_chiizu
350.dialogue: Please, everyone! Give Miss Kai’Sa some space.

360.speaker: speaker_kaisa
360.dialogue: Thanks, Chiizu. You know, you’re the only one that—

370.speaker: speaker_chiizu
370.dialogue: Though, now that I have a moment… I was wondering if perhaps we’d have some free time to go to a concert. There’s a great singer in town, and I thought we might float by.

400.speaker: speaker_chiizu
400.dialogue: OH, NO! I spoke out of turn, didn’t I? I’M SO SORRY!

420.speaker: speaker_kaisa
420.dialogue: Listen up, everybody!

430.speaker: speaker_kaisa
430.dialogue: I know our friends are off having fun, exploring a cool city, enjoying delicious food…

450.speaker: speaker_kaisa
450.dialogue: Umi! Jeez, for a manta ray you sure act like an evil empress. Okay, I’ll get to the point—

460.speaker: speaker_kaisa
460.dialogue: We have work to do.

470.speaker: speaker_chiizu
470.dialogue: Miss Kai’Sa, I don’t really know anything about high-school physics. I’m a soulful being with the heart of a poet.

480.speaker: speaker_kaisa
480.dialogue: I’m not talking about homework.

490.speaker: speaker_kaisa
490.dialogue: I’m talking about being the best Star Guardians we can be!

500.speaker: speaker_chiizu
500.dialogue: Oh—well, we aren’t really guardians, per se…

510.speaker: speaker_waku
510.dialogue: [Helpful beep boop.]

520.speaker: speaker_chiizu
520.dialogue: Yes! That’s right, Waku. We are simply adorable companions meant to distract and delight.

530.speaker: speaker_chiizu
530.dialogue: We aren’t meant to see… combat.

540.speaker: speaker_umi
540.dialogue: [Combative chirp!]

550.speaker: speaker_chiizu
550.dialogue: Okay, some of us aren’t meant to see combat. Unless we’re transforming weapons, sentient guns-slash-knives, or we explode when thrown.

560.speaker: speaker_kaisa
560.dialogue: Well, times have changed, Chiizu.

570.speaker: speaker_kaisa
570.dialogue: When the rest of the guardians come back, we’ll show them that practice makes—

580.speaker: speaker_aru
580.dialogue: [Overly excited bah!]

590.speaker: speaker_kaisa
590.dialogue: No… perfect, not paninis. But I appreciate the enthusiasm.

600.speaker: speaker_aru
600.dialogue: [Destitute bah.]

610.speaker: speaker_kaisa
610.dialogue: We can get paninis later.

620.speaker: speaker_kaisa
620.dialogue: You’re gonna have to be my right-hand… rabbit this week.

630.speaker: speaker_kaisa
630.dialogue: You up to the challenge?

640.speaker: speaker_ina
640.dialogue: [Enthusiastic cheep.]

650.speaker: speaker_kaisa
650.dialogue: I can’t offer you a salary.

660.speaker: speaker_ina
660.dialogue: [Less enthusiastic cheep.]

670.speaker: speaker_kaisa
670.dialogue: You’ll do it anyway? Great.

680.speaker: speaker_chiizu
680.dialogue: Miss Kai’Sa—

690.speaker: speaker_kaisa
690.dialogue: Ina, wait! I didn’t tell you what I need help with… Stars alive, why are there so many of you?

700.speaker: speaker_chiizu
700.dialogue: Miss Kai’Sa—

710.speaker: speaker_kaisa
710.dialogue: Hmm. Okay… we can spar on Sunday, run some drills after school on Monday…

730.speaker: speaker_kaisa
730.dialogue: Then, Tuesday, I have journalism club…

750.speaker: speaker_kaisa
750.dialogue: What, Chiizu?! What is so important?!

response.dialogue: Aru headbutted you again, and you want to write them a sternly worded letter?
Waku won’t stop beatboxing even after you asked nicely?
Ina is bragging about the new—well-deserved—responsibilities I gave them?

10.speaker: speaker_kaisa
10.dialogue: Umi?!

20.speaker: speaker_ina
20.dialogue: [Worried cheep.]

30.speaker: speaker_kaisa
30.dialogue: I don’t think Umi is around here, Ina.

40.speaker: speaker_chiizu
40.dialogue: Oh, dear. OH, DEAR! We’re going to be in so much trouble.

50.speaker: speaker_kaisa
50.dialogue: We’ll find Umi. They can’t have gone far.

60.speaker: speaker_waku
60.dialogue: [Purposeful boop.]

70.speaker: speaker_kaisa
70.dialogue: They wouldn’t have gone into the sewer, Waku.

80.speaker: speaker_waku
80.dialogue: [Insistent beep.]

90.speaker: speaker_kaisa
90.dialogue: Yeah, no, obviously! I’ll go in the sewer! In the sewer with all the sewage! Let me check right now!

100.speaker: speaker_kaisa
100.dialogue: …Nothing.

120.speaker: speaker_aru
120.dialogue: [Hopeless bah.]

130.speaker: speaker_kaisa
130.dialogue: Don’t say that. Umi is out there somewhere.

140.speaker: speaker_kaisa
140.dialogue: …We’ll search all of Valoran City if we have to.

150.speaker: speaker_chiizu
150.dialogue: Great idea, Miss Kai’Sa! I know just where to start!

160.speaker: speaker_kaisa
160.dialogue: …The school? Your great idea is… the school?

170.speaker: speaker_kaisa
170.dialogue: Why, Chiizu? Why would Umi come here?

180.speaker: speaker_chiizu
180.dialogue: To learn, of course!

190.speaker: speaker_kaisa
190.dialogue: The entire school is on a field trip.

200.speaker: speaker_chiizu
200.dialogue: NOOOO! I’ve led the team astray!

210.speaker: speaker_chiizu
210.dialogue: I’m a terrible Star Guardian!!! Or adorable Star Guardian familiar! I don’t remember where we landed on that.

220.speaker: speaker_waku
220.dialogue: [Defensive boop beep.]

230.speaker: speaker_kaisa
230.dialogue: What do you mean Chiizu just needs some time to cool off? Cool off from what? He looks like a cartoon mouse!

240.speaker: speaker_waku
240.dialogue: [Descriptive boop.]

250.speaker: speaker_kaisa
250.dialogue: Oh, mother of… Yeah, alright, Waku. I’ll give him some space.

260.speaker: speaker_waku
260.dialogue: [Thoughtful beep.]

270.speaker: speaker_kaisa
270.dialogue: Huh… Well, there’s probably a better chance Umi would go there than school…

280.speaker: speaker_chiizu
280.dialogue: YOU’RE RIGHT! IT WAS AN AWFUL IDEA! I’M SO, SO SORRY!

300.speaker: speaker_waku
300.dialogue: [Questioning boop beep.]

310.speaker: speaker_kaisa
310.dialogue: I’m not going back up there to get you a “Special Cutie Surprise Special Menu Doughnut with Bonus Smooch.” That’s… I can’t even begin to describe how embarrassing that is.

320.speaker: speaker_waku
320.dialogue: [Angry BOOP.]

330.speaker: speaker_kaisa
330.dialogue: Wait a minute… Can you even eat food?

340.speaker: speaker_waku
340.dialogue: [Ashamed beep.]

350.speaker: speaker_kaisa
350.dialogue: That’s what I thought! You just want the Bonus Smooch! Which is probably just a sticker or something!

360.speaker: speaker_aru
360.dialogue: [Very excited bah!]

370.speaker: speaker_kaisa
370.dialogue: Now isn’t the time for games, Aru.

380.speaker: speaker_aru
380.dialogue: [Insistent bah.]

390.speaker: speaker_kaisa
390.dialogue: Oh! You think Umi’s at Arcade World?

410.speaker: speaker_kaisa
410.dialogue: That makes sense! Akali loves that place, too…

420.speaker: speaker_kaisa
420.dialogue: She’s always going on about how school is a prison and the arcade is where she does all her real learning.

430.speaker: speaker_kaisa
430.dialogue: …Which would explain why she’s getting straight Cs.

450.speaker: speaker_kaisa
450.dialogue: Sure, now I’m boring. Well, lead the way!

460.speaker: speaker_kaisa
460.dialogue: Umi’s not by the VALORANT machine…

470.speaker: speaker_aru
470.dialogue: [Descriptive bah.]

480.speaker: speaker_kaisa
480.dialogue: Not by the snacks either?

490.speaker: speaker_kaisa
490.dialogue: Well then. They definitely aren’t here.

510.speaker: speaker_kaisa
510.dialogue: Maybe we should just call it for today. Look again tomorrow?

520.speaker: speaker_ina
520.dialogue: [Motivational cheep.]

530.speaker: speaker_kaisa
530.dialogue: Hey! That’s my line. I’m the one who says, “We should never give up.” Unless we should give up… you know, for tactical reasons.

540.speaker: speaker_ina
540.dialogue: [Even more motivational cheep.]

550.speaker: speaker_kaisa
550.dialogue: Noodle Bill’s! It’s so obvious! How did I not think of that?

560.speaker: speaker_ina
560.dialogue: [Constructive criticism cheep.]

570.speaker: speaker_kaisa
570.dialogue: Of course I’m attentive to my team’s needs! It’s just, sometimes, I get so focused on Star Guardian work that I—

580.speaker: speaker_ina
580.dialogue: [Sassy cheep.]

590.speaker: speaker_kaisa
590.dialogue: I’m not making excuses. I…

600.speaker: speaker_kaisa
600.dialogue: …W-we should get going! We’re coming for you, Umi!

610.speaker: speaker_kaisa
610.dialogue: …Bill? Are you open?

620.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
620.dialogue: Well, well, Miss Kai’Sa! I think I know why you’re here…

630.speaker: speaker_kaisa
630.dialogue: Really? You’ve seen a floating… uh… manta ray… thing?

640.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
640.dialogue: …A what?

650.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill

response.dialogue: I… uh… Oh—I meant…
Ramen! Yes, of course! That’s why I’m here!
Floating manta ray!? That would be crazy. Not something I know about…

650.dialogue: I thought you were here to eat ramen…

660.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
660.dialogue: Ha! The look on your face!

670.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
670.dialogue: Yeah, I’ve seen your pet…

680.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
680.dialogue: …And I see you’ve brought more of them. A lot more. An entire little zoo.

690.speaker: speaker_kaisa
690.dialogue: These things? Uh… yes. They’re my pets!

700.speaker: speaker_aru
700.dialogue: [Baaah!]

710.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
710.dialogue: Quite… uh… exotic animals.

720.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
720.dialogue: And very talkative, too… This one in particular.

730.speaker: speaker_kaisa
730.dialogue: Umi! There you are! I’ve looked so many places for you! Places so far apart from one another! On foot!

740.speaker: speaker_kaisa
740.dialogue: Sorry to bother you, Bill. We’ll get going now.

750.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill

response.dialogue: Break? Why would I need a break?
Oh, yes, please. I’m starving.
No time, Bill. My many weird pets and I have combat drills to do.

750.dialogue: Why not stay a while, Kai’Sa? I think you could use a break.

760a_10.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
760a_10.dialogue: I’m sure you’ve been running around all day looking for your lost… pet.

760a_30.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
760a_30.dialogue: You know what they say… “Before you take care of others, you must take care of yourself.” I came up with that, by the way. Trade secret.

760b_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
760b_20.dialogue: You wouldn’t believe the day I had…

760b_30.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
760b_30.dialogue: I’m sure you’re exhausted. You always put so much on your plate!

760b_40.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
760b_40.dialogue: The only thing on one’s plate that matters… is good food.

760c_10.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
760c_10.dialogue: Training? For what? Normal stuff, I’m sure, but hey, let’s talk about it.

760c_30.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
760c_30.dialogue: Hrm, a competition. You make your pets work as hard as you do!

760c_40.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
760c_40.dialogue: Relax, Kai’Sa. If not for yourself… for them.

770.speaker: speaker_kaisa
770.dialogue: Ah… that aroma… The Targon Park bicentennial special tonkotsu… but they only make it once a year...!

780.speaker: speaker_noodle_bill
780.dialogue: I wrote that recipe, so really, it’s whenever I decide to make it. Gotta break the rules sometimes if you wanna live long! Wahaha!

10.speaker: speaker_kaisa
10.dialogue: Good morning, everybody!

20.speaker: speaker_ina
20.dialogue: [Surprised cheep.]

30.speaker: speaker_kaisa
30.dialogue: I know! I can’t believe I slept in so late!

40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
40.dialogue: But I’m actually feeling more refreshed than I have in… months.

50.speaker: speaker_ina
50.dialogue: [Wry cheep.]

60.speaker: speaker_kaisa
60.dialogue: There’s no need to say “I told you so…”

70.speaker: speaker_kaisa
70.dialogue: But you were right. And Noodle Bill was right.

80.speaker: speaker_kaisa
80.dialogue: It’s important to find a work/life/school/Star Guardian balance.

90.speaker: speaker_kaisa
90.dialogue: I almost forgot what it was like to sleep in after staying up late watching documentaries… eating an acceptable number of healthy snacks… staying hydrated…

100.speaker: speaker_kaisa
100.dialogue: You know, typical high schooler stuff!

120.speaker: speaker_kaisa
120.dialogue: Wh-what!? I can be a typical high schooler! I didn’t even make plans today!

130.speaker: speaker_kaisa
130.dialogue: I’m chill Kai’Sa. I just go with the flow.

140.speaker: speaker_waku
140.dialogue: [Suspicious boop.]

150.speaker: speaker_kaisa
150.dialogue: No more drills. Promise.

160.speaker: speaker_kaisa
160.dialogue: What do you want to do, Waku?

170.speaker: speaker_waku
170.dialogue: [Questioning beep boop.]

190.speaker: speaker_kaisa
190.dialogue: Does anyone have any suggestions that don’t involve time travel?

200.speaker: speaker_waku
200.dialogue: [Disappointed beep.]

210.speaker: speaker_aru
210.dialogue: [Feverish bah.]

220.speaker: speaker_kaisa
220.dialogue: Rock surfing sounds pretty… cool… I guess…

230.speaker: speaker_aru
230.dialogue: [Angry bah.]

240.speaker: speaker_kaisa
240.dialogue: No! I’m not just saying that! I’m sure it’s a lot of fun.

250.speaker: speaker_aru
250.dialogue: [Furious bah.]

260.speaker: speaker_kaisa
260.dialogue: I just don’t know where the nearest quarry is… or how to surf… Also, rocks are very hard…

270.speaker: speaker_chiizu
270.dialogue: I know something we all could do!

280.speaker: speaker_kaisa
280.dialogue: Ooh! What, Chiizu?

300.speaker: speaker_kaisa
300.dialogue: Wait… Did you stay up all night? You look… unwell.

310.speaker: speaker_chiizu
310.dialogue: I had to finish the show we started…

320.speaker: speaker_chiizu
320.dialogue: And then another show started…

330.speaker: speaker_chiizu

response.dialogue: Maybe you should get some sleep, little guy.
You’ll never be able to watch them all.
I know! There are so many… and we didn’t even get to the ones on the internet…

330.dialogue: Do you know how many shows there are? THERE ARE SO MANY!!!

340a_10.speaker: speaker_chiizu
340a_10.dialogue: SLEEP?! I don’t need sleep! If I sleep, I can’t watch the screen!

340b_10.speaker: speaker_chiizu
340b_10.dialogue: I can do it! I just need to watch several at the same time.

340b_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
340b_20.dialogue: …But then they won’t make any sense to you.

340b_30.speaker: speaker_chiizu
340b_30.dialogue: It’s not about them making sense. It’s about sEEing aLL tHe piCTurES on tHe scrEEn!

340c_10.speaker: speaker_chiizu
340c_10.dialogue: Oh, no… How many shows are on there?

340c_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
340c_20.dialogue: Unlimited. And a lot of them are free.

340c_30.speaker: speaker_chiizu
340c_30.dialogue: This is too much! I-I CAN’T PROCESS THIS INFORMATION!!!!

350.speaker: speaker_kaisa
350.dialogue: Uh… Don’t worry, guys. I’m… sure… Chiizu will be okay.

360.speaker: speaker_kaisa
360.dialogue: Umi! …We never really talked about what happened.

370.speaker: speaker_umi
370.dialogue: [Feigned confused chirp.]

380.speaker: speaker_kaisa
380.dialogue: You know exactly what I’m talking about.

410.speaker: speaker_kaisa
410.dialogue: Of course I’d notice if you were gone!

420.speaker: speaker_kaisa
420.dialogue: You’re my best friend… ’s familiar. My best friend’s familiar.

430.speaker: speaker_umi
430.dialogue: [Satisfied chirp.]

440.speaker: speaker_kaisa

response.dialogue: Maybe go to Arcade World? I think they fixed that broken fighting game!
How about getting a pastry at the cafe? …Or maybe two pastries?
I mean, rock surfing sounds kind of fun, right? We could try it!

440.dialogue: Do you want to do something today?

450.speaker: speaker_chiizu
450.dialogue: Forget that! We could watch more TV!

470.speaker: speaker_chiizu
470.dialogue: I’m not addicted! I CAN STOP ANYTIME!

480.speaker: speaker_chiizu
480.dialogue: It’s only one thousand episodes. How long can it take? [shivers]

490.speaker: speaker_umi
490.dialogue: [Pleasant chirp.]

500.speaker: speaker_kaisa
500.dialogue: A trip to the park sounds perfect, Umi.

510.speaker: speaker_kaisa
510.dialogue: I know at least one of us could use some outdoor time.

520.speaker: speaker_chiizu
520.dialogue: Hey, what are you doing? DON’T TOUCH THE REMOTE!

530.speaker: speaker_umi
530.dialogue: [Delighted chirps.]

540.speaker: speaker_ina
540.dialogue: [Blissful cheeps.]

550.speaker: speaker_kaisa
550.dialogue: Ahhh… this is the life.

560.speaker: speaker_kaisa
560.dialogue: Only thing that would make it better would be…

570.speaker: speaker_umi
570.dialogue: [Knowing chirp.]

580.speaker: speaker_kaisa
580.dialogue: …Yeah. Akali.

590.speaker: speaker_kaisa
590.dialogue: Ever since we became Star Guardians, we haven’t really had a chance to relax.

600.speaker: speaker_kaisa
600.dialogue: Even though she begs for breaks all the time. Ugh, what am I doing? Why can’t I just be normal sometimes?

610.speaker: speaker_kaisa
610.dialogue: I guess somewhere along the line, I forgot how to be… me. The me before I took the oath.

620.speaker: speaker_umi
620.dialogue: [Wise chirps.]

630.speaker: speaker_kaisa
630.dialogue: Yeah. You’re right. I can’t lose sight of what’s important—friends to rely on when the fighting ends.

640.speaker: speaker_kaisa
640.dialogue: …I’m sure it’ll end. One day. It has to.

660.speaker: speaker_kaisa
660.dialogue: Haha! And good ramen is important, too. How could I forget?

670.speaker: speaker_kaisa
670.dialogue: Yeah… a nice, big meal… to share with a friend…

10.speaker: speaker_unknown
10.dialogue: And you’re sure he’s here? Valoran City?

20.speaker: speaker_unknown
20.dialogue: Positive. We’d recognize that smiling moron anywhere.

30.speaker: speaker_nilah
30.dialogue: Luxanna Crownguard didn’t say anything about a chaos-tainted Star Guardian. I should track him down and destroy him before he causes any further damage.

40.speaker: speaker_ahri
40.dialogue: Belay that. We’re handling it.

50.speaker: speaker_miss_fortune
50.dialogue: And if I recall correctly, you made a promise to train these powder monkeys into real fighters. I thought the Outer Guardians didn’t break promises.

60.speaker: speaker_nilah
60.dialogue: …We do not.

70.speaker: speaker_nilah
70.dialogue: But know that if you fail, I will find and slay Rakan. And there is no force in this universe that will stop me.

80.speaker: speaker_miss_fortune
80.dialogue: Nilah, if we fail…

90.speaker: speaker_miss_fortune
90.dialogue: …he’ll come looking for those kids next.

100.speaker: speaker_nilah
100.dialogue: [Mumbling.]

120.speaker: speaker_nilah
120.dialogue: Hmm? Yes, Captain Kai’Sa of the Star Guardians?

130.speaker: speaker_kaisa
130.dialogue: Oh! How extremely formal!

140.speaker: speaker_nilah
140.dialogue: There’s power in a true name, Captain Kai’Sa of the Star Guardians. You would do well to remember that.

150.speaker: speaker_kaisa
150.dialogue: I… uh… I will do that! I will remember this lesson!

160.speaker: speaker_nilah
160.dialogue: Ha!

170.speaker: speaker_nilah
170.dialogue: Let your hair down a little, Kai’Sa. I’m teasing you.

180.speaker: speaker_kaisa
180.dialogue: Haha! I knew that! I totally understood that!

190.speaker: speaker_kaisa
190.dialogue: [Idiot! Your first talk with a real guardian, and you’re blowing it!]

200.speaker: speaker_kaisa
200.dialogue: So… what are you doing? I thought we could get to know each other… you know, if that’s alright with you…

220.speaker: speaker_kaisa
220.dialogue: Maybe you could… show me the ropes? Teach me some Star Guardian wisdom or something?

230.speaker: speaker_nilah
230.dialogue: “Wisdom?” I’m a warrior, Kai’Sa. I can teach you how to fight, and how to survive.

240.speaker: speaker_nilah
240.dialogue: But if you insist… I’ll share what I know. I warn you, I may not have your answers. Few Guardians live as long as I have. Of those who have, none recorded their learnings.

250.speaker: speaker_kaisa
250.dialogue: Ulp! W-wait, I didn’t prepare…

260.speaker: speaker_nilah
260.dialogue: Ask me any question you wish. This first one is a courtesy. The rest you’ll have to earn. Preferably through combat.

270.speaker: speaker_kaisa

response.dialogue: What can you tell me about the oath?
Where do all those monsters come from?
I had a dream where you were my dad.

270.dialogue: Oh, okay! Uh, let’s see…

280a_10.speaker: speaker_nilah
280a_10.dialogue: A very good question! The oath is a bond between the First Star, the First Light, and a prospective guardian. Think of the First Star as… a broker in a transaction.

280a_30.speaker: speaker_nilah
280a_30.dialogue: Both Light and Star are very similar—perhaps even one and the same, if the truly ancient guardians are to be believed.

280a_40.speaker: speaker_nilah
280a_40.dialogue: The First Star is born of the First Light and is its physical manifestation in this universe. The oath we take connects us to that avatar, and through it, we gain power.

280b_10.speaker: speaker_nilah
280b_10.dialogue: Monsters?! The manifestation of dark forces in the universe, the great hounds of anti-light!

280b_30.speaker: speaker_nilah
280b_30.dialogue: These beasts are tied to chaos and entropy, spawned from their well of darkness. It is a great cycle that gives us the gift of these colossal foes, so we might test our strength against them!

280b_40.speaker: speaker_nilah
280b_40.dialogue: …Ahem. My apologies. The idea of facing another titanic beast… Whew, it’s very exciting.

280c_30.speaker: speaker_nilah
280c_30.dialogue: It’s also not a question, but I’m counting it as one. You have lost your question privileges.

280c_40.speaker: speaker_nilah
280c_40.dialogue: If this is what I have to work with, I swear…

290.speaker: speaker_nilah
290.dialogue: There. From now on, you will earn your answers through rigor or guile.

300.speaker: speaker_nilah
300.dialogue: [Mumbling.]

310.speaker: speaker_kaisa
310.dialogue: What was that thing you did just now?

320.speaker: speaker_nilah
320.dialogue: You mean this? It’s a special gesture paired with a recitation. It prevents my power from consuming me, and I must perform it often.

330.speaker: speaker_nilah
330.dialogue: The recitation isn’t anything special. Usually, I quote literature or an old Star Guardian text. The passage must, however, bring me joy.

340.speaker: speaker_kaisa
340.dialogue: Are you saying you’re constantly on the verge of falling?

350.speaker: speaker_nilah
350.dialogue: …Not as you understand it, no. Guardians who live long enough may chance upon powers beyond even the First Star’s capabilities.

360.speaker: speaker_nilah
360.dialogue: As the centuries passed, I encountered one myself. And in our own ways, we both emerged victorious.

370.speaker: speaker_kaisa
370.dialogue: Centuries?!

380.speaker: speaker_nilah
380.dialogue: Is that strange? Many Outer Guardians are hundreds or even thousands of years old.

390.speaker: speaker_kaisa
390.dialogue: Thousands of years? What about your families, your friends?

410.speaker: speaker_nilah
410.dialogue: The oath magically halts aging. All Star Guardians are destined to die in battle or in darkness. There is no third option.

420.speaker: speaker_nilah
420.dialogue: You will see all that you care for live, grow old, and fade away. Cities will rise and fall, great threats will menace the universe and be destroyed…

430.speaker: speaker_nilah
430.dialogue: …and you will see your closest friends, those who knew you best… fall in turn. Until, if you are unlucky enough, you are the last one left.

450.speaker: speaker_nilah
450.dialogue: A prayer, offered for the departed.

460.speaker: speaker_kaisa
