460.dialogue: So, everyone you knew is gone? There’s no one left who remembers you?

470.speaker: speaker_nilah
470.dialogue: Dahlia remembers.

480.speaker: speaker_dahlia
480.dialogue: [Yee hee hee!]

490.speaker: speaker_nilah

response.dialogue: I know it’s rude, but how old are you, exactly?
Where’s the rest of your squad? Are they still around?
Is that a hyena ball? A ball that’s also a hyena?

490.dialogue: Well spoken, old friend. You are wise beyond your many, many years.

500a_10.speaker: speaker_nilah
500a_10.dialogue: My team was the seventh to be inducted. In our day, we were quite the heroes.

500a_30.speaker: speaker_nilah
500a_30.dialogue: Far too old for high school! Hahaha!

500b_10.speaker: speaker_nilah
500b_10.dialogue: Sadly, most are gone. The Twilight Star claimed one. Two were lost in a legendary battle for the fate of the universe… though that’s a tale for another day.

500b_20.speaker: speaker_nilah
500b_20.dialogue: One remains. Though I haven’t seen him in almost a thousand years… I assume he’s still out there somewhere, slaying monsters to prove his strength.

500b_30.speaker: speaker_nilah
500b_30.dialogue: He was always a proud one.

500c_10.speaker: speaker_nilah
500c_10.dialogue: She’s more hyena than ball, but it’s an apt description.

500c_30.speaker: speaker_nilah
500c_30.dialogue: Of course you’re a great warrior. We’re all very impressed.

510.speaker: speaker_nilah
510.dialogue: Ah, I wasn’t supposed to answer another question! Well played, Kai’Sa.

520.speaker: speaker_kaisa
520.dialogue: Th-thanks. You make me really nervous.

530.speaker: speaker_nilah
530.dialogue: Ha! Luxanna Crownguard mentioned I might intimidate you. I was hoping she’d be right!

540.speaker: speaker_kaisa
540.dialogue: Luxanna… Do you mean Lux? You know Lux?!

550.speaker: speaker_nilah
550.dialogue: Who do you think asked me to train you?

560.speaker: speaker_kaisa
560.dialogue: I… I… What’s she like?! Did she say anything else?! What did—?

570.speaker: speaker_nilah
570.dialogue: Another time, Kai’Sa. It is my job to prepare you for the many threats you will face.

580.speaker: speaker_nilah
580.dialogue: Remember: Do well and win knowledge. Hahaha!

590.speaker: speaker_kaisa
590.dialogue: Nilah…

600.speaker: speaker_kaisa
600.dialogue: Alright, time to nail some training.

10.speaker: speaker_nilah
10.dialogue: Kai’Sa! Why are you letting your guard down?

20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
20.dialogue: I’m not letting you through again! I can… huff… I can still fight!

30.speaker: speaker_nilah
30.dialogue: Good! Let our battle sing across time and space! Let this day mark the awakening of your inner power!

40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
40.dialogue: Ugh! How are you… so strong… I’ve never felt anything like this...!

50.speaker: speaker_kaisa
50.dialogue: N-no! I won’t stay down! You won’t stop me, no matter how powerful you are!

60.speaker: speaker_nilah
60.dialogue: Yes! I am Nilah of the Seventh Layer! My joy is endless, my bliss eternal! And you, worthy enemy, are done!

70.speaker: speaker_kaisa
70.dialogue: Aaaaaagh!!!

80.speaker: speaker_nilah
80.dialogue: Kai’Sa? Kai’Sa? If you’re dead, Lux will be very angry with me.

90.speaker: speaker_kaisa
90.dialogue: Ow… What happened? Did I win?

100.speaker: speaker_akali
100.dialogue: You got smoked, bro.

110.speaker: speaker_nilah
110.dialogue: You did, in fact, get “smoked, bro.”

120.speaker: speaker_nilah
120.dialogue: Ah, much better.

130.speaker: speaker_nilah
130.dialogue: Your father asked some awkward questions about the uniform. I told him I work at Café Cuties… and it seemed to convince him. I think.

140.speaker: speaker_nilah

response.dialogue: Oh, you met my dad?
Nobody saw us battling it out, did they? We can’t risk our identities being exposed.
How did you talk to my dad… if you’re my dad?

140.dialogue: I did have to sing a fairly horrible theme song. Taliyah and Sona helped. It was… not my proudest victory, but a victory nonetheless.

150a_10.speaker: speaker_nilah
150a_10.dialogue: I did. Kassadin is a good man. You are very lucky to have him.

150b_10.speaker: speaker_nilah
150b_10.dialogue: Don’t worry. Your training area is impressively remote, considering the view of the city. Your secrets are safe.

150c_10.speaker: speaker_akali
150c_10.dialogue: I’m sorry, what did you say?

150c_20.speaker: speaker_nilah
150c_20.dialogue: If I was physically capable of frowning, I would frown at you. Consider this my smile-frown.

160.speaker: speaker_akali
160.dialogue: Yeah, yeah, Kassadad, whatever. Nilah, what was that magic?! It looked like you could cut a mountain in half!

170.speaker: speaker_nilah
170.dialogue: That, Akali, is the power of joy.

180.speaker: speaker_kaisa
180.dialogue: The power of… joy? I thought you were a Star Guardian?

190.speaker: speaker_nilah
190.dialogue: I am indeed a Star Guardian, now an Outer Guardian. But the light is not my only strength.

200.speaker: speaker_nilah
200.dialogue: Long ago, I faced a creature not unlike your Fiddlesticks… a fallen guardian, or perhaps something more. By then, it was impossible to tell.

210.speaker: speaker_nilah
210.dialogue: So great was its hunger that it threatened to devour the cosmos itself. A dark being of twisted, unnatural bliss… the Star of Joy, Ashlesh.

220.speaker: speaker_akali
220.dialogue: The Star of… Joy? I thought there were only two stars… First and Twilight.

230.speaker: speaker_nilah
230.dialogue: Many stars shine in the skies above. The First Star is a part of the universe itself… a natural and benevolent light that touches all things.

240.speaker: speaker_nilah
240.dialogue: Then there are the pretender stars. Stars born from the hearts of guardians and other powerful entities… Twilight is one. Joy was another. I know for certain there are more.

250.speaker: speaker_kaisa
250.dialogue: Ashlesh… That’s the monster that your squad faced, right? But… I thought you killed it?

260.speaker: speaker_nilah
260.dialogue: In a sense. Before it was slain, I was tainted by its cosmic joy. I succumbed to it at first, but successfully fought my way back. Now, the power is mine… as is the threat it poses.

270.speaker: speaker_akali
270.dialogue: Whoa… So you're, like, a monster? You could turn evil and kill us all?

280.speaker: speaker_kaisa
280.dialogue: Kali!

290.speaker: speaker_akali
290.dialogue: What? She kind of is a monster… right?

300.speaker: speaker_nilah
300.dialogue: Ha! Not quite a monster, I’m afraid. There are others like me. The guardian Xayah, I believe, has a similar power after her brush with Zoe.

310.speaker: speaker_nilah
310.dialogue: Just as there are many powerful threats across the universe, there are powerful forces of good. Each balances the other. From this conflict, my joy endures.

320.speaker: speaker_nilah
320.dialogue: [Mumbling.]

330.speaker: speaker_nilah
330.dialogue: And there we are. Sated again, for now.

340.speaker: speaker_akali
340.dialogue: You’re awesome, Nilah.

350.speaker: speaker_akali
350.dialogue: Spar with me next! I want to face the power of a star monster!

360.speaker: speaker_kaisa
360.dialogue: Kali! That’s an Outer Guardian! You can’t say stuff like that!

370.speaker: speaker_nilah
370.dialogue: Oh? And why not?

380.speaker: speaker_akali

response.dialogue: It’s rude! What if she called you a star monster?
Star Guardians should always respect their elders!
That’s my dad you’re talking to!

380.dialogue: Yeah, Kai? Why not?

390a_10.speaker: speaker_akali
390a_10.dialogue: Am I a hot star monster, or a scary star monster?

390a_20.speaker: speaker_nilah
390a_20.dialogue: Whichever one is more fun for you.

390b_10.speaker: speaker_nilah
390b_10.dialogue: Always? That’s funny. You’re very funny.

390b_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
390b_20.dialogue: What? Is that not how we’re supposed to operate?

390b_30.speaker: speaker_nilah
390b_30.dialogue: Not even a little. Star Guardian recruits are almost always teenagers. Insubordination… Drama… It all comes with the territory.

390c_10.speaker: speaker_nilah
390c_10.dialogue: I don’t understand. Do you need another father figure? You have an actual father.

390c_20.speaker: speaker_akali
390c_20.dialogue: She’s desperate for Lux’s approval, and you’ve talked to Lux at least once. It’s this weird mentor-student thing.

390c_40.speaker: speaker_nilah
390c_40.dialogue: That explains all this… Star Guardian merchandise?! I have some uncomfortable questions about the state of this planet.

410.speaker: speaker_nilah
410.dialogue: It’s funny. I’ve fought alone for a long, long time. And with each victory over a great opponent, my reputation among the guardians has grown.

420.speaker: speaker_nilah
420.dialogue: Yet precious few know the true me. Most who did are gone… a fact I’ve learned to accept. Embrace, even.

430.speaker: speaker_nilah
430.dialogue: You two have a special bond of friendship. Whether you realize it or not, you are each other’s lights, and reason to fight on against all odds.

450.speaker: speaker_kaisa
450.dialogue: That is…!

460.speaker: speaker_nilah
460.dialogue: Ha! Let your feud go on a little longer. Time and shared trials will do you wonders.

470.speaker: speaker_nilah
470.dialogue: Tell me, have you ever faced a monster so titanic it blots out the sky? Or an enemy so insidious that you cannot escape it no matter where you turn?

480.speaker: speaker_kaisa
480.dialogue: Morgana?

490.speaker: speaker_akali
490.dialogue: Fiddlesticks?

500.speaker: speaker_nilah
500.dialogue: Two powerful opponents, but I mean physically large. Gigantic. Epic in scale and ferocity.

510.speaker: speaker_kaisa
510.dialogue: Uh… not yet… I don’t think...?

520.speaker: speaker_nilah
520.dialogue: Excellent!

530.speaker: speaker_akali
530.dialogue: Oh, I don’t like that look.

540.speaker: speaker_kaisa
540.dialogue: Nilah, what are you planning on doing?! Isn’t that your “excited about giant monsters” face?

550.speaker: speaker_nilah
550.dialogue: Is it? I only have the one expression. Nuance sometimes escapes me.

560.speaker: speaker_nilah
560.dialogue: I have devised another lesson for your squad—one that will engage me as much as it does you.

570.speaker: speaker_kaisa
570.dialogue: Wait, no! You can’t lure any giant monsters into the city!

580.speaker: speaker_akali
580.dialogue: Y-yeah! There are some lines even I won’t cross! Hot monsters? Sure. Scary? Definitely. But giant? People could get hurt!

590.speaker: speaker_nilah
590.dialogue: Ah, look at the time. I must be off.

600.speaker: speaker_kaisa
600.dialogue: Nilah! H-hey! This isn’t how we’re supposed to train!

610.speaker: speaker_akali
610.dialogue: We're gonna have to fight a huge monster, aren’t we?

620.speaker: speaker_kaisa
620.dialogue: I really, really hope not.

10.speaker: speaker_kaisa
10.dialogue: Th-that’s...!

20.speaker: speaker_quinn
20.dialogue: How are we supposed to beat this thing?! We’re not strong enough...!

30.speaker: speaker_rell
30.dialogue: Show me whatcha got, coward! I’ve been ready to die since the day I was born!

40.speaker: speaker_unknown
40.dialogue: GYAOOOOOOON

50.speaker: speaker_kaisa
50.dialogue: Wow, we didn’t stand a chance.

60.speaker: speaker_nilah
60.dialogue: Omega Gromp suffers no fools, Kai’Sa. That’s why he’s Omega, and you are not.

70.speaker: speaker_rell
70.dialogue: Stupid VR machine! You made me lag! I got stream sniped! My headset disconnected!

80.speaker: speaker_kaisa
80.dialogue: It doesn’t lag, we’re not streaming, and the headset is literally tied to your head.

90.speaker: speaker_rell
90.dialogue: I just can’t believe I got melted by his stupid acid spit! It’s the slowest projectile in the game! It’s slower than the concept of slow! I’m so… freaking…

100.speaker: speaker_rell
100.dialogue: OVER THIS!

110.speaker: speaker_kaisa
110.dialogue: How is every member of this squad a toxic gamer? Literally all of you. I feel like we should talk about this.

120.speaker: speaker_nilah
120.dialogue: You’re very skilled, Rell! If you trusted your comrades a bit more, you’d be nearly unstoppable.

130.speaker: speaker_rell
130.dialogue: Ugh, I just hate losing! And in front of Nilah?! I just met her and she’s already my role model!!

140.speaker: speaker_nilah
140.dialogue: I like her! She is learning to open her heart.

150.speaker: speaker_kaisa
150.dialogue: I like her too.

160.speaker: speaker_kaisa
160.dialogue: But what exactly are we supposed to be learning? How to die over and over in a video game?

170.speaker: speaker_nilah
170.dialogue: Ekko told me this is the most advanced combat simulator on the market. If you can’t figure out how to beat virtual giant monsters as a team…

180.speaker: speaker_nilah

response.dialogue: What do you mean by “really nasty?”
As captain, I forbid you from endangering this city.
You're Rell's role model? I've been trying to be her role model for WEEKS!

180.dialogue: …then I could always attract a real monster into the downtown core. A really nasty one. And believe me, I really, really want to fight a giant monster.

190a_10.speaker: speaker_nilah
190a_10.dialogue: Imagine a creature so twisted by darkness that looking at it is like throwing your unprotected mind into the core of the sun.

190a_20.speaker: speaker_nilah
190a_20.dialogue: Its shadow swallows the entire sky. Each footstep is a cataclysm on par with a globe-spanning extinction event, wiping out millions of innocents without so much as a thought.

190a_30.speaker: speaker_nilah
190a_30.dialogue: I fight monsters like these all the time. And I can find another one for us to take on, if you like.

190b_10.speaker: speaker_nilah
190b_10.dialogue: Heh. You wish to force me into submission?

190b_30.speaker: speaker_nilah
190b_30.dialogue: If I recall correctly, you didn’t fare so well last time… and I was holding back. Care to try again at my full strength? I’d love the practice.

190c_10.speaker: speaker_nilah
190c_10.dialogue: Perhaps you tried too hard, Kai'Sa. Being a role model comes with experience.

190c_20.speaker: speaker_nilah
190c_20.dialogue: And I've experienced... centuries. I've seen hundreds, no, thousands of Star Guardians just like you rise against the dark, only to be snuffed out like candles in a hurricane.

190c_30.speaker: speaker_nilah
190c_30.dialogue: I’ve survived, and whether you like it or not, I’ve been charged with making sure you don’t vanish into the screaming abyss like all those who came before.

200.speaker: speaker_kaisa
200.dialogue: Wow! That’s extremely horrifying!

210.speaker: speaker_nilah
210.dialogue: Why are you smiling if it’s horrifying?

220.speaker: speaker_kaisa
220.dialogue: I don’t know! I’m really intimidated right now! Why did you sound so happy when you said those terrible, terrible things?

230.speaker: speaker_nilah
230.dialogue: I’m glad you asked! Hundreds of years ago, a joy monster erased my other emotions.

240.speaker: speaker_kaisa
240.dialogue: Great! Awesome! Ekko, how are we doing so far?! Please feel free to jump in as quickly as possible...!

250.speaker: speaker_ekko
250.dialogue: I’ve reprogrammed Omega Gromp to be extremely aggressive and twice as strong. Been kinda breezy, if I’m being honest.

260.speaker: speaker_ekko
260.dialogue: I don’t think the average Arcade World employee cares too much about what I’m doing. Or… about anything else.

270.speaker: speaker_kaisa
270.dialogue: Good. Nilah is getting that look in her eye when she senses a good fight, and she’s, uh… saying some very dark stuff? So we should probably start soon.

280.speaker: speaker_ekko
280.dialogue: One extra difficult VR boss encounter, coming up.

290.speaker: speaker_kaisa
290.dialogue: Alright, team! This time we walk away with the win! Put your headsets on, and pair up.

300.speaker: speaker_nilah
300.dialogue: I can’t wait to get in there. Let’s see what you’ve all learned.

310.speaker: speaker_ekko
310.dialogue: Starting instance! Three, two, one...!

320.speaker: speaker_unknown
320.dialogue: Promise me you’ll teach them, Nilah. Until our fight is over… promise me you won’t let them fall.

330.speaker: speaker_nilah
330.dialogue: You know I can’t do that. It’s not within my power.

340.speaker: speaker_unknown
340.dialogue: Please, won’t you try? You’re so strong… and their light… it’s in terrible danger…

350.speaker: speaker_unknown
350.dialogue: If you could go back and save your friends… wouldn’t you...?

370.speaker: speaker_nilah
370.dialogue: Alright, Luxanna Crownguard. I’ll teach them. I promise.

380.speaker: speaker_kaisa
380.dialogue: W…what?! This isn’t the simulation!

390.speaker: speaker_nilah
390.dialogue: Relax, Kai’Sa. I spoke with Ekko beforehand. You’re supposed to be seeing this.

410.speaker: speaker_nilah
410.dialogue: Are fighting a level-900 Omega Gromp. It’s probably not going well, but you never know.

420.speaker: speaker_kaisa

response.dialogue: Where are we, exactly?
Is that a little baby planet? It’s so cute!
I’m sorry about the “you being my dad” stuff. Please don’t kill me.

420.dialogue: Then...

430a_10.speaker: speaker_nilah
430a_10.dialogue: This is my little pocket of the universe. That right there? That’s my home.

430a_30.speaker: speaker_nilah
430a_30.dialogue: It’s all that I need. A place to sit, a few good books, a cup of tea, and silence.

430b_10.speaker: speaker_nilah
430b_10.dialogue: I’m glad you think so. It’s a place I come to in order to rest and refocus.

430b_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
430b_20.dialogue: I didn’t expect it to look like this…

430b_30.speaker: speaker_nilah
430b_30.dialogue: A true warrior doesn’t need much. Just a few essentials, and a little quiet.

430c_10.speaker: speaker_nilah
430c_10.dialogue: Ha! It was a little strange, but then again… we’re all a bit off, aren’t we?

430c_30.speaker: speaker_nilah
430c_30.dialogue: That’s the spirit. Embrace your differences, and you won’t need anything else in the world.

450.speaker: speaker_nilah
450.dialogue: …this, I promise.

460.speaker: speaker_kaisa
460.dialogue: Hmm? Promise what?

470.speaker: speaker_nilah
470.dialogue: The truth is, I’m not a teacher. I’m not someone who can tell you how to be a better Star Guardian or how the organization works…

480.speaker: speaker_nilah
480.dialogue: …But I can teach you how to endure.

490.speaker: speaker_nilah
490.dialogue: “Star Guardians burn bright, but are destined to fall.” Isn’t that the saying?

500.speaker: speaker_nilah
500.dialogue: You will give everything, Kai’Sa. This is only the beginning. There will be more threats, and more tragedies, and losses you cannot even begin to imagine.

510.speaker: speaker_nilah
510.dialogue: This is all I have left. A chunk of rock in a distant, lifeless galaxy… a handful of books… and no one.

520.speaker: speaker_nilah
520.dialogue: Almost everyone I’ve ever loved is long gone. Nilah isn’t even my real name. The stories of me conquering legendary villains? They’ve replaced the person I once was.

530.speaker: speaker_nilah
530.dialogue: My days as a young girl… the smile on my mother’s face… I see them in half-formed dreams, yet feel only the weight of this accursed joy.

540.speaker: speaker_kaisa
540.dialogue: Nilah…

550.speaker: speaker_nilah
550.dialogue: Don’t weep for me, Kai’Sa. Despite the loss, the danger, and the constant recitations, I face my future with a smile!

560.speaker: speaker_nilah
560.dialogue: There is much more to do and see! More lives to change, more foes to face! Friends to fight side by side with, against overwhelming odds!

570.speaker: speaker_nilah
570.dialogue: We cannot divert from the path we have taken, and we cannot regain what was lost… but we can enjoy what we have, when we have it, and hold it close.

580.speaker: speaker_nilah
580.dialogue: Hold your friends close, Kai’Sa. Hold them close, and know that darkness will always find you, no matter what form it may take… and try to wrest them away.

590.speaker: speaker_nilah
590.dialogue: Yet, despite all this… do not be afraid to find your joy, and endure.

600.speaker: speaker_nilah
600.dialogue: Do you understand?

610.speaker: speaker_kaisa
610.dialogue: I think I do, Nilah. Thank you.

620.speaker: speaker_nilah
620.dialogue: Good! Then this little excursion wasn’t a waste.

630.speaker: speaker_kaisa
630.dialogue: It wasn’t, Nilah. You’re extremely terrifying sometimes, but thanks… for looking out for us. I mean it.

640.speaker: speaker_nilah
640.dialogue: It is no trouble at all, Kai’Sa.

650.speaker: speaker_nilah
650.dialogue: You and your friends… Stick together, and I think you’ll be alright.

660.speaker: speaker_kaisa
660.dialogue: You’re one of us too, y’know! We’re all stuck with each other now, no matter what you say.

670.speaker: speaker_nilah
670.dialogue: Ha! I know. I was just waiting for you to admit it.

680.speaker: speaker_nilah
680.dialogue: Consider your promise kept, Luxanna Crownguard.

690.speaker: speaker_nilah
690.dialogue: Buuuut… maybe I’ll stick around a while longer. You know… just to see what happens next.

10.speaker: speaker_prof_okamoto
10.dialogue: …Thank you for presenting, Leith.

20.speaker: speaker_prof_okamoto
20.dialogue: The story I heard was full of interesting moments. Let this be a lesson, class: Everyone’s life is engaging and unique in its own ways.

30.speaker: speaker_akali
30.dialogue: Wait, Green Thumb Leith has an interesting life? Leith, Prince of the Greenhouse?

40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
40.dialogue: Kali! Those are group text nicknames! What if he hears you?!

50.speaker: speaker_akali
50.dialogue: So what? He talked about potted plants for like fifteen minutes. If I must suffer, then he must suffer.

60.speaker: speaker_kaisa
60.dialogue: Ugh, true.

70.speaker: speaker_kaisa
70.dialogue: Who knew there were so many types of bean plants? And when he got into root systems and cross pollination…

80.speaker: speaker_kaisa
80.dialogue: I guess not everyone can have a life as exciting as ours.

90.speaker: speaker_prof_okamoto
90.dialogue: That’s all for today, class. Next week, we’ll be starting with… hm… looks like we have Akali—

100.speaker: speaker_akali
100.dialogue: Groan.

120.speaker: speaker_kaisa
120.dialogue: Jokes on you. I finished my presentation two weeks ago. Guaranteed A. Though I could always touch it up a little…

130.speaker: speaker_prof_okamoto
130.dialogue: And… Quinn! Alright, everyone. See you bright and early next week.

140.speaker: speaker_akali
140.dialogue: Quinn… Why do I know that name?

150.speaker: speaker_kaisa
150.dialogue: Are you serious? She just joined our… you know… “study group.”

160.speaker: speaker_akali
160.dialogue: Wait… one of the new kids?

170.speaker: speaker_kaisa
170.dialogue: Yeah, the falconer. Reserved, sort of old fashioned… uh…

180.speaker: speaker_kaisa
180.dialogue: …B-bird?

190.speaker: speaker_akali
190.dialogue: Bird? Quinn’s defining characteristic is “bird?”

200.speaker: speaker_kaisa
200.dialogue: …I’ve been busy helping the rest of you! Stop enjoying this!

210.speaker: speaker_quinn
210.dialogue: …Professor?

220.speaker: speaker_prof_okamoto
220.dialogue: Yes, Quinn?

230.speaker: speaker_quinn
230.dialogue: Could we present as a group? I’d really prefer—

240.speaker: speaker_prof_okamoto
240.dialogue: No, I’m sorry Quinn. Only you can tell your story. I don’t want to go over this again.

250.speaker: speaker_prof_okamoto
250.dialogue: Feel free to work with your friends. Didn’t I see you making some new ones the other day?

270.speaker: speaker_quinn
270.dialogue: Of course, professor. Sorry to bother you.

280.speaker: speaker_akali
280.dialogue: So… what are you two gonna talk about?

290.speaker: speaker_kaisa
290.dialogue: Hmm. We can’t exactly mention our… extracurricular activities… at the school.

300.speaker: speaker_akali
300.dialogue: Oh, like that’s ever stopped you before.

310.speaker: speaker_akali
310.dialogue: HEY EVERYONE, KAI’SA AND I ARE—

320.speaker: speaker_kaisa
320.dialogue: SHHHHH!

330.speaker: speaker_akali
330.dialogue: Oh, c’mon. I wasn’t gonna say it.

340.speaker: speaker_kaisa
340.dialogue: Obviously, I can’t talk about family.

350.speaker: speaker_kaisa
350.dialogue: …So I’m planning on sticking to life before the oath.

360.speaker: speaker_quinn
360.dialogue: Hi, Kai’Sa! Hi, Akali! Are you talking about Star Guardian stuff?

370.speaker: speaker_akali
370.dialogue: Yeah, Kai. Are we?

380.speaker: speaker_kaisa
380.dialogue: Uh… we try not to talk about it at school too much.

390.speaker: speaker_akali
390.dialogue: Don’t want to give away our secret identities. It’s a whole thing.

400.speaker: speaker_quinn
400.dialogue: Doesn’t your squad have masks? I haven’t seen any so far, but I dunno. Maybe fake sunglasses? A super long scarf?

410.speaker: speaker_kaisa
410.dialogue: Uh… well… not really…

420.speaker: speaker_quinn
420.dialogue: Then what secret identity are you protecting?

430.speaker: speaker_kaisa
430.dialogue: T-that’s..! You..!

440.speaker: speaker_akali
440.dialogue: I love this conversation. I love it more than I have ever loved anything.

450.speaker: speaker_kaisa
450.dialogue: …A-ahem! So, Quinn… was there something you wanted to talk about? Other than Star Guardian stuff, I mean.

460.speaker: speaker_quinn
460.dialogue: Do I talk about Star Guardian stuff too much?

470.speaker: speaker_kaisa
470.dialogue: No, not at all! Though we haven’t hung out much without Rell being there too.

480.speaker: speaker_quinn
480.dialogue: Well, she’s my best friend. Back home, it was just the two of us fighting for the First Star. You two... you get it, right?

490.speaker: speaker_akali
490.dialogue: Hmm.

510.speaker: speaker_kaisa
510.dialogue: But we both realized… We don't really know much about you.

520.speaker: speaker_akali
520.dialogue: We know you like birds! So that’s one thing.

530.speaker: speaker_quinn
530.dialogue: I don’t like all birds. Just this one.

540.speaker: speaker_valor
540.dialogue: [Chirp!]

550.speaker: speaker_kaisa
550.dialogue: About that… How did you get permission to bring a raptor to school?

560.speaker: speaker_quinn
560.dialogue: I don’t think the administration minds. He scares all the pests away, so nobody brings it up.

570.speaker: speaker_kaisa
570.dialogue: Ah, that’s where Chiizu went. Hmm...

580.speaker: speaker_kaisa

response.dialogue: Where are you from again?
What do you think of history class?
Can your bird do any tricks?

580.dialogue: [...I should ask Quinn more about herself.]

590a_10.speaker: speaker_quinn
590a_10.dialogue: It’s a small town. You’ve probably never heard of it.

590a_20.speaker: speaker_akali
590a_20.dialogue: I dunno, Kai is pretty good with geography. Right, Kai?

590a_30.speaker: speaker_kaisa
590a_30.dialogue: All I know is that it’s pretty far down the rail line. And that Rell will only talk about how much of a dump it was.

590a_40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
590a_40.dialogue: But… I’d love to know what you think about your town!

590b_10.speaker: speaker_quinn
590b_10.dialogue: It’s fine, I guess. I definitely didn’t think I’d have to talk about my own history.

590b_20.speaker: speaker_quinn
590b_20.dialogue: I’m… not really much of a public speaker. Never really had to back home, you know?

590b_30.speaker: speaker_kaisa
590b_30.dialogue: Come on! I’m sure you’ll do great!

590c_10.speaker: speaker_quinn
590c_10.dialogue: Valor is… not really a show bird. Or even really a bird. He just looks like a bird.

590c_20.speaker: speaker_quinn
590c_20.dialogue: He doesn’t like games, either. More of the serious type. We used to scout the neighborhood in my old town.

590c_30.speaker: speaker_akali
590c_30.dialogue: He’s super serious! Like you, Kai!

600.speaker: speaker_kaisa
600.dialogue: Speaking thereof…

610.speaker: speaker_kaisa
610.dialogue: Would you want to work on our presentations together? Maybe meet up at the cafe tomorrow?

620.speaker: speaker_quinn
620.dialogue: Y-yeah! That sounds great!

630.speaker: speaker_akali
630.dialogue: I thought we were gonna work together, Kai. You know, as a unit.

640.speaker: speaker_kaisa
640.dialogue: We can all work together. Think of it as… a team bonding exercise.

660.speaker: speaker_quinn
660.dialogue: Would it be okay if I invite Rell?

670.speaker: speaker_rell
670.dialogue: I’ll be there, Q.

680.speaker: speaker_kaisa
680.dialogue: Oh. Alright then.

690.speaker: speaker_kaisa
690.dialogue: Look at that. We’ve got our own study group!

700.speaker: speaker_akali
700.dialogue: Nope. This sucks.

710.speaker: speaker_kaisa
710.dialogue: Kali! Come on! Aw, man…

720.speaker: speaker_quinn
720.dialogue: W-we don’t have to go! Rell and I know everything there is to know about our hometown!

730.speaker: speaker_quinn
730.dialogue: …Ugh. I’m sorry. Sorry if things have been weird since we got here, Kai’Sa.

740.speaker: speaker_kaisa
740.dialogue: You mean between Akali and I? No, we were having problems before you two got here—

750.speaker: speaker_quinn
750.dialogue: We just don’t want to be an intrusion. You have your team, and you already all know each other so well… I don’t want to cause any problems.

760.speaker: speaker_kaisa
760.dialogue: That’s not gonna happen. You’re not a burden, you’re our friend… If anything, Akali is mad at me. She probably thinks you’re incredible because you burned me on the mask thing.

770.speaker: speaker_quinn

response.dialogue: Maybe I can give you a tour!
They’re not so different once you get used to ’em!
Because we lack funding for falconry classes?

770.dialogue: A-alright, thanks. Things are just so different here in the city… A new squad, a new life… new social landmines. I feel like it’s all moving so fast.

790.speaker: speaker_quinn
790.dialogue: I’m just… not so sure I fit in here.

800.speaker: speaker_kaisa
800.dialogue: Just give it time, Quinn. VC is a lot, but I’m sure you’ll get used to it!

810.speaker: speaker_quinn
810.dialogue: If you say so. I’ll… I’ll see you at the cafe.

830.speaker: speaker_kaisa
830.dialogue: Akali aside, Quinn was mentioning her old town more than I thought she would.

10.speaker: speaker_kaisa
10.dialogue: [So Akali didn’t show after all…]

20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
20.dialogue: [Which means it’s just Quinn and me…]

30.speaker: speaker_rell
30.dialogue: Hey, K. What’s good here?

40.speaker: speaker_kaisa

response.dialogue: Their croissants are pretty tasty.
They have the best matcha ever!
Anything with peach in it. There are like, six peach things.

40.dialogue: [Oh. And her bestie, Rell.]

50.speaker: speaker_rell
50.dialogue: Yeah… I think I’ll pass.

60.speaker: speaker_quinn
60.dialogue: Rell generally prefers places that have ranges of peppers on their menu.

70.speaker: speaker_rell
70.dialogue: Anything under three peppers is coward food.

80.speaker: speaker_kaisa
80.dialogue: …Cool.

90.speaker: speaker_rell
90.dialogue: So you guys are partners on some school thing?

100.speaker: speaker_quinn
100.dialogue: No—not really.

110.speaker: speaker_kaisa
110.dialogue: We each have to give a presentation about our life. We’re just working together.

120.speaker: speaker_rell
120.dialogue: And you’re gonna tell them how we punch monsters so hard they explode, right?

130.speaker: speaker_kaisa
130.dialogue: We can’t talk about being Star Guardians.

140.speaker: speaker_rell
140.dialogue: Why not? In Kiiso, we did it all the time.

150.speaker: speaker_quinn
150.dialogue: Uh… No, we didn’t.

160.speaker: speaker_rell
160.dialogue: I did.

170.speaker: speaker_kaisa
170.dialogue: What… What happened?

180.speaker: speaker_rell
180.dialogue: Nothing. No one believed me.

190.speaker: speaker_quinn
190.dialogue: Valoran City isn’t like Kiiso though. We can’t reveal our identities. We—

200.speaker: speaker_rell
200.dialogue: Hold that thought, Q.

210.speaker: speaker_rell
210.dialogue: The students at the corner table appear to be in a heated argument about “Beastman Chronicles: the Pitmaster Saga!” I better make sure this doesn’t turn violent!

220.speaker: speaker_kaisa
220.dialogue: It sort of just seems like a friendly disagreement -

230.speaker: speaker_rell
230.dialogue: I’ll keep an eye on them K! For Star Guardian reasons! Not because their conversation is interesting to me in any way!

240.speaker: speaker_kaisa
240.dialogue: … So your hometown. It’s called Kiiso?

250.speaker: speaker_quinn
250.dialogue: Yeah. We both grew up there, but didn’t speak too much before she took the oath.

260.speaker: speaker_kaisa
260.dialogue: Oh, really?

270.speaker: speaker_quinn
270.dialogue: We… came from different social circles. You’ll have to ask her about it.

280.speaker: speaker_quinn
280.dialogue: Plus, with her being younger…

300.speaker: speaker_quinn
300.dialogue: …She means well. She really does.

310.speaker: speaker_kaisa
310.dialogue: Oh, I didn’t mean anything by it!

320.speaker: speaker_kaisa
320.dialogue: Rell is… sweet.

330.speaker: speaker_quinn
330.dialogue: It’s hard for her to open up to people. But once you get to know her, she’ll always be there for you.

340.speaker: speaker_kaisa
340.dialogue: I believe that.

350.speaker: speaker_quinn
350.dialogue: Back in Kiiso, we’d take on HUGE monsters, dozens of them, just the two of us. There was no one I’d rather have in my corner.

360.speaker: speaker_kaisa
360.dialogue: I’m surprised you even get monsters all the way out there.

370.speaker: speaker_quinn
370.dialogue: Valoran City isn’t the only place that needs defending.

380.speaker: speaker_kaisa
380.dialogue: Of course. I—

390.speaker: speaker_quinn
390.dialogue: I had to train her. Alone. And Rell has… issues… with authority figures.

400.speaker: speaker_quinn
400.dialogue: All I had to go on were Lux’s quotes in the Official Star Guardian Daily Planner. And I don’t think most of them are authentic.

410.speaker: speaker_kaisa
410.dialogue: Oh! I have one of those. Mine is… more full than I would like.

420.speaker: speaker_quinn
420.dialogue: Do you have the Ahri Erasable Pen too?

430.speaker: speaker_kaisa
430.dialogue: No, I wish. It—

450.speaker: speaker_kaisa
450.dialogue: Yeah… and it matches the Daily Planner so well…

460.speaker: speaker_kaisa
460.dialogue: Sorry, Quinn. I know fighting alone for so long wasn’t easy for you.

470.speaker: speaker_quinn
470.dialogue: Oh, it wasn’t all bad.

480.speaker: speaker_quinn
480.dialogue: Kiiso was our home. It had our friends, our family… I was happy to protect it.

490.speaker: speaker_kaisa
490.dialogue: You really miss it, don’t you?

510.speaker: speaker_kaisa
510.dialogue: Before I was a Star Guardian… things were simpler. I remember when a day at the mall was an adventure.

520.speaker: speaker_quinn
520.dialogue: I remember when the scariest monster I’d ever seen was just in a movie at the cineplex.

530.speaker: speaker_kaisa
530.dialogue: Ha! One year my dad took me to see Night of the Xer’Sai, and I couldn’t sleep for a month.

540.speaker: speaker_kaisa
540.dialogue: I used to get pretty scared.

550.speaker: speaker_quinn

response.dialogue: Of course! It’s not weak to be afraid.
I mean, I would never cover my eyes or anything. At least not all the way…
Yeah, I hated the old High Noon Gothic movies. Those demons are freaky.

550.dialogue: Really? You got scared?

560a_10.speaker: speaker_quinn
560a_10.dialogue: I guess… sometimes you have to be strong for other people. Even when everything changes.

560a_20.speaker: speaker_quinn
560a_20.dialogue: I just wish I didn’t always have to, you know? It would make things a lot easier…

560b_10.speaker: speaker_quinn
560b_10.dialogue: Yeah… you have to learn to keep the fear inside. People here are counting on us to be brave… and everyone back home, too.

560b_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
560b_20.dialogue: Is that why you wear a mask?

560b_30.speaker: speaker_quinn
560b_30.dialogue: Oh, uh… no. I just think it looks really cool. And it hides my identity.

560b_40.speaker: speaker_quinn
560b_40.dialogue: Not sure why you still don’t wear one. Eventually somebody will catch on.

560c_10.speaker: speaker_quinn
560c_10.dialogue: Oh! The one where the cow-skull devil fights the half-demon cowboy?

560c_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
560c_20.dialogue: Yeah, and in the sequel, there’s a mechanical angel. Pretty sure they just released a new one about a train heist, but it looks really scary…

560c_30.speaker: speaker_quinn
560c_30.dialogue: High Noon Gothic 4: Devil of the Sulfur Rail! Rell’s already seen it six times. Apparently, this one guy explodes… so it might not be the movie for me.

560c_40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
560c_40.dialogue: Or me. I’m fine with my regular Star Guardian night terrors, thanks.

570.speaker: speaker_kaisa
570.dialogue: You know, Quinn… it’s okay to let us know you’re scared. Otherwise, they’ll never feel safe… not even around you.

580.speaker: speaker_quinn
580.dialogue: Did you read that one in the Daily Planner?

590.speaker: speaker_kaisa
590.dialogue: No, that’s a Kai’Sa original.

600.speaker: speaker_quinn
600.dialogue: Ha! Straight from the source!

610.speaker: speaker_quinn
610.dialogue: I don’t know how you do it… School and a full team of guardians. Plus, I heard you were all at the Battle of the Twilight Star… We only saw it on the news.

620.speaker: speaker_quinn
620.dialogue: I struggled with just one guardian! And zero giant invasions!

630.speaker: speaker_kaisa
630.dialogue: Sometimes, I’m not so sure I am doing it. Things fall through the cracks… People get hurt.

640.speaker: speaker_kaisa
640.dialogue: You saw what happened with Akali. That’s been going on since the school year started.

650.speaker: speaker_quinn
650.dialogue: Hhrm. Well, I’m sure you’ll handle it.

660.speaker: speaker_quinn
660.dialogue: It seems like you always do.

670.speaker: speaker_quinn
670.dialogue: I miss home a lot, of course… and everyone there. But talking to you… I feel a little better, I think. Just seeing you rise above the situation.

680.speaker: speaker_kaisa
680.dialogue: I guess I—

690.speaker: speaker_rell
690.dialogue: Q. K. The situation has been handled. Did you finish your homework?

700.speaker: speaker_quinn
700.dialogue: Oh! Actually, we haven’t even—

710.speaker: speaker_rell
710.dialogue: You said you’d go to the mall with me today.

740.speaker: speaker_quinn
740.dialogue: Rell, calm down! Haha! A promise is a promise.

750.speaker: speaker_rell
750.dialogue: I knew I could count on you, Q! We better head over now! You know how long those lines get!

780.speaker: speaker_kaisa
780.dialogue: Yeah, I get it. The things we do for our squads.

790.speaker: speaker_quinn
790.dialogue: Rell will tell you about her secret hobby eventually. But I want to let her do it on her own terms, ya know?

800.speaker: speaker_kaisa
800.dialogue: Of course. Have fun, you two!

810.speaker: speaker_quinn
810.dialogue: Thanks! It was nice talking about, you know, everything!

830.speaker: speaker_kaisa
830.dialogue: Minor grammar error here. And this should be an ellipsis… Move this image over to here…

840.speaker: speaker_kaisa
840.dialogue: Not that I would ever… want to do… double the homework…

10.speaker: speaker_akali
10.dialogue: And that… that would be for me to decide.

20.speaker: speaker_prof_okamoto
20.dialogue: …I, uh…

30.speaker: speaker_prof_okamoto
30.dialogue: Thank you, Akali.

40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
40.dialogue: Woo! Great job, Kali!

50.speaker: speaker_akali
50.dialogue: You can stop applauding now. I totally bombed up there.

60.speaker: speaker_kaisa
60.dialogue: Just showing my support for the mad bomber.

70.speaker: speaker_akali
70.dialogue: Heh. That’s good. I’m keeping that one.

80.speaker: speaker_prof_okamoto
80.dialogue: Quinn, you’re up next.

90.speaker: speaker_akali
90.dialogue: Oh, yeah. How’d prep go with your new study buddy?

100.speaker: speaker_kaisa
100.dialogue: Not great, actually. We weren’t very productive.

110.speaker: speaker_akali
110.dialogue: Oh, noooo. Did her bird eat her homework?

120.speaker: speaker_kaisa
120.dialogue: …You know, she’s actually very nice.

130.speaker: speaker_kaisa
130.dialogue: And she’s one of us now, so be cool.

140.speaker: speaker_akali
140.dialogue: I’m being serious. Did her bird—?

150.speaker: speaker_prof_okamoto
150.dialogue: Akali! Your presentation is over. Please, be quiet.

160.speaker: speaker_akali
160.dialogue: …Lame.

170.speaker: speaker_quinn
170.dialogue: Ahem. Hi. I’m Quinn.

180.speaker: speaker_kaisa
180.dialogue: [C’mon, Quinn. You got this.]

190.speaker: speaker_quinn
190.dialogue: I know I’m still pretty new here, and many of you don’t know me…

200.speaker: speaker_quinn
200.dialogue: But I hope that you will soon.

210.speaker: speaker_quinn
210.dialogue: I spent my whole life in one small town surrounded by huge, sprawling mountains…

220.speaker: speaker_quinn
220.dialogue: Its name is Kiiso.

230.speaker: speaker_quinn
230.dialogue: It’s the kind of place where everyone knows each other… No matter where you go, there’s always a familiar face.

240.speaker: speaker_quinn
240.dialogue: To me, it’s a place where promises are never broken and friendships last a lifetime.

250.speaker: speaker_quinn
250.dialogue: It was… a fairytale. But fairytales always end.

260.speaker: speaker_quinn
260.dialogue: My academics were strong enough that I was moved to an accelerated learning program. So… I ended up coming to VC, and leaving Kiiso behind.

270.speaker: speaker_quinn
270.dialogue: My family, most of my friends, and all the memories I’d made there with them… I thought I’d left them all behind. It… it really scared me.

280.speaker: speaker_quinn
280.dialogue: I… I thought that my life was over. It was tough to adjust, and in a lot of ways, it still is.

290.speaker: speaker_quinn
290.dialogue: But I found a new life here, in Valoran City. New friends, new adventures…

300.speaker: speaker_quinn
300.dialogue: And it’s just the beginning…

310.speaker: speaker_kaisa
310.dialogue: I really liked your story.

320.speaker: speaker_quinn
320.dialogue: Thanks. I was pretty nervous.

330.speaker: speaker_kaisa
330.dialogue: Really?! You didn’t seem nervous at all!

340.speaker: speaker_quinn
340.dialogue: Oh, yeah. I got some good public-speaking advice from a friend.

350.speaker: speaker_kaisa
350.dialogue: …From me?

360.speaker: speaker_quinn
360.dialogue: No, from Rell. She said to picture the entire class as a “pack of evil deer” and myself as a brave warrior defending the Valoran City Park…

370.speaker: speaker_kaisa
370.dialogue: That sounds like Rell.

380.speaker: speaker_quinn
380.dialogue: It does, haha! That type of thing would only work for her.

390.speaker: speaker_quinn
390.dialogue: I just pictured everyone as the scary, non-deer monsters we’ve been facing.

400.speaker: speaker_quinn
400.dialogue: And I pretended I had the team at my side. Rell, of course, featured heavily. When she’s riding Sebastien, she’s, like, eight feet tall.

410.speaker: speaker_kaisa
410.dialogue: I understand. Sometimes, being a Star Guardian can be easier than being…

420.speaker: speaker_quinn
420.dialogue: …Yourself.

430.speaker: speaker_kaisa
430.dialogue: ...Yeah.

440.speaker: speaker_quinn
440.dialogue: This oath we took… it bonds us for life. Shine bright, only to burn out.

450.speaker: speaker_quinn
450.dialogue: It’s scary… but it’s good, you know?

460.speaker: speaker_quinn
460.dialogue: Friendship can be so fleeting. One day you wake up… and it’s gone.

470.speaker: speaker_kaisa
470.dialogue: You’ll always remember the friends you left behind in Kiiso.

480.speaker: speaker_quinn
480.dialogue: Every day. Not because of all the good times we had…

490.speaker: speaker_quinn
490.dialogue: But because of all the good times we didn’t get to have. You know?

510.speaker: speaker_kaisa
510.dialogue: I mean—I still see her every day. But it’s different.

520.speaker: speaker_quinn

response.dialogue: We used to sing together at karaoke.
Reading the new chapters of this webtoon she loves.
I just liked laughing with her. It was so easy before.

520.dialogue: What do you miss the most?

530.speaker: speaker_quinn
530.dialogue: You don’t think that can happen again?

540.speaker: speaker_kaisa
540.dialogue: I don’t know. I just know that growing up is a drag.

550.speaker: speaker_quinn
550.dialogue: Put that quote in the next Star Guardian Daily Planner.

560.speaker: speaker_kaisa
560.dialogue: Ooh. Being quoted in there would be awesome.

570.speaker: speaker_quinn
570.dialogue: Too bad they don’t take open submissions.

580.speaker: speaker_quinn
580.dialogue: I have a whole list of quotes, though they probably need some work.

590.speaker: speaker_kaisa
590.dialogue: Aww… I never thought I’d turn down an opportunity to proofread, but I think we have bigger problems to worry about.

600.speaker: speaker_quinn
600.dialogue: I suppose my dreams of becoming a published author can wait until AFTER we face Morgana.

610.speaker: speaker_quinn
610.dialogue: … There’s no going back to the way things were, is there?

620.speaker: speaker_kaisa
620.dialogue: No, not for us.

630.speaker: speaker_kaisa
630.dialogue: We’re the only people that will ever understand what it’s like…

640.speaker: speaker_kaisa
640.dialogue: …to hold the fate of the universe in our hands.

650.speaker: speaker_quinn

response.dialogue: You can always talk to me.
Sometimes, it’s best to deal with it alone.
You might say he’s a little… bird-brained? Eh? Ehhhh?

650.dialogue: Yeah. I try to talk to Valor about this stuff, but he’s not a great conversationalist.

660a_10.speaker: speaker_quinn
660a_10.dialogue: Thanks. You’re easy to talk to.

660a_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
660a_20.dialogue: I try really hard to be.

660a_30.speaker: speaker_quinn
660a_30.dialogue: You don’t need to try. You’re a pro.

660b_10.speaker: speaker_quinn
660b_10.dialogue: Yeah, I guess I need time to process my thoughts.

660b_20.speaker: speaker_quinn
660b_20.dialogue: Otherwise, my words come out all “bleh.”

660c_10.speaker: speaker_quinn
660c_10.dialogue: Hey! He’s really sensitive about those kinds of jokes.

660c_30.speaker: speaker_kaisa
660c_30.dialogue: Sometimes, I don’t think before I speak. It’s… gotten me into trouble before.

660c_40.speaker: speaker_quinn
660c_40.dialogue: Really? Me, too! I’ll just talk, and it comes out all “bleh.” But you…

670.speaker: speaker_quinn
670.dialogue: …You seem like you always have things under control.

680.speaker: speaker_kaisa
680.dialogue: Guess you’re not the only one who wears a mask.

690.speaker: speaker_quinn
690.dialogue: Ha! Valor liked that one.

700.speaker: speaker_quinn
700.dialogue: I mean… I did too. Not as much. You have to work on your delivery.

710.speaker: speaker_kaisa
710.dialogue: Could I… feed Valor? I’ve always been curious… and he seems so hard to approach…

730.speaker: speaker_quinn
730.dialogue: I like to take him out here and let him fly around.

740.speaker: speaker_quinn
740.dialogue: It’s as close to Kiiso as we can get.

750.speaker: speaker_kaisa
750.dialogue: I like it here, too. It calms me down when I’m feeling overwhelmed.

760.speaker: speaker_kaisa
760.dialogue: You can see all of Valoran City… the winding streets, the giant skyscrapers…

770.speaker: speaker_kaisa
770.dialogue: It’s beautiful in its own way.

10.speaker: speaker_student
10.dialogue: I - I didn’t do anything wrong. I swear!

20.speaker: speaker_student
20.dialogue: Seriously! I was just kidding around!

30.speaker: speaker_rell
30.dialogue: Ah, so you’re a bully AND a liar?

40.speaker: speaker_rell
40.dialogue: I saw you picking on that group of first-years. C’mon, you can do better. Why not try fighting somebody with years of hardened physical training and an undeniable thirst for justice?

50.speaker: speaker_student
50.dialogue: I ONLY PICK ON YOUNGER STUDENTS BECAUSE I’M INCREDIBLY INSECUREEEEE!

60.speaker: speaker_kaisa
60.dialogue: I heard screaming! What’s going on?

70.speaker: speaker_rell
70.dialogue: Hey K — about time you showed up.

80.speaker: speaker_rell
80.dialogue: I was just showing this kid the consequences of being a grade-A dirtbag.

90.speaker: speaker_student

response.dialogue: Rell, let him go right now!
There’s a crowd gathering. Drop him before you get us in trouble.
Hand him over. I wanna take a swing.

90.dialogue: GAHHHH! KAI’SA! HELP! SHE’S GOT ME IN A SUPER-MEGA CHOKEHOLD! JUST LIKE THE ONE THE KING USED ON THOSE SOLDIERS IN “DERELICT EMPEROR #275”!

100.speaker: speaker_rell
100.dialogue: Just doing what we’re supposed to do, K. Defending the innocent!

120.speaker: speaker_rell
120.dialogue: I’m gonna let you go, kid. But you better apologize to those first-years, and your apology better be super-mega sincere!

130.speaker: speaker_student
130.dialogue: I PROMISE! I’ll NEVER HURT ANOTHER SOUL! AHHHHHH!!!

140.speaker: speaker_rell
140.dialogue: See? He’s totally reformed.

150.speaker: speaker_rell
150.dialogue: Another win for good guys.

160.speaker: speaker_kaisa
160.dialogue: Rell, you shouldn’t waste your time on bullies like him. We’re Star Guardians. We have bigger threats to face.

170.speaker: speaker_rell
170.dialogue: Star Guardians are supposed to protect people.

180.speaker: speaker_rell
180.dialogue: If I didn’t stop that kid, who would?

190.speaker: speaker_kaisa
190.dialogue: I - I don’t know. The teachers?

200.speaker: speaker_rell
200.dialogue: You don’t really believe that. One of our teachers is straight-up evil. And you know I don’t mean in the assigns-too-much-homework kinda way.

210.speaker: speaker_rell
210.dialogue: C’mon - deep down I bet you wanted to take a swing at him too.

220.speaker: speaker_kaisa
220.dialogue: As captain, I have to lead by example. And my example is -

230.speaker: speaker_rell
230.dialogue: Wait, were you gonna quote from the Star Guardian Daily Planner? Q’s always repeating the one about “the true power of friendship” or whatever! That reminds me…!

240.speaker: speaker_kaisa
240.dialogue: Rell! Come back! You dropped your book!

250.speaker: speaker_kaisa
250.dialogue: … Is this a manga?

260.speaker: speaker_kaisa
260.dialogue: “Derelict Emperor #282”...

270.speaker: speaker_rell
270.dialogue: Lux… so you’re the one Q thinks has ALL the answers.

280.speaker: speaker_kaisa
280.dialogue: Rell… hff, hff, wait up!

290.speaker: speaker_rell
290.dialogue: Oh hey, K. Just talking to this statue here. Q says the two of you do it all the time.

300.speaker: speaker_kaisa
300.dialogue: What? She told you that? I don’t talk to statues! … Fine, you caught me. But normally I do my talking when I’m NOT wearing my Star Guardian uniform.

310.speaker: speaker_rell
310.dialogue: Oh! Oops! I was just showing her the new versions of the uniforms. And she was totally agreeing that they are much cooler than the old ones. Silently, of course.

320.speaker: speaker_rell
320.dialogue: Back to normal - see? Don’t worry! There’s no way anybody saw me transform!

330.speaker: speaker_man
330.dialogue: W-was that a Star Guardian transformation just now?

340.speaker: speaker_woman
340.dialogue: I think it was! Right over by the Lux statue!

350.speaker: speaker_rell
350.dialogue: Oh no! They're onto us!

360.speaker: speaker_kaisa
360.dialogue: Rell! Hey - ! … I never returned her book…

370.speaker: speaker_rell
370.dialogue: Cool place, T! I mean… I like the food, but all the costumes and storylines are a bit confusing…

380.speaker: speaker_taliyah
380.dialogue: Um, could you call me Tali? Or Taliyah?

390.speaker: speaker_rell
390.dialogue: Sorry, let me try that again.

410.speaker: speaker_taliyah
410.dialogue: A-ah, much better… Oh, my order number’s up! I should go get it!

420.speaker: speaker_kaisa
420.dialogue: Rell… why are you pretending like you don’t get this place? I bet you’d love it if you gave it a chance. The storyline isn’t any more complicated than this manga you’ve been reading…

430.speaker: speaker_rell
430.dialogue: Hey… why do you have my copy of “Derelict Emperor”! I mean - uh - what is that? I’ve never seen that before! I have to go! Never speak of this!

440.speaker: speaker_ekko
440.dialogue: Oh, shoot. Looks like I’m next on the VALORANT cabinet. Catch ya later!

450.speaker: speaker_kaisa
450.dialogue: Wow, I can’t believe Ekko lets you play VALORANT with him. Everytime I try to join, he says the red gun is broken and he calls dibs on the blue gun.

460.speaker: speaker_rell
460.dialogue: Yeah - Ekko’s alright. Honestly, your whole team is pretty cool, K. Uh… I-I’m gonna go on patrol.

470.speaker: speaker_rell
470.dialogue: K, does that deer look suspicious to you? Like it’s going to attack that small child?

480.speaker: speaker_kaisa
480.dialogue: Um… no?

490.speaker: speaker_rell
490.dialogue: OH NO! It just made that baby drop their ice-cream cone! And now they’re crying! UNACCEPTABLE. Hey, Sebastien!

510.speaker: speaker_rell
510.dialogue: Time to teach that buck a lesson!

520.speaker: speaker_sebastien
520.dialogue: [Proud whinny.]

530.speaker: speaker_kaisa
530.dialogue: Wait - what? Sebastien! RELL!

540.speaker: speaker_kaisa
540.dialogue: I’ve never even heard of someone being kicked out of the park…

550.speaker: speaker_rell
550.dialogue: I’m really sorry about that. You know how I get around injustice.

560.speaker: speaker_rell
560.dialogue: On the bright side…Sebastien totally won that fight! That deer will think twice before trying to get a lick of Freljordian FreeZ ever again!

570.speaker: speaker_kaisa
570.dialogue: Rell, I hate injustice as much as you do… but you have to learn that your actions have consequences.

580.speaker: speaker_rell
580.dialogue: This isn’t just about the deer, is it? Because that thing was a menace.

590.speaker: speaker_kaisa
590.dialogue: No, it’s not just about the deer.

600.speaker: speaker_rell

response.dialogue: You’ll alienate everyone around you, and it’ll hurt the team.
I can’t fix everything you mess up.
When that deer charged me, I saw my entire life flash before my eyes.

600.dialogue: It’s just hard for me not to help when I see someone in trouble.

610a_10.speaker: speaker_rell
610a_10.dialogue: I would never purposefully put your friends in danger.

610a_30.speaker: speaker_rell
610a_30.dialogue: I told Q I’d be no good on a team.

610b_10.speaker: speaker_rell
610b_10.dialogue: It’s just… I’m just used to being with Quinn. And she kind of lets me do my own thing.

610b_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
610b_20.dialogue: Working together isn’t always going to be… well… a walk in the park, Rell. But we have to give it a try!

610b_30.speaker: speaker_rell
610b_30.dialogue: I don’t know if I can… or if I want to.

610c_10.speaker: speaker_rell
610c_10.dialogue: An evil space deer? I wouldn’t put it past her. I bet she’s got squirrells listening in on our conversation right now!

610c_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
610c_20.dialogue: Maybe we should speak in code?

610c_30.speaker: speaker_rell
610c_30.dialogue: I appreciate you trying to make me feel better, K. But I got you kicked out of your favorite park. Looks like I’M the menace, not the deer.

620.speaker: speaker_rell
620.dialogue: I’m just better off alone. Just me - and also Quinn - and Valor and Sebastien sometimes - against the world.

630.speaker: speaker_kaisa
630.dialogue: That doesn’t sound very alone to me. You sure you don’t want to talk -

640.speaker: speaker_rell
640.dialogue: Why does EVERYTHING I do end up hurting people? I can’t keep letting people down! First my parents—and now…

660.speaker: speaker_rell
660.dialogue: Forget it…

670.speaker: speaker_rell
670.dialogue: It’s nothing personal, K. I can’t let anybody get close, not again.

680.speaker: speaker_rell
680.dialogue: I have to go. I… need some space.

690.speaker: speaker_kaisa
690.dialogue: Rell…

700.speaker: speaker_kaisa
700.dialogue: What aren’t you telling me?

10.speaker: speaker_quinn
10.dialogue: Hmm. So you want to find Rell when she doesn’t want to be found…

20.speaker: speaker_quinn
20.dialogue: There is one place…

30.speaker: speaker_mall_mascot
30.dialogue: How do you do, young lady! I’m a real-life Star Guardian! Nice to meet ya!

40.speaker: speaker_rell
40.dialogue: WAGH! What in the world?!

50.speaker: speaker_mall_mascot
50.dialogue: Guh! Right in the gemstones!

60.speaker: speaker_rell
60.dialogue: Oh no… I didn't mean to hurt you! You can’t sneak up on me like that…

80.speaker: speaker_kaisa
80.dialogue: Why would Rell be here -

90.speaker: speaker_kaisa
90.dialogue: Uh sir, are you… rolling around in the fetal position?

100.speaker: speaker_mall_mascot
100.dialogue: Yeah…no big deal… completely my fault…

110.speaker: speaker_kaisa
110.dialogue: Yeah I’m sure she had her reasons…

120.speaker: speaker_kaisa
120.dialogue: But I wonder if Rell being here has anything to do with that book I found…

130.speaker: speaker_kaisa
130.dialogue: What was its name again?

140.speaker: speaker_mall_mascot
140.dialogue: It’s… Derelict… Emperor… release day…

150.speaker: speaker_kaisa
150.dialogue: That’s it! The manga! She must be here to visit the comic shop.

160.speaker: speaker_kaisa
160.dialogue: But I thought only the crazy hardcore fans wait in line for preorders. Like, crazy crazy. Taliyah crazy.

170.speaker: speaker_kaisa
170.dialogue: If that’s true, then that can only mean…

180.speaker: speaker_rell
180.dialogue: It’s finally mine! Derelict Emperor volume two hundred and eighty-six, fully colorized and translated! Plus, it comes with a trading card.

190.speaker: speaker_rell
190.dialogue: In this volume, Derelict Emperor uses the Heart of Camavor as a catalyst, unlocking his ultimate special attack right before the fated showdown with Dread Sentinel Gwenlodias…

200.speaker: speaker_rell
200.dialogue: And he, uh… you know… he…

response.dialogue: …You’re a massive otaku.
Hi, Rell. Whatcha reading?
I don’t wanna spoil anything, but I heard Gwenlodias is the sister of Sir Skarner.

220.speaker: speaker_rell
220.dialogue: C-c-can I speak with you privately?!

230.speaker: speaker_kaisa
230.dialogue: Lead the way.

240.speaker: speaker_kaisa
240.dialogue: This collection is ridiculous. And these are just the ones you could fit in your backpack? How many manga volumes do you own?!

250.speaker: speaker_rell
250.dialogue: Whatever I could have shipped to VC. These are some of the rarer editions… plus any I’ve picked up since I moved.

260.speaker: speaker_kaisa
260.dialogue: Battle Academia…Steel Valkyries…the Pentakill comics?! I thought these sold out the minute they were listed!

270.speaker: speaker_rell
270.dialogue: They did. I ordered in the first three seconds.

280.speaker: speaker_kaisa
280.dialogue: Can I borrow it? I promise I’ll give it back.

300.speaker: speaker_rell
300.dialogue: You know… I used to have a lot more manga… some really good ones. But…

310.speaker: speaker_rell
310.dialogue: …my parents found them last year, and, uh, threw them away. What you’re seeing is what I was able to hide.

320.speaker: speaker_kaisa
320.dialogue: Wait, why would they throw your stuff away?

330.speaker: speaker_rell
330.dialogue: I dunno. Mom and dad had big expectations for me, I guess. Our town is small, but a lot of powerful political families have roots there.

340.speaker: speaker_rell
340.dialogue: I had to do exactly what they told me so they could get well connected, you know? Horseback riding, student government, being quiet at boring benefit dinners…

350.speaker: speaker_rell
350.dialogue: And if I did anything they didn’t like… well…

360.speaker: speaker_rell
360.dialogue: …they’d chase off my friends. Give away my stuff. Send me away for entire summers. I could never get close to anyone…

370.speaker: speaker_kaisa
370.dialogue: That’s so awful. I assume your parents don’t keep in touch.

380.speaker: speaker_rell
380.dialogue: Nah.

390.speaker: speaker_rell
390.dialogue: After a while, I couldn’t take the pressure. I just wanted to be able to be myself…my true self.

400.speaker: speaker_rell
400.dialogue: Turns out being my true self wasn’t good enough for them. I was a “huge embarrassment” that “wasted her unlimited potential.”

410.speaker: speaker_rell
410.dialogue: I’m actually grateful they shipped me off to VC. I needed a fresh start, away from Kiiso.

420.speaker: speaker_rell
420.dialogue: But here… I figure it’s best not to make new friends. That way, it’s harder to disappoint anyone.

430.speaker: speaker_rell
430.dialogue: Quinn knows where I come from. She understands… that I’m always just trying to do what’s right. And that if I push people away, it’s only to protect them.

response.dialogue: I understand you, Rell.
You’re part of a squad now, and we’ll all look out for you.
What’s this comic..? “That Time I Was Transported to the Spirit World”?

450a_20.speaker: speaker_rell
450a_20.dialogue: Normally, I’d get really defensive right now. Just an FYI. I’m not great with new… uh… friends.

450a_30.speaker: speaker_rell
450a_30.dialogue: I don’t know you too well yet… so just… give me time, alright?

450b_20.speaker: speaker_rell
450b_20.dialogue: I just hope Tali and E feel the same way…

450b_30.speaker: speaker_rell
450b_30.dialogue: figured if I kept you at a distance, it would make things easier. Rookie mistake.

450c_10.speaker: speaker_rell
450c_10.dialogue: Are you… unfamiliar with this masterwork of modern literature?

450c_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
450c_20.dialogue: I usually only read assigned textbooks…

450c_30.speaker: speaker_rell
450c_30.dialogue: So, the story takes place in this fantasy world where a mild-mannered festivalgoer falls into the realm of the spirits…

450c_40.speaker: speaker_rell
450c_40.dialogue: And then… Er, we can talk about this later. In one volume, this snake lady crushes the protagonist, and it is explicit, if you know what I mean.

460.speaker: speaker_kaisa
460.dialogue: Rell… you don’t need to be so hard on yourself. You’re cool. We WANT to be your friend.

470.speaker: speaker_kaisa
470.dialogue: How about we make a deal?

480.speaker: speaker_rell
480.dialogue: A deal? What kind of deal?

490.speaker: speaker_kaisa
490.dialogue: You be the most authentic Rell you can be. Defend first years, talk to statues, defend babies from evil space deers… No matter what, I’ll stand by your side.

500.speaker: speaker_rell
500.dialogue: I like where this is going.

510.speaker: speaker_kaisa
510.dialogue: But in exchange… you open up to us. Let us be a part of your life.

520.speaker: speaker_rell
520.dialogue: Okay… maybe I like this a little less…

530.speaker: speaker_kaisa
530.dialogue: … Even the part of your life that includes secretly reading manga.

540.speaker: speaker_rell
540.dialogue: MANGA?! I have no clue what you’re talking about!

550.speaker: speaker_kaisa
550.dialogue: Rell! You literally just showed me your collection.

560.speaker: speaker_rell
560.dialogue: Sorry, sorry. Force of habit.

570.speaker: speaker_rell
570.dialogue: Hmm…I dunno if I can keep my part of the deal. There’s a reason I don’t have too many friends, K.

580.speaker: speaker_rell
580.dialogue: My family has resources to reach me anywhere. Who’s to say I won’t lose all of you…that I’ll lose Quinn…

590.speaker: speaker_kaisa
590.dialogue: Let them try to scare us off! We aren’t going anywhere.

600.speaker: speaker_rell
600.dialogue: You mean it? Even with all my baggage? You’re really sure you want me around?

610.speaker: speaker_kaisa
610.dialogue: No one is perfect. And I’m sure.

620.speaker: speaker_rell
620.dialogue: Heh. Okay. Let me think about it, alright?

630.speaker: speaker_rell
630.dialogue: In the meantime, wanna read Derelict Emperor? His only weakness is scorpions, but so far, nobody knows that… except for the Crystal Knight, Sir Skarner.

640.speaker: speaker_rell
640.dialogue: I ship them for completely normal reasons. You can’t tell anybody, and that doesn’t count as part of our deal.

660.speaker: speaker_rell
660.dialogue: K, get ready to reach a state of pure enlightenment.

10.speaker: speaker_student
10.dialogue: I - I didn’t do anything wrong. I swear!

20.speaker: speaker_student
20.dialogue: Don’t hurt me! I’m just a small cat with big responsibilities!!!

30.speaker: speaker_rell
30.dialogue: You think THAT’S what Battle Principal Yuumi would say to a God-Weapon? Have you even watched her spin-off series?! She fears nothing!

40.speaker: speaker_rell
40.dialogue: Battle Principal Yuumi has the highest God-Weapon affinity of anyone at Durandal Academy. She even fought back the Praetorian invasion in Chapter 112: Danger! Parallel Future Robot Uprising!

50.speaker: speaker_student
50.dialogue: It may be partially retconned, but I think Battle Instructor Graves is hiding a way higher affinity level! Also, I’m more of a dog person!

60.speaker: speaker_kaisa
60.dialogue: I got here as fast as I could! Point me to the—

70.speaker: speaker_rell
70.dialogue: Heya, K. How’s it hanging?

80.speaker: speaker_kaisa
80.dialogue: It’s going… fine. Were you talking about manga? In public?!

90.speaker: speaker_student
90.dialogue: Yeah, we’ve been debating Battle Academia. Are you… a fan, perchance?

100.speaker: speaker_kaisa
100.dialogue: Oh, uh… I don’t know that one. But hey, I got caught up on Derelict Emperor!

110.speaker: speaker_rell

response.dialogue: I was not expecting them to destroy Helia with the Prevailing Mist Beam.
Kinda surprised by that crossover with Café Cuties.
Hecarabius will be my 2D husband. I will be his 3D wife.

110.dialogue: Yes! What did you think of the Hecarabius fight?

120.speaker: speaker_rell
120.dialogue: Right?! We gotta talk about it later. Plus, I just picked up this new manga about a guy who’s sad because he kills everything he touches. It’s awesome.

130.speaker: speaker_kaisa
130.dialogue: Y-yep. See you around!

140.speaker: speaker_student
140.dialogue: Later, Kai’Sa! Okay. One choice, ultimate deathmatch. Gun Goddess or Bullet Angel?

150.speaker: speaker_rell
150.dialogue: Come on, this is troll. Gun Goddess’ AI is so much more advanced! It surpasses the Battle Angel chassis’ superior firepower in every way. Get real. Next question.

160.speaker: speaker_rell
160.dialogue: … And then Sebastien charged forward with the power of a thousand stars!

170.speaker: speaker_kaisa
170.dialogue: Talking to Lux again?

180.speaker: speaker_kaisa
180.dialogue: I honestly didn’t think it’s something you’d keep up with.

190.speaker: speaker_rell
190.dialogue: I can do anything I put my mind to!

200.speaker: speaker_rell
200.dialogue: Even if that involves talking to a statue, loudly recounting Star Guardian stories in broad daylight.

210.speaker: speaker_man
210.dialogue: Keep going! I need to hear what happens next in your totally fictional story!

220.speaker: speaker_woman
220.dialogue: Yeah, don’t leave us hanging!

230.speaker: speaker_kaisa
230.dialogue: Don’t mind me, sorry to interrupt!

240.speaker: speaker_rell
240.dialogue: … The monster looked down at Sebastien. “THIS?! This is the best you Star Guardians could muster?! A tiny horse?!” But Sebastien was no ordinary horse…

250.speaker: speaker_sebastien
250.dialogue: [Whinny.]

260.speaker: speaker_rell
260.dialogue: Sebastien! … Uh! Nothing to see here folks, just my cat in high-quality cosplay.

270.speaker: speaker_rell
270.dialogue: So you’re saying the Cuties protect their tea shop from giant monsters… who just want to come in and have some tea?!

280.speaker: speaker_taliyah
280.dialogue: Yes! Ohmygosh, have you gotten the Berry Swirl Cake? It comes with an exclusive crossover card for Monster Tamers!

290.speaker: speaker_rell
290.dialogue: I must have it! Order three of them!

300.speaker: speaker_kaisa
300.dialogue: [Wow, those two are really getting along...]

310.speaker: speaker_ekko
310.dialogue: I’m locking Phoenix.

320.speaker: speaker_rell
320.dialogue: I’m locking Yoru.

330.speaker: speaker_ekko
330.dialogue: I’m going A.

340.speaker: speaker_rell
340.dialogue: I’ll cover.

350.speaker: speaker_ekko
350.dialogue: SMOKED THEM! OH! DID YOU SEE THAT?! DO YOU SEE WHAT YOU GET WHEN THE TIME LORD IS UPON YOU?!

360.speaker: speaker_rell
360.dialogue: YEAH, OTHER TEAM, GO CRY TO YOUR MOM! I DON’T CARE IF YOU’RE TWELVE! THERE’S NO MERCY IN VIDEO GAMES!

370.speaker: speaker_kaisa
370.dialogue: [First Tali, now Ekko… She’s opening up to everyone!]

380.speaker: speaker_kaisa
380.dialogue: I don’t know… I don’t see it.

390.speaker: speaker_rell
390.dialogue: Their eyes are totally glowing a dark, evil purple. Those aren’t normal deer eyes. And that one just stole that woman’s purse!

400.speaker: speaker_rell
400.dialogue: C’mon, you promised I could be my authentic self. And that means defending this park from a bunch of semi-wild animals.

410.speaker: speaker_kaisa
410.dialogue: … wait, that deer really IS running away with some woman’s purse…

420.speaker: speaker_rell
420.dialogue: HEY, MR. PARK RANGER! YOU’RE JUST IN TIME! THIS DEER HAS A REALLY STRONG GRIP, BUT IF WE TUG TOGETHER, I BET WE CAN PRY THE PURSE FREE!

430.speaker: speaker_kaisa
430.dialogue: Guess we won’t get kicked out this time… no more miscommunication about “fighting wildlife unprompted.”

440.speaker: speaker_rell
440.dialogue: That man just made me an honorary Park Ranger. Said he’d never seen a kid tackle a deer before.

450.speaker: speaker_kaisa
450.dialogue: Of course he did.

460.speaker: speaker_rell

response.dialogue: Yes! It was an experience I’ll never forget.
Are you kidding? We should be hanging out all the time.
Authentic Rell confuses and inspires me. I like her a lot.

460.dialogue: So? How was hanging out with the authentic me? Still interested in keeping me around?

470a_10.speaker: speaker_rell
470a_10.dialogue: In a good way or a bad way?

470a_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
470a_20.dialogue: Definitely a good way. Though I’m not sure your Star Guardian uniform has any room for a Park Ranger badge.

470a_30.speaker: speaker_rell
470a_30.dialogue: Who said anything about putting it on my Star Guardian uniform? I’m wearing this thing to school!

470b_10.speaker: speaker_rell
470b_10.dialogue: Really? All the time, every day?

470b_30.speaker: speaker_rell
470b_30.dialogue: K, I’m kidding. Hanging out with you would cut into my Q time. But… maybe I’ll text you more. When I’m feeling it.

470c_10.speaker: speaker_rell
470c_10.dialogue: Ha! See, once you get to know me, I’m charming and sweet!

470c_30.speaker: speaker_rell
470c_30.dialogue: Don’t tell anyone. I kinda like being known as the mysterious loner. With friends in my corner, I can own it. I feel powerful.

480.speaker: speaker_rell
480.dialogue: Anyway, thanks for not judging me too harshly. I still have a lot to work through, but it’s nice to know I can count on you.

490.speaker: speaker_kaisa
490.dialogue: Don’t worry about it, Rell. I’m just glad you’re on our side.

520.speaker: speaker_rell
520.dialogue: I wonder… If it was so easy for you to like me, why didn’t my parents? I tried to be the person they wanted me to be…

530.speaker: speaker_rell
530.dialogue: I just don’t get it. Did I do something wrong?

540.speaker: speaker_kaisa
540.dialogue: You didn’t do anything wrong. Parents can be… complicated. They don’t always know what they want.

550.speaker: speaker_rell
550.dialogue: Yeah… I guess.

560.speaker: speaker_rell
560.dialogue: Maybe it’s more important that I like me, and that I surround myself with people who accept me for who I am: an awesome person.

570.speaker: speaker_rell
570.dialogue: It’s just… hard, you know? I don’t know if my parents and I will ever get along. Or if I even want that.

580.speaker: speaker_rell
580.dialogue: Guess you’ll all have to be my family… for now. U-until I can figure out my situation, you know?

590.speaker: speaker_kaisa
590.dialogue: I know. And you can be part of our squad as long as you need to.

600.speaker: speaker_rell
600.dialogue: Heh. Thanks.

610.speaker: speaker_rell
610.dialogue: AHEM! That's a problem for another day. Now, the last step of our agreement is upon us.

620.speaker: speaker_rell
620.dialogue: Time to hit the manga shop!

630.speaker: speaker_rell
630.dialogue: This week, they’re releasing the first volume of “My Life as an Imprisoned Star Dragon”. It’s about this star dragon who…

640.speaker: speaker_kaisa
640.dialogue: …is imprisoned in a giant mountain, and before he can get out, he has to teach a class of middle schoolers how to kill God?

650.speaker: speaker_rell
650.dialogue: YES! It’s by the same author as Super Galaxy, so you know the quality is there.

660.speaker: speaker_rell
660.dialogue: Hopefully that mascot doesn’t sneak up on me again. I wasn’t scared, he just caught me off guard. But this time -

670.speaker: speaker_mall_mascot
670.dialogue: Hey there, friends! I’m a real-life Star Guardian!

680.speaker: speaker_rell
680.dialogue: AAUUUUGH! ROGUE MASCOT ATTACK!

690.speaker: speaker_mall_mascot
690.dialogue: Gyahhh! I was just cleared to return to work!

700.speaker: speaker_kaisa
700.dialogue: Remind me to warn Nilah that this thing is a person. No reason.

710.speaker: speaker_kaisa
710.dialogue: But also… a mascot phobia? Rell, you’re full of surprises.

720.speaker: speaker_rell
720.dialogue: Hope you don’t get sick of surprising Rell facts, because I have a lot of sharing to catch up on. Now let's score that manga!

730.speaker: speaker_rell
730.dialogue: Thank you… Thank you all for being my friends. It feels like, after all this time, my heart… is finally full.

10.speaker: speaker_school_bell
10.dialogue: [RING RONG RING RONG. DING DONG DING DONG.]

20.speaker: speaker_akali
20.dialogue: Kai’Sa, is she here?

30.speaker: speaker_kaisa
30.dialogue: Nope. Late again.

40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
40.dialogue: [The school year just started…]

50.speaker: speaker_kaisa
50.dialogue: [...but Sona’s already shown up late to most of her classes.]

60.speaker: speaker_akali
60.dialogue: Eventually, Professor Chuba will notice.

70.speaker: speaker_prof_chuba
70.dialogue: Settle down, class.

90.speaker: speaker_kaisa
90.dialogue: Not today, he won’t.

100.speaker: speaker_kaisa
100.dialogue: She’s so quiet… How does she manage to move without making any noise?

110.speaker: speaker_akali
110.dialogue: This is ridiculous! I trained for so long, and Sona’s naturally that stealthy? UGH!

120.speaker: speaker_kaisa
120.dialogue: Do I sense jealousy, Akali?

130.speaker: speaker_akali
130.dialogue: I could sneak past any teacher if I wanted.

140.speaker: speaker_akali
140.dialogue: I just prefer to arrive on time.

150.speaker: speaker_prof_chuba
150.dialogue: Ahem.

160.speaker: speaker_kaisa
160.dialogue: Maybe you’d be better at sneaking if you learned to be quiet every once in a while.

170.speaker: speaker_akali
170.dialogue: Maybe bleh bleh blergh.

180.speaker: speaker_prof_chuba
180.dialogue: Yesterday, we left off talking about the different types of chemical bonds.

190.speaker: speaker_prof_chuba
190.dialogue: Can anyone tell me what a covalent bond is?

200.speaker: speaker_prof_chuba
200.dialogue: How about Kai’Sa?

210.speaker: speaker_kaisa

response.dialogue: A type of chemical bond.
I think Akali knows this one.
How about no?

210.dialogue: [Ulp! You have got to be kidding me!]

220a_10.speaker: speaker_prof_chuba
220a_10.dialogue: I mean… yes. That’s technically correct.

220a_30.speaker: speaker_prof_chuba
220a_30.dialogue: But not the answer I was looking for.

220c_10.speaker: speaker_prof_chuba
220c_10.dialogue: Are you saying you don’t know the answer?

220c_30.speaker: speaker_prof_chuba
220c_30.dialogue: No, you don’t know the answer? Or no, you know the answer?

220c_40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
220c_40.dialogue: I invoke my right to an attorney.

230.speaker: speaker_prof_chuba
230.dialogue: …A covalent bond is when two atoms share electrons.

240.speaker: speaker_prof_chuba
240.dialogue: It’s my personal favorite bond. Aside from my bond with Mrs. Chuba!

260.speaker: speaker_prof_chuba
260.dialogue: A little teacher humor there. Anybody? No? Well, moving on…

270.speaker: speaker_kaisa
270.dialogue: Okay, I mean, sure, his speech was cheesy, but the professor did sort of make me realize something.

280.speaker: speaker_akali
280.dialogue: Inertia is a property of matter?

290.speaker: speaker_kaisa
290.dialogue: Inertia is the… Were we at the same lecture?

300.speaker: speaker_akali
300.dialogue: Nope. I was on my phone. They added new levels in Hyper Crystal Dungeon Mobile.

310.speaker: speaker_kaisa
310.dialogue: I need to get to know Sona better.

320.speaker: speaker_akali
320.dialogue: How did you get that from a science class?

330.speaker: speaker_kaisa
330.dialogue: Working together, combining the best parts of a thing to make an even more powerful whole.

340.speaker: speaker_kaisa
340.dialogue: It’s just like being Star Guardians.

350.speaker: speaker_akali
350.dialogue: This again. So now you’re using chemistry as an excuse to hang out with your team?

360.speaker: speaker_kaisa
360.dialogue: Exactly.

370.speaker: speaker_akali
370.dialogue: Okay, but why Sona and not, for instance, me?

380.speaker: speaker_kaisa
380.dialogue: I already know you too well.

400.speaker: speaker_kaisa
400.dialogue: Oh! Here she comes! I’ll, uh… talk to you later!

410.speaker: speaker_akali
410.dialogue: Oh… Bye, I guess?

420.speaker: speaker_kaisa
420.dialogue: Sona!

430.speaker: speaker_sona
430.dialogue: [Sona waves politely.]

response.dialogue: How’s it hanging?
What did you think of the lecture?
Nice, uh… weather we’re having?

450.speaker: speaker_sona
450.dialogue: [Sona rotates her wrist rapidly back and forth.]

460.speaker: speaker_kaisa
460.dialogue: Does that mean so-so?

470.speaker: speaker_sona
470.dialogue: [Sona nods.]

480.speaker: speaker_kaisa
480.dialogue: Nice! We are in agreement… I think!

490.speaker: speaker_kaisa
490.dialogue: By the way… Akali and I noticed that you’ve been late to class a couple times.

500.speaker: speaker_kaisa
500.dialogue: It’s not a huge deal. As long as you aren’t late to our battles against the forces of darkness.

510.speaker: speaker_sona
510.dialogue: [Sona shakes her head.]

520.speaker: speaker_kaisa
520.dialogue: Cool, cool.

530.speaker: speaker_kaisa
530.dialogue: Well, if you want to, erm… tell me about it—what’s going on—I’m here.

540.speaker: speaker_sona
540.dialogue: [Sona signs something.]

550.speaker: speaker_kaisa
550.dialogue: [Oh, shoot. I don’t know sign language!]

560.speaker: speaker_chiizu
560.dialogue: It’s the people, Miss Kai’Sa. They’re running around like mice in a maze!

570.speaker: speaker_kaisa
570.dialogue: Chiizu?! You shouldn’t be here! You’ll give us away!

580.speaker: speaker_chiizu
580.dialogue: I’ve been here every day! To most non-guardians, I’m invisible unless they know what they’re looking for. Nobody can see me!

590.speaker: speaker_chiizu
590.dialogue: Not even you, Miss Kai’Sa! …Except for right now. When you can. Because we’re talking.

600.speaker: speaker_kaisa
600.dialogue: Interesting. Must be why nobody ever mentions the other familiars…

610.speaker: speaker_chiizu
610.dialogue: But you’re right. It’s too dangerous for me to be talking here… If anyone notices, they might focus on me. And that would blow our cover!

620.speaker: speaker_chiizu
620.dialogue: Meet Miss Sona and I at the mall. We’ll explain everything.

640.speaker: speaker_chiizu
640.dialogue: And by we, I of course mean… she! She will explain everything! I’m just a humble translator!

650.speaker: speaker_chiizu
650.dialogue: I gotta get outta here! Squeak!

660.speaker: speaker_kaisa
660.dialogue: Oh. Well, I guess I’ll meet you two… later, then? Please don’t kill each other?

670.speaker: speaker_sona
