670.dialogue: [Sona waves goodbye, then turns angrily toward Chiizu.]

680.speaker: speaker_chiizu
680.dialogue: RUN AWAY! SHE’S BRIMMING WITH RAGE!

690.speaker: speaker_student
690.dialogue: Eek!

700.speaker: speaker_another_student
700.dialogue: Professor, one of the lab rats escaped!

710.speaker: speaker_a_third_student
710.dialogue: Sona was chasing it through the hall! And I think it was wearing… glasses?!

10.speaker: speaker_kaisa
10.dialogue: [It’s sooooo early.]

20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
20.dialogue: [Why would Sona possibly want to meet at the mall now?]

30.speaker: speaker_kaisa
30.dialogue: [Half the stores are closed!]

40.speaker: speaker_sona
40.dialogue: [Sona waves.]

50.speaker: speaker_kaisa
50.dialogue: Oh! Hi, Sona! Good to see you at the… crack of dawn?

60.speaker: speaker_chiizu
60.dialogue: Good morning, Miss Kai’Sa!

70.speaker: speaker_kaisa
70.dialogue: And hello to you, Chiizu.

80.speaker: speaker_sona
80.dialogue: [Sona signs.]

90.speaker: speaker_chiizu
90.dialogue: Thank you for meeting us here so early.

100.speaker: speaker_chiizu
100.dialogue: I know it may seem strange to you, but there’s a good reason we chose this place!

120.speaker: speaker_chiizu
120.dialogue: W..what?! There is a good reason! I was just adding that part for clarity!

130.speaker: speaker_kaisa
130.dialogue: It’s fine, really! I guess we aren’t here to shop, though…

140.speaker: speaker_sona
140.dialogue: [Sona signs.]

150.speaker: speaker_chiizu
150.dialogue: "Maybe later! I was actually hoping to find some books for school."

160.speaker: speaker_kaisa
160.dialogue: Chiizu… you can read?

170.speaker: speaker_sona
170.dialogue: [Sona forms two L shapes with her hands, tracing along the form of her smile.]

180.speaker: speaker_chiizu
180.dialogue: Like I said before, I’m simply translating for Miss Sona. I have no use for academic books! They’re heavy, and very painful when thrown!

190.speaker: speaker_kaisa
190.dialogue: Right, I always forget you’re basically a magic butler.

210.speaker: speaker_chiizu
210.dialogue: It’s not funny! I’m a powerful magical being from beyond the stars, squeak!

220.speaker: speaker_chiizu
220.dialogue: Ahem… We chose this time because the mall is much less crowded.

230.speaker: speaker_chiizu
230.dialogue: And less people means less noise. Too much noise drowns out my thoughts.

240.speaker: speaker_kaisa
240.dialogue: Drowns out your… What do you mean by that?

250.speaker: speaker_chiizu
250.dialogue: It all started one year ago, almost to the day…

260.speaker: speaker_chiizu
260.dialogue: When Zoe attacked the city… Miss Sona was there. In one of the residential districts that got hit the hardest.

270.speaker: speaker_chiizu
270.dialogue: Right in the center of everything.

280.speaker: speaker_civilian
280.dialogue: [Run! Get out of the way! The stars are falling!]

290.speaker: speaker_shop_owner
290.dialogue: [Take shelter! Take shelter before… Oh, no!]

300.speaker: speaker_chiizu
300.dialogue: The destruction was deafening.

310.speaker: speaker_chiizu
310.dialogue: She couldn’t move. She couldn’t breathe.

320.speaker: speaker_chiizu
320.dialogue: Miss Sona could only watch as her neighborhood was blasted to rubble.

330.speaker: speaker_sona
330.dialogue: [Sona signs.]

340.speaker: speaker_chiizu
340.dialogue: “Screams merged with the sounds of the city. The sirens. The blaring horns.”

350.speaker: speaker_chiizu
350.dialogue: “I heard terrible things. It still rings in my ears like a dissonant chorus.”

360.speaker: speaker_chiizu
360.dialogue: That’s why Miss Sona is always late for class.

370.speaker: speaker_chiizu
370.dialogue: She waits for the rush of people to stop. Businessmen at the train station, students at the school. And of course, for the bell to stop ringing.

380.speaker: speaker_kaisa
380.dialogue: Sona… I had no idea. I’m so sorry.

410.speaker: speaker_chiizu
410.dialogue: Miss Sona says, “I’m a Star Guardian now.”

420.speaker: speaker_chiizu
420.dialogue: When she puts on the uniform… everything is easier.

430.speaker: speaker_kaisa
430.dialogue: That’s really nice to hear. I’m glad she has you by her side, Chiizu.

440.speaker: speaker_chiizu
440.dialogue: Don’t worry, Miss Kai’Sa, I’m not going anywhere! I’m brave and strong, just like Miss Sona!

450.speaker: speaker_mall_mascot
450.dialogue: Why hellooooo there!

460.speaker: speaker_chiizu
460.dialogue: AHHHHHHHHH!

470.speaker: speaker_mall_mascot
470.dialogue: Was that a— ? Hmm… nevermind.

490.speaker: speaker_mall_mascot
490.dialogue: Hi! My name is Mimi!

510.speaker: speaker_kaisa
510.dialogue: Right. All the noise must have scared her off.

520.speaker: speaker_kaisa
520.dialogue: Uh, well… Nice costume, I guess.

530.speaker: speaker_mall_mascot

response.dialogue: You’re clearly wearing a Star Guardian familiar costume.
Oh! I mean: looking good, very real familiar.
Not as good as my costume, though… You should see it! Real sparkly.

530.dialogue: Costume? Whatever do you mean?

540a_10.speaker: speaker_mall_mascot
540a_10.dialogue: No… I’m real! As real as the Star Guardians themselves!

540a_20.speaker: speaker_mall_mascot
540a_20.dialogue: Come on, man! You’re ruining it for the kids!

540b_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
540b_20.dialogue: You’re much bigger than I remember.

540b_30.speaker: speaker_mall_mascot
540b_30.dialogue: Yeah, I had a growth spurt. A normal familiar thing.

540c_10.speaker: speaker_mall_mascot
540c_10.dialogue: You have a Star Guardian costume?! I’m so jealous.

540c_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
540c_20.dialogue: Yeah, it’s no big deal… kinda tight around the haunches.

540c_30.speaker: speaker_mall_mascot
540c_30.dialogue: Bet it’s not as sweaty as this one. Plus, I can’t even take it home!

540c_40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
540c_40.dialogue: Why would you… take it… home? Actually, I don’t want to know.

550.speaker: speaker_mall_mascot
550.dialogue: Anywhoooooo…

560.speaker: speaker_mall_mascot
560.dialogue: Don’t forget! It’s Skeeball Sunday! Unlimited rounds all day, only at Arcade World!

570.speaker: speaker_kid
570.dialogue: Mommy, look! It’s Mimi!

580.speaker: speaker_mall_mascot
580.dialogue: Why hellooooo there!

590.speaker: speaker_kaisa
590.dialogue: Well that was exciting. Looks like the mall is starting to get crowded.

600.speaker: speaker_sona
600.dialogue: [Sona once more forms two Ls, tracing her smile.]

610.speaker: speaker_kaisa
610.dialogue: Ha. You can trust me, Sona. If you’re ever feeling… you know, overwhelmed, I’ll do my best to help.

620.speaker: speaker_sona
620.dialogue: [Sona nods.]

630.speaker: speaker_gamer
630.dialogue: Come on! The arcade’s opening!

640.speaker: speaker_hardcore_gamer
640.dialogue: SKEEBALL SUNDAY! LET’S GO!

660.speaker: speaker_kaisa
660.dialogue: Sona, it’ll be alright. Just take deep breaths.

670.speaker: speaker_kaisa
670.dialogue: [That’s what people say, right?]

680.speaker: speaker_sona
680.dialogue: [Sona takes in short, gasping breaths.]

690.speaker: speaker_kaisa
690.dialogue: Crap. This isn’t working.

700.speaker: speaker_kaisa
700.dialogue: Uh… Sona! Do you hear that?

720.speaker: speaker_kaisa

response.dialogue: The clang of tokens in the change machine?
The clunk of skee balls into the pocket?
The clattering of feet on the hard tile floor?

720.dialogue: Try focusing on just one sound...

730.speaker: speaker_sona
730.dialogue: [Sona pauses, listening for a second.]

750.speaker: speaker_gamer
750.dialogue: New high score! Take THAT, Omega Cypher!

800.speaker: speaker_sona
800.dialogue: [Sona winces, lowering her hands from her ears to sign.]

810.speaker: speaker_kaisa
810.dialogue: Where is Chiizu?! Ugh, that stupid mall mascot ruined everything!

10.speaker: speaker_kaisa
10.dialogue: [Okay, so my last attempt to help Sona didn’t go so hot.]

20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
20.dialogue: [But now… I’ve got a new plan of attack.]

30.speaker: speaker_monster
30.dialogue: SCREECH!

40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
40.dialogue: Oh, come on! Now, of all times?!

50.speaker: speaker_kaisa
50.dialogue: Sona! Chiizu!

60.speaker: speaker_kaisa
60.dialogue: I think we’re going to have to postpone our coffee date. Unless that gross monster likes maid cafes.

80.speaker: speaker_chiizu
80.dialogue: Of course, Miss Kai’Sa. Should we call the other guardians?

90.speaker: speaker_kaisa
90.dialogue: Hmm… This thing doesn’t seem like too big a threat. I think we can take it down.

100.speaker: speaker_sona
100.dialogue: [Sona signs.]

110.speaker: speaker_chiizu
110.dialogue: “I don’t know. He seems pretty big to me.”

120.speaker: speaker_kaisa
120.dialogue: Sona, just say the word, and I’ll call them.

130.speaker: speaker_kaisa
130.dialogue: But we can do it alone. I’ve watched you train… You’re a lot stronger than you think.

140.speaker: speaker_sona
140.dialogue: [Sona signs.]

150.speaker: speaker_chiizu
150.dialogue: Miss Sona says, “I’m not so sure.”

160.speaker: speaker_chiizu
160.dialogue: …Erm, this may not be the time… what with the monster and all… and I don’t want to editorialize again…

170.speaker: speaker_chiizu
170.dialogue: But Miss Kai’sa, there is more to Miss Sona’s story…

180.speaker: speaker_chiizu
180.dialogue: During the attack, Miss Sona couldn’t move.

190.speaker: speaker_chiizu
190.dialogue: She would have been hurt,or even killed, if not for the bravery of a boy…

200.speaker: speaker_chiizu
200.dialogue: Someone no older than us. And not one of the Star Guardians… just a boy, with no extraordinary powers.

210.speaker: speaker_unknown
210.dialogue: Look out!

220.speaker: speaker_sona
220.dialogue: [Sona signs.]

230.speaker: speaker_chiizu
230.dialogue: He… well. If she’d had the light of the First Star then… maybe he wouldn’t have had to save her. And he wouldn’t have been hurt keeping her safe.

250.speaker: speaker_chiizu
250.dialogue: I’m sorry, Miss Sona. I promise I won’t say more if you don’t want me to.

260.speaker: speaker_kaisa
260.dialogue: Sona… I’m so sorry. I had no idea. But… just because you didn’t have the power to help him then, doesn’t mean you can’t help others now.

270.speaker: speaker_kaisa
270.dialogue: Being a Star Guardian doesn’t make you brave. Being brave is what makes you a Star Guardian.

300.speaker: speaker_kaisa
300.dialogue: Oh, I know this one! Hang on, let me try this…

310.speaker: speaker_kaisa
310.dialogue: [You’re welcome.]

330.speaker: speaker_kaisa
330.dialogue: Nailed it. Now… you ready to kick monster butt?

340.speaker: speaker_monster
340.dialogue: SCREEEEEECH!

360.speaker: speaker_kaisa
360.dialogue: Ugh, the air raid siren is going off, too? Come on!

370.speaker: speaker_kaisa
370.dialogue: Wait… Sona, I was wrong before!

380.speaker: speaker_kaisa
380.dialogue: You shouldn’t try to focus on one sound.

390.speaker: speaker_kaisa
390.dialogue: And you shouldn’t try to shut them out, either!

410.speaker: speaker_kaisa

response.dialogue: That roar… it’s kinda like a cymbal, isn’t it?
The siren. It’s laying down a steady beat.
That guy playing the skinny trumpet on the street corner!

410.dialogue: You’re a composer, right? Listen to the music of the city!

420a_10.speaker: speaker_chiizu
420a_10.dialogue: I see, Miss Kai’Sa! It’s all part of a symphony!

420b_10.speaker: speaker_chiizu
420b_10.dialogue: I see, Miss Kai’Sa! It’s all part of a symphony!

420c_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
420c_20.dialogue: Is it not called the skinny trumpet?! Who told me…? Ekko. I swear, when this is over...

420c_30.speaker: speaker_chiizu
420c_30.dialogue: But I see…! It’s all part of a symphony.

430.speaker: speaker_kaisa
430.dialogue: Exactly!

450.speaker: speaker_kaisa
450.dialogue: Is it… working?

460.speaker: speaker_sona
460.dialogue: [“I hear it.”]

470.speaker: speaker_kaisa
470.dialogue: Good. Use it. Now, let’s mop up that giant freak before the cafe closes.

480.speaker: speaker_monster
480.dialogue: SCREeeeechhh!

490.speaker: speaker_monster
490.dialogue: SCR... eeeeech...

510.speaker: speaker_kaisa
510.dialogue: Ugh, I shouldn’t have said that. Burned a lot of calories out there. Now, I want cake.

530.speaker: speaker_kaisa
530.dialogue: Sona! You killed it! Literally! Your music powers are so strong!

540.speaker: speaker_chiizu
540.dialogue: Miss Sona was incredible! She was all, “Bang! Pow! Pow!” And the monster was all, “SCREEEECH!”

550.speaker: speaker_kaisa
550.dialogue: Heh. I see you’ve been hanging out with Taliyah.

560.speaker: speaker_chiizu
560.dialogue: Chu chu, star powers!

570.speaker: speaker_sona
570.dialogue: [“It was a thrilling battle, Captain.”]

580.speaker: speaker_kaisa
580.dialogue: [Sign language! And you understand it now! Okay, Kai’Sa… you got this.]

590.speaker: speaker_kaisa

response.dialogue: “You make beautiful music, Sona.”
“We should start a band. I can play the triangle!”
“Let’s get out of here before they make us clean this up.”

590.dialogue: [You’ve been practicing your signs. You’ve done your homework. The moment is perfect. Please don’t screw it up…]

600a_30.speaker: speaker_chiizu
600a_30.dialogue: Yeah, I know you understood her without me! But I’m not giving up my job! This economy is brutal!

600b_10.speaker: speaker_sona
600b_10.dialogue: [“My music is more of a solo act.”]

600b_20.speaker: speaker_chiizu
600b_20.dialogue: Sona… will think about it, Miss Kai’Sa.

600b_30.speaker: speaker_chiizu
600b_30.dialogue: See? That was interpreting for extra politeness. I’m also learning things!

600c_20.speaker: speaker_chiizu
600c_20.dialogue: Sona would like to stay. For a little while.

600c_30.speaker: speaker_chiizu
600c_30.dialogue: At least until people start to gather. Our cover can’t be blown yet, squeak!

610.speaker: speaker_kaisa
610.dialogue: I’ll just have to take your word for it, Chiizu.

620.speaker: speaker_chiizu
620.dialogue: I’m impressed, Miss Kai’Sa. Your sign language has greatly improved!

630.speaker: speaker_kaisa
630.dialogue: A captain’s got to be able to communicate with her team.

640.speaker: speaker_kaisa
640.dialogue: [“Right, Sona?”]

660.speaker: speaker_kaisa
660.dialogue: I’m here for you. We all are. I know it won’t always be easy…

670.speaker: speaker_kaisa
670.dialogue: Some days, you might not be able to handle the crowds.

680.speaker: speaker_kaisa
680.dialogue: [“But that’s okay.”]

690.speaker: speaker_kaisa
690.dialogue: [“Just take it one… note at a time.”]

700.speaker: speaker_sona
700.dialogue: [“You don’t know anything about music, do you?”]

710.speaker: speaker_kaisa
710.dialogue: I know about autotune. Does that count?

730.speaker: speaker_kaisa
730.dialogue: [“Maybe you can teach me?”]

750.speaker: speaker_chiizu
750.dialogue: Ooh! I’ll get my wood block!

760.speaker: speaker_chiizu
760.dialogue: Don’t start the lesson without me! The great wood block musician and interpreter extraordinaire, Chiizu! Squeak!

10.speaker: speaker_kaisa
10.dialogue: Taliyah?

20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
20.dialogue: Taliyah? Did anyone see where Taliyah went?

30.speaker: speaker_kaisa
30.dialogue: Taliyah? Hey, are you around here?

40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
40.dialogue: Where did she...?

60.speaker: speaker_kaisa
60.dialogue: Tali! There you are! I’ve been looking all over for you.

70.speaker: speaker_taliyah
70.dialogue: Oh! Captain! I apologize. I didn’t mean to cause you any distress.

80.speaker: speaker_taliyah
80.dialogue: What can I help you with? Hopefully nothing too troubling.

90.speaker: speaker_kaisa
90.dialogue: Uh… right…

100.speaker: speaker_kaisa
100.dialogue: You, uh… left your familiar in class…

120.speaker: speaker_taliyah
120.dialogue: Aru! You silly little thing. Captain, I apologize profusely for Aru’s behavior. Sometimes, they… wander off. I can assure you this won’t happen again.

130.speaker: speaker_aru
130.dialogue: [Beehhh.]

140.speaker: speaker_taliyah
140.dialogue: I know nobody can see them, but… if you’d like me to run extra training drills as punishment, I fully support your decision!

150.speaker: speaker_kaisa
150.dialogue: Um… That… won’t be necessary…

170.speaker: speaker_taliyah
170.dialogue: Yes? Is there anything else, Captain?

180.speaker: speaker_kaisa
180.dialogue: Nothing, I just… You’re so… different when we’re training… almost like an entirely other person.

190.speaker: speaker_taliyah
190.dialogue: Ah, yes, well...! It’s, ah… That is true…

200.speaker: speaker_taliyah
200.dialogue: I… er… Well… it’s just that… um…

210.speaker: speaker_kaisa
210.dialogue: I-I’m sorry! I didn’t mean to embarrass you! I, uh… Oh, gosh, how do I fix this?

220.speaker: speaker_taliyah
220.dialogue: N-no worries! I just think I’d rather tell you… away from school. School is kind of… a related problem.

230.speaker: speaker_kaisa

response.dialogue: How about Arcade World? I’m a crack shot on the VALORANT machine.
The park? It’s really beautiful right now, and super quiet.
You don’t like… Café Cuties… do you?

230.dialogue: Got it! In that case…

240a_10.speaker: speaker_taliyah
240a_10.dialogue: Ah… I don’t know if I should go to Arcade World…

240a_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
240a_20.dialogue: Too loud? Sorry, I didn’t mean to…

240a_30.speaker: speaker_taliyah
240a_30.dialogue: Oh, it’s not that. I can get a little… uh… competitive. One time, I told this kid I’d bury his family. It’s… not a great look.

240a_40.speaker: speaker_taliyah
240a_40.dialogue: What about Café Cuties? They have really cute drinks, and everyone there is super nice!

240b_10.speaker: speaker_taliyah
240b_10.dialogue: Ah… Targon Park? I know the wishing tree is in bloom, but, uh…

240b_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
240b_20.dialogue: Not a fan of wishes? Or trees?

240b_30.speaker: speaker_taliyah
240b_30.dialogue: No! I mean, yes! I mean… Um, maybe not somewhere outside… At least, not right this minute…

240b_40.speaker: speaker_taliyah
240b_40.dialogue: What about Café Cuties? They have really cute drinks, and everyone there is super nice!

240c_10.speaker: speaker_taliyah
240c_10.dialogue: Ahhh, Café Cuties… I’m one stamp away from winning a special meep teacup. It has little eyes! It looks at me!

240c_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
240c_20.dialogue: Meep… teacup? I’m not familiar… Café Cuties isn’t exactly my kind of…

240c_30.speaker: speaker_taliyah
240c_30.dialogue: It’s decided! Café Cuties it is!

240c_40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
240c_40.dialogue: Oh, man… a maid café? This is gonna be so awkward…

250.speaker: speaker_taliyah
250.dialogue: Don’t worry, it’s not that awkward. You just have to… lean into the fantasy.

260.speaker: speaker_taliyah
260.dialogue: You go on ahead, Captain! I need to get changed before I meet you.

270.speaker: speaker_kaisa
270.dialogue: Yeah, of course—

280.speaker: speaker_kaisa
280.dialogue: Wait. What do you mean, “get changed”...?

290.speaker: speaker_kaisa
290.dialogue: What is this menu? “Cutie Puffs with an Extra Special Smooch, Just For You?” “Cutie Coffee with a Dollop of Clouds?”

300.speaker: speaker_kaisa
300.dialogue: Oh, no! All the items have little characters. “Café Cuties Vladimir offers you a cup of his finest tea, but watch out for his evil nephew…”

310.speaker: speaker_kaisa
310.dialogue: The cute little tea guy has an evil nephew? Is… is there an expanded Café Cuties universe? There’s, like, fifteen characters! What is happening?!

320.speaker: speaker_kaisa
320.dialogue: Maybe I died on the walk over. Maybe I’m trapped here. I sinned in life, and Café Cuties is my purgatory.

330.speaker: speaker_taliyah
330.dialogue: Hey, be nice! I really like this place!

340.speaker: speaker_kaisa
340.dialogue: Tali! I’m so glad you’re here! This pla… ce…

350.speaker: speaker_taliyah
350.dialogue: This place what?

360.speaker: speaker_kaisa
360.dialogue: Isn’t what I… expected…

370.speaker: speaker_taliyah
370.dialogue: …Hmm? Is there something on my face?

380.speaker: speaker_taliyah
380.dialogue: Hang on… Okay, did I wipe it off? Captain? Did I get it?

10.speaker: speaker_kaisa
10.dialogue: You think you can take me down?! Not today, First Year!

20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
20.dialogue: I’m the captain for a reason, Tali! And you just let your guard down!

30.speaker: speaker_kaisa
30.dialogue: A rookie mistake, one I’ll make you pay for! Rain of Starlight!

40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
40.dialogue: Huff… huff… Gotcha.

50.speaker: speaker_kaisa
50.dialogue: Wait… Where’d she…?

60.speaker: speaker_taliyah
60.dialogue: I let my guard down, huh?! More like you’re the captain of sucking, ha!

70.speaker: speaker_kaisa
70.dialogue: This… This isn’t over!

80.speaker: speaker_taliyah
80.dialogue: I think it is! You just used all your energy for your special attack, while I’ve been dodging everything you throw at me!

90.speaker: speaker_kaisa

response.dialogue: You may defeat me here, but I’ll be back! And next time, I’ll be stronger than ever!
Enjoy your momentary victory, Star Guardian! Though I fall here, my allies will follow!
If you destroy me with the power of friendship, I will sock your freaking nose.

90.dialogue: No way...! I can still...!

100.speaker: speaker_taliyah
100.dialogue: Nice speech, Captain. Now, get ready to ride the pain train!

120.speaker: speaker_kaisa
120.dialogue: I’ll get you for thiiiiiiiis!

130.speaker: speaker_kaisa
130.dialogue: Ow, ow… Can someone help me drink my Macha-Kun Lovely Latte? Or give me my Special Smooch Just For Me? I’m in quite a lot of pain…

140.speaker: speaker_taliyah
140.dialogue: I-I’m so sorry, Captain! I truly didn’t mean to hit you so hard!

150.speaker: speaker_kaisa
150.dialogue: Ouch… ugh… It’s totally fine… Good to see you’re… ow, ow, ow… taking to the training…

160.speaker: speaker_kaisa
160.dialogue: Whew, you weren’t kidding about the pain train. That really smarts.

170.speaker: speaker_taliyah
170.dialogue: Also… I think the special smooch is just a sticker.

180.speaker: speaker_kaisa
180.dialogue: Ugh… Foiled again… Just like Viego trying to get to his uncle Vladimir’s exotic teas…

200.speaker: speaker_taliyah
200.dialogue: Soooo, I guess you like this place now, huh?

210.speaker: speaker_kaisa
210.dialogue: It grows on you.

220.speaker: speaker_kaisa
220.dialogue: Also, they did Café Cuties Viego dirty! Sealing him in a prison of crystal tea?! All he wanted was to use the power of the hibiscus fragments to free his wife from the clutches of Earl Grey!

230.speaker: speaker_kaisa
230.dialogue: Ahem. I’m not fangirling. I’m just… passionate about tea. Let’s change the subject.

240.speaker: speaker_kaisa
240.dialogue: What happens to you out in the field, Tali? At school, you avoid almost everyone, and you’re super polite… Here, you’re, well… It looks like you work on a crabbing ship.

250.speaker: speaker_taliyah
250.dialogue: Haha… Yeah, I guess it’s a little confusing.

260.speaker: speaker_taliyah
260.dialogue: Truth be told… It's the school uniforms.

270.speaker: speaker_kaisa
270.dialogue: Wait… the ones we have to wear? Like, with the skirts and the blazers? The one I’m wearing right now?

280.speaker: speaker_taliyah
280.dialogue: Yeah, those ones.

290.speaker: speaker_taliyah
290.dialogue: They’re not really… hm… my style, I guess. So I don’t really like being seen in them. Anywhere.

300.speaker: speaker_kaisa
300.dialogue: Of course! That’s why you get changed before we hang out!

310.speaker: speaker_taliyah
310.dialogue: Right, exactly! I dunno. I don’t like the way those uniforms look on me. They aren’t very… pretty. O-on me! You look fine!

320.speaker: speaker_taliyah
320.dialogue: Now that I’m in high school, I’ve been trying to figure out my own sense of style… but…

330.speaker: speaker_kaisa
330.dialogue: We’re always training.

340.speaker: speaker_taliyah
340.dialogue: Yeah… Sorry, Captain. I know how much you like training… and being a Star Guardian…

350.speaker: speaker_taliyah
350.dialogue: I like it, too! But… hmm… after the invasion, I spent a lot of time helping my family rebuild. We live by the shops, and a lot of the buildings were badly damaged in the attack.

360.speaker: speaker_taliyah
360.dialogue: I was going through a lot back then… N-not that everyone else wasn’t! But I felt like I had to put my problems on hold.

370.speaker: speaker_taliyah
370.dialogue: Then I met you and Akali, I took the oath, and we all started training… Then school started up again… It all happened so fast…

380.speaker: speaker_taliyah
380.dialogue: Until I can figure out the way I want to dress, I’d rather wear this big hoodie. Then I can make my, you know, fashion debut… without anyone telling me how I should dress.

400.speaker: speaker_kaisa
400.dialogue: Huh… a fashion problem. You’re so confident as a Star Guardian… I never would have guessed.

410.speaker: speaker_taliyah
410.dialogue: Like I said, the Star Guardian outfit makes me feel like the person I want to be! If I can find some clothes like that… Well, maybe without the magical space powers…

420.speaker: speaker_taliyah
420.dialogue: I’m sure I could throw this ratty old hoodie away for good!

430.speaker: speaker_taliyah
430.dialogue: Uh… and maybe be more confident… at school. A-and other places. Here. The park. Etcetera.

450.speaker: speaker_kaisa
450.dialogue: Well, as your captain, I’d love to help! Only if you’ll let me, of course.

460.speaker: speaker_taliyah
460.dialogue: You’re more than my captain, Cap… uh, Kai’Sa. We’re friends! I-I think!

470.speaker: speaker_taliyah
470.dialogue: Though, uh… you’re not exactly the most… um…

480.speaker: speaker_taliyah
480.dialogue: Fashionable? Person?

490.speaker: speaker_taliyah

response.dialogue: I do wear this uniform a lot…
There’s nothing wrong with student-body-president/fit-girlboss casual, Tali.
I have just become fully evil. I am now your archnemesis.

490.dialogue: Please, don’t be mad!

500a_10.speaker: speaker_taliyah
500a_10.dialogue: A-and there’s nothing wrong with that, Captain!

500a_20.speaker: speaker_taliyah
500a_20.dialogue: But, you know, it’s not for me.

500b_10.speaker: speaker_taliyah
500b_10.dialogue: I’ve been reading a lot of fashion magazines… and I don’t think that’s a thing.

500c_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
500c_20.dialogue: I’m going to build a giant, evil castle. With spikes. It’ll be awesome, and you can’t hang out in it.

510.speaker: speaker_kaisa
510.dialogue: Hmm. You know who’s really on top of fashion trends? Akali.

520.speaker: speaker_taliyah
520.dialogue: Really?!

530.speaker: speaker_taliyah
530.dialogue: Oh… but are you two alright? You both seem… strained?

540.speaker: speaker_kaisa
540.dialogue: Ugh... I don’t know. I think we’re okay? It’s… complicated.

550.speaker: speaker_kaisa
550.dialogue: Regardless! She really likes you, so she’ll totally help update your look!

560.speaker: speaker_taliyah
560.dialogue: Really?! Oh, Captain, that’s amazing! Thank you!

570.speaker: speaker_kaisa
570.dialogue: Of course, Tali! You’re my—

580.speaker: speaker_kaisa
580.dialogue: Ow, ow, ow, my back. My sides. My legs. My head. Ow, ow, ow, ow, ow…

590.speaker: speaker_taliyah
590.dialogue: Argh! I’m really, really sorry! I never should have made you ride the pain train!

600.speaker: speaker_kaisa
600.dialogue: Café Cuties Bard… take me away…

10.speaker: speaker_taliyah
10.dialogue: Uh… I dunno about this one…

20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
20.dialogue: I think it looks nice.

30.speaker: speaker_akali
30.dialogue: You’re not looking with a critical eye. You want to accentuate the hips and waistline while drawing the eye across the midsection.

40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
40.dialogue: I don’t know what that means.

50.speaker: speaker_akali
50.dialogue: Kai, I love you. You know I do. Now get out of this dressing room right now before I stab you.

60.speaker: speaker_kaisa
60.dialogue: Ugh! Fine!

70.speaker: speaker_aru
70.dialogue: [Baaaah.]

80.speaker: speaker_kaisa
80.dialogue: You, too, Aru?

90.speaker: speaker_aru
90.dialogue: [Behhh.]

100.speaker: speaker_kaisa
100.dialogue: Well, that’s your fault. Just because you can pull off a bucket hat, doesn’t mean everyone can!

120.speaker: speaker_kaisa
120.dialogue: And what’s so bad about jeggings?! They’re for work and for play!

130.speaker: speaker_aru
130.dialogue: [Baaaabaaah.]

140.speaker: speaker_kaisa
140.dialogue: Whatever. Stupid alpaca. Telling me what to do. You don’t even have hands.

150.speaker: speaker_akali
150.dialogue: Welp. No dice.

160.speaker: speaker_taliyah
160.dialogue: Sorry, everyone! I don’t mean to be a bother!

170.speaker: speaker_aru
170.dialogue: [Beeeehhh.]

180.speaker: speaker_akali
180.dialogue: Thank you, Aru! That’s a very good point!

190.speaker: speaker_akali
190.dialogue: We may not know what works, but we did find out what doesn’t work. That means we’re getting close.

200.speaker: speaker_taliyah
200.dialogue: Really?!

210.speaker: speaker_kaisa
210.dialogue: Yeah, wait, really?

220.speaker: speaker_akali
220.dialogue: Kai, I wouldn’t expect you to know this because your personal fashion is whatever the rules say is mandatory…

230.speaker: speaker_kaisa
230.dialogue: Hmph. At least it’s functional.

240.speaker: speaker_akali

response.dialogue: The mathematics of magical artillery is not boring!
Let’s see how you like it when the enemy switches to mixed-infantry tactics.
Better hope we never fight alternate versions of ourselves sent by an evil corporation.

240.dialogue: But Taliyah requires a deft, and fashionable, hand. Process of elimination is still a process. I’m pretty sure you told me that in a very boring speech about something.

250.speaker: speaker_akali
250.dialogue: BOO! NOT FUN!

260.speaker: speaker_akali
260.dialogue: And I only say that because I love you.

270.speaker: speaker_kaisa
270.dialogue: Ugh, fine. I’ll give you a pass.

280.speaker: speaker_akali
280.dialogue: Thatta girl. Now… Taliyah.

300.speaker: speaker_akali
300.dialogue: Hmm… I have some ideas. Stick here with Kai while I grab some stuff from different stores.

310.speaker: speaker_kaisa
310.dialogue: You’re not gonna shoplift, are you?!

320.speaker: speaker_akali
320.dialogue: Oh, what’s that? I need Aru’s help for an undisclosed reason? Come on, little buddy. Let’s make some magic happen.

330.speaker: speaker_aru
330.dialogue: [Beehhhh.]

340.speaker: speaker_kaisa
340.dialogue: Akali! Don’t steal!

350.speaker: speaker_kaisa
350.dialogue: Ugh… My dad’s gonna kill me…

360.speaker: speaker_taliyah
360.dialogue: Heh heh. You two are funny.

370.speaker: speaker_kaisa
370.dialogue: …We are. We’re pretty funny.

380.speaker: speaker_taliyah
380.dialogue: I hope this works… I would love to find something I can wear that isn’t, you know, gonna blow our cover and reveal our secret identities to the world.

400.speaker: speaker_kaisa
400.dialogue: Don’t worry about that right now. Akali has… unconventional methods… but I bet she’ll know what to do.

410.speaker: speaker_taliyah
410.dialogue: I just wanna figure out my own look. It feels so frustrating… This should have been really easy!

420.speaker: speaker_taliyah
420.dialogue: Every other girl in school did it! I see you all walking around on the weekends… You all look amazing, while I’m balled up in this big, dumb hoodie.

430.speaker: speaker_kaisa
430.dialogue: Dumb? Why’s the hoodie dumb? I thought it was part of the mystique of figuring out your, you know… big fashion debut.

450.speaker: speaker_taliyah
450.dialogue: It’s also one of the only things we saved from our old house.

460.speaker: speaker_kaisa
460.dialogue: Oh, Tali… I’m sorry…

470.speaker: speaker_taliyah
470.dialogue: N-no, no! It’s not that bad! Everybody came together in our neighborhood and built it all back a hundred times better!

480.speaker: speaker_taliyah
480.dialogue: It just feels like… this hoodie is holding me back in that time...

490.speaker: speaker_taliyah
490.dialogue: Like… I can’t move on. I know, it sounds really dumb. But that’s the way I feel.

500.speaker: speaker_taliyah

response.dialogue: I lost someone close, once.
The night of the invasion. I keep seeing it in my dreams.
How could they do that to Viego?! Of all the Café Cuties, why him?!

500.dialogue: Have you ever felt like you can’t move on, Captain?

510a_10.speaker: speaker_kaisa
510a_10.dialogue: My mom passing was pretty tough. I still think about it sometimes.

510a_30.speaker: speaker_kaisa
510a_30.dialogue: It’s alright. It happened a long time ago. I was really young.

510a_40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
510a_40.dialogue: Part of it… never goes away. You learn to cope.

510b_10.speaker: speaker_taliyah
510b_10.dialogue: Seems like that night hit everybody pretty hard.

510b_20.speaker: speaker_kaisa
510b_20.dialogue: I was there, Tali. At the epicenter… right in the middle of the battle.

510b_40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
510b_40.dialogue: It feels like I’m still there sometimes. I hope, one day, that changes.

510c_10.speaker: speaker_kaisa
510c_10.dialogue: It’s not fair! He just wants to be with his wife!

510c_20.speaker: speaker_taliyah
510c_20.dialogue: M-maybe you’ve been getting too into the Café Cuties canon…

510c_30.speaker: speaker_kaisa
510c_30.dialogue: It doesn’t make any sense! If Bard has the cosmic power of brewing the perfect cup of tea, why can’t Vladimir just give Viego the magical hibiscus fragments?!

510c_40.speaker: speaker_kaisa
510c_40.dialogue: Taliyah, you have made me this way, and that is why we are enemies. I cherish your friendship. We are enemies.

520.speaker: speaker_taliyah
520.dialogue: S-seems like we both have some ghosts.

530.speaker: speaker_kaisa
530.dialogue: Yeah, maybe.

540.speaker: speaker_kaisa
540.dialogue: But we’ll figure it out together.

550.speaker: speaker_taliyah
550.dialogue: Yeah!

560.speaker: speaker_akali
560.dialogue: RUN!

570.speaker: speaker_akali
570.dialogue: Hello! We need to go right now! I may have gone overboard!

580.speaker: speaker_security
580.dialogue: Hey! Someone stop that girl and her weird, tall dog!

590.speaker: speaker_kaisa
590.dialogue: We can talk about this later! Book it!

610.speaker: speaker_taliyah
610.dialogue: Well? What do you bad dudes think?

620.speaker: speaker_taliyah
620.dialogue: I think I look hot. But approachable. Also, I could kick a monster off the top of a skyscraper. Star kick! Chu chu!

630.speaker: speaker_akali
630.dialogue: There she is. That’s the Taliyah I know.

640.speaker: speaker_kaisa
640.dialogue: Glad you found your look, Tali. Wanna wear it out? Maybe kick a villain off a skyscraper?

650.speaker: speaker_taliyah
650.dialogue: Soon, all will be revealed! But not yet. I wanna save it for the exact right moment.

660.speaker: speaker_taliyah
660.dialogue: Alright, hoodie, looks like you and I are gonna do one last big score before retirement. Yee-haw!

670.speaker: speaker_taliyah
670.dialogue: Oh, wow. The tag says these leggings are… oh, wow.

680.speaker: speaker_kaisa
680.dialogue: Kali, how much did these clothes cost?

690.speaker: speaker_akali
690.dialogue: They were free. Shut up.

700.speaker: speaker_kaisa
700.dialogue: Those are crazy-expensive designer brands. What did you do?!

710.speaker: speaker_akali
710.dialogue: I did what had to be done, O Great and Mighty Captain.

720.speaker: speaker_akali
720.dialogue: Also, I may be banned from the bottom floor of the mall until their security team retires. No big deal.

730.speaker: speaker_kaisa
730.dialogue: We’ll talk about this later.

740.speaker: speaker_taliyah
740.dialogue: Aaaaand I’m back. What were you two talking about? Doing crimes?

750.speaker: speaker_kaisa
750.dialogue: Tali! You’re in your academy outfit?!

760.speaker: speaker_akali
760.dialogue: I thought you hated that thing?!

770.speaker: speaker_taliyah
770.dialogue: Yeah, I did. But after seeing myself in my awesome new outfit…

780.speaker: speaker_taliyah
780.dialogue: ...I realized maybe it’s not the clothes holding me back. It’s just me. But now… I feel really good.

790.speaker: speaker_taliyah
790.dialogue: I know I can look cute and kick butt. I wasn’t so sure before… but even having one look set aside really makes a difference.

800.speaker: speaker_taliyah
800.dialogue: Thanks, to both of you. I really mean it.

810.speaker: speaker_taliyah
810.dialogue: I still hate these stupid outfits, though. When we graduate, let's burn them.

820.speaker: speaker_akali
820.dialogue: New best friend. Kai’Sa, you’re demoted.

830.speaker: speaker_kaisa
830.dialogue: Taliyah… Here's your gun and badge. Respect the code of the best friend, and please promise not to commit any more mall crimes.

840.speaker: speaker_taliyah
840.dialogue: I will literally only do mall crimes.
